story:
Hello! ♥

Whoa. The first thing you may think is 'Wtf, JenNyan needs 1000$!? FOR WHAT!?
Well. Did you know: I always wanted to be a photographer. I wanted to make an education as photographer, but everyone told me "You won't earn much money, trust us, you won't make it through the life without money." So I was like "Mmm.. Okay.. Maybe I can make it as a hobby~ one day". This was when I was 15. Now I'm 20 years old (on December I'm 21!) and I still didn't move forward in this section. Sure; I'm a cosplayer and hobbymodel, I absolutely love to stand infront of the camera, especially when my friends are photographing me! But I'm missing something.
It's always nice to see wonderful pictures of me - but I want to learn it, too.

  • I want to photograph models, cosplayers, my family, places where I've never been before.
  • I want to make many other people smile, while showing them the pictures I've done.
  • YouTube was always one of my biggest dreams too, I even tried it.. Without success. I knew that I couldn't make it with my mobile-phone-camera, hah.

What, why?

I know, 1000$ is a lot of money. But I live in Germany, so Dollar is transforming to Euros (€) in Europe - it's like 120$ lesser. + the fee for PayPal & indiegogo fee is also included.

  • Camera, softbox, lens, tripod - this is what I'll buy with this money.
  • You got the chance to skype with me!
  • Personal fansigns & videos!

It is & always was my dream.

To make people smile. To make them happy. I'm doing everything to make them feel better. I know a lot of people are dealing with problems, etc. - so do I. And I know how a single video, photo, or just a reply from an important human can mean. You're telling it so often: "Thanks for replying to me, it really means a lot." "You're making my day with your picture" "Thanks for making me laugh."

  • I want to improve my english speaking, so I can reach the whole world ♥
  • Tutorials, entertainment, behind-the-scenes, smalltalk stuff, everything!
  • I'll do everything to entertain you.
  • Better photos & videos for better product reviews!

It's a lot of money..

I know it's a lot of money - I'm willing to do this for me AND you! I'm only a student, I don't earn anything. I'm sharing everything on my facebook-page, hoping you like what I do. Of course I like what I do, it makes a lot of fun. I want to improve! I want to think about new ideas and realize them!

    If you're not able to donate

    Don't worry. Maybe you can share this campaign or just keep supporting me with your courage! :)


      Thank you very much for reading and spending your time here. Thank you for donating, and thank you for supporting!

      JenNyan. ♥

story:
We are Third Year Commercial Photography students at the University of Derby, and we're trying to raise £5k for our exhibition in London in June this year. So far to help raise the money we have done cake sales, a thrift shop, a halloween and christmas party and most recently, a 12 hour sponsored spin dressed up as Santa. We have plenty more ideas for this new year, including a boat party, a print auction, where we have been lucky enough to get lecturers and past successful students to donate prints, and of course, there will be more cake sales! But all of this effort will only help us reach a fraction of our goal. We're asking for your donations to help us finish the final milestone of £500 and help us achieve what we've put blood, sweat and tears into over the past three years, to get where we are today. 


The money we will raise is going to go towards a number of different things related to the exhibition. Majority of the money raised is going to pay for the venue where the exhibition will be held on Brick Lane in London. This area in London is well known for its photography exhibitions, and will be a huge stepping stone into our future careers. For many of us, it is the first time we have exhibited our work to the public, therefore that in itself is a massive achievement. As well as the venue, some money will be needed to advertise the event. This will be a chance for us to invite potential employers, as well as showing our family and friends what we have accomplished. Hopefully inviting potential employers we will be able to show our talent and professionalism, which hopefully will get our names recognised in what is a tough industry to break. 


By donating,  you are helping young creative talent break into the Commercial Photography industry. Amongst us may be the next Rankin or Annie Leibovitz.We thank each and everyone of you that have showed your support already and we appreciate your help to raise our goal.


Don't forget to share this page to your friends and family and get them to help us with our final journey to mark our time at the University of Derby. Thanks again!

story:
Purpose, Cause, Background

Hello investors, let me start by introducing myself. My name is Brian and I am an avid photographer trying to make my impact on the world. I have been taking photos my entire life and it has always been a strong passion of mine. While attending photography classes at Santa Monica College I realized my potential to be a great photographer. I switched from film to photo-journalism and I have been on my path to professional photography ever since. 

I am a true artist at heart. I also draw, tattoo, play 8 instruments, and I am an avid researcher of history and science. I love learning new things, every day I learn something new.

Over the last several years I have found myself in the corporate world of photography and graphics. I have done everything from weddings, to family portraits, to catalogs and print advertisement. In January 2013 I decided to resign from my management position at my full-time job to pursue photography. It was a blessing but a struggle at the same time. 

Currently I am working as a freelance photographer trying to make a dent on the photography market in my area. I am also in the progress of writing a photography book that should be finished by the end of 2013. I want to share my images with the world and share my knowledge with other photographers. Photography and visual media is a big part of our everyday lives; I want to be a part of that and make a difference. Photo-journalism is very important to me.  

Please help fund me to a National Geographic workshop so I can keep learning and spreading the joy and happiness of photography. I will use this workshop to sharpen my skills and to produce content for my book and portfolio. Understand this is what I want to do for the rest of my life. Taking pictures and capturing one of a kind moments is what I live and breathe for. 

What We Need!

There are several National Geographic workshops that will be held within the next 2-3 months. My goal is to attend one of these workshops to learn from a real National Geographic photographer. While doing so I plan and obtaining more content for my book and website. I need to have an edge in the photography market and the knowledge and content I would receive from the workshop will be greatly beneficial for me.

FYI. I have the gear and equipment to accomplish all my tasks. I have the knowledge and drive to get what I want done. I just need the funds at this point.

The workshops include accommodations and classes with a professional National Geographic photographer. They will take the students to various locations and teach us on site in the field. 

The cheapest workshop is also the closest to me. The workshop will start on Oct. 3rd 2013 and will be in San Francisco, California. The workshop total cost will be $2,020. I will also need to drive (several hours) or fly to San Francisco as airfare and transport is not included in the price of the workshop. I will also have to pay for my own food. $3,000 would allow me to take this workshop.

Another potential workshop is in Washington D.C. I have never been there and I would love to attend this workshop in our nations Capital. The date for this workshop is Oct. 24th 2013 and costs $1,875. I would have to fly or drive which will cost at least a few hundred dollars. I am not opposed to driving because I will be able to take photos across the United States while driving to Washington D.C. An estimated $3,000-$4,000 would be needed to fund me to this workshop.

The Yellowstone winter workshop sounds like a great chance to be in the snow and take photos. I like the challenge and would help give me experience in outdoor snow photography. Photography in the snow is something that takes a lot of skill and knowledge to perfect. This workshop starts on Dec. 22nd 2013 and I would miss Christmas with the family but it would be well worth the experience. The cost of this workshop is $3,495 and I would drive to Yellowstone to take advantage of the scenic wilderness. With transportation and food $4,000-$5,000 total would help make this workshop a reality.

There are also international destinations for National Geographic workshops. The Galapagos Islands have long since been known for its ecosystem and beauty. This trip is between $4,990-$8,660. This does not include airfare to Miami where they will depart to the Galapagos, another $1,000 in airfare to South America. It is a ten day workshop on the islands and $7,000 minimum would help fund me to this workshop. 

For something a bit further, on November 12th 2013 there is a New Zealand workshop. Total cost for the workshop is $6,895. Not including airfare and food. I would need at least $8,000 for this trip. If this campaign exceeds 100% I will go for this workshop. 

What You Get!

This is the most important part. What you will get for your contribution. 

I will be offering limited edition signed prints in various sizes. All prints will be done by a local professional printer. All prints will retain its beauty for years to come. Even if I don't reach my goal I will send you a beautiful print for your support. I will include a personal letter with each print. Photo choices from gallery will include past photos and photos from the workshop. I will provide a link to the gallery. 

For the high rollers I will be offering hand sculpted flowers in three sizes. All sculptures are original pieces of art by a local painter and sculptor. I am always for supporting local artists and if I can share their gift and mine, why not?!  

If you want I can sweeten the deal by giving you a photoshoot. Whether you need head-shots, or if you have a business and you need professional product photos. I will include a certain amount of photos I will give you, fully edited, ready for print. Products can be brought to me or mailed. 

GALLERY WILL BE AVAILABLE AFTER THE WORKSHOP! PLEASE STAY TUNED.

Like I said before, even if I don't reach my goal I want everyone to receive something in memory of their charity. I created many options for myself if I don't reach my goal. The San Fran workshop would be possible even if I only reach half of my goal. If I do not raise enough for any of the workshops I will use the money towards a local photography program that costs under several hundred dollars. Remaining money will be used towards my "travel California photographic journey" collection. I am born and raised in California and in my opinion is a beautiful state with a lot to offer. Either way the funds to help push my photography career. 

The main thing is to build my content for my book and website. A photography book on techniques and tips etc. This book will be finished by the end of the year. 

The Deep Impact

I love photo-journalism and it is what I want to do for the rest of my life. Whether its portraying art, nature, society etc. I want to be able to tell a story with that photograph. I want you to be part of it and know that when you see that photograph you had a part in it. Know that when I am taking each photo I will be thinking of every one of you who helped me get my first push onto this journey. This is only the first step to something can be extraordinary. Help me be that individual who gets the point across and the job done correctly. My mind is constantly thinking of photography and how I can be the best photographer possible. I am very good at what I do and with the knowledge I have gained over the years and your support we cannot fail. 

No Problem, support in other ways too

Whether you donate or not you can still support me! If you agree with me on my mission than maybe you have some friends who will agree also. Share, share and share again. Its FREE!!!

story:
print oculus: mobile device photography

  • sample pages under 'Gallery'

In these days of countless photographs being taken and shared with ease and for such a wide and varied audience Oculus Arts would like to discover the photographic artist in us all.

This past winter Oculus Arts put out a call for submissions to all mobile device photographers to join in our first publication –

print oculus: mobile device photography 

Casting the news as wide as we could we invited everyone with a mobile device to offer one of their photography files to be put into print. To accompany their images we asked for peoples’ consideration about the topic Enlightenment: Past, Present or Future.

Oculus Arts stopped accepting submissions late March and with the photographs from folks from different places and of varying ages we have created a 60 page photography book of mobile device photography.

An element of this book is the juried exhibition of twelve outstanding images submitted. These photographs, chosen by two professional photographic artists will become Giclee prints and be on show at QSQ Gallery, Toronto (845 College Street) throughout May 2013, in concurrence with the Photography Festival CONTACT. Also within this book there is an essay that offers thoughtful debate about mobile phone image capture.

A comment on photography in our times print oculus: mobile device photography is about to go into print. The number of copies in the first edition will be determined by the amount of funds we can raise. This is where crowd sourcing with indiegogo can help. With your contribution we can print books, reach more people and bring awareness to Oculus Arts as a link to discover stunning and clever artwork and with this first publication suggest making prints of your photographs that so often remain as pixels.

your contribution:

A person making a minimum contribution of $250 CAD will receive a copy of the book signed and dated by the Oculus team and a fine art print of their choice from the 12 images in the exhibition.

Interest in distribution for the book has already been expressed from boutiques and galleries in Halifax and Toronto, Canada and London and Glasgow, UK.

In recent experience we have discovered the use of mobile device photography in fields of expertise previously unchartered by such a tool for image capture. For example –press photographer Lewis Whyld in his latest exhibition ‘London Riots Revisited’ at the Strand Gallery, London (February 2013) comments, “The scenes of looting, chaos and violence were shocking and had to be recorded, even if it meant I shot many of my pictures from a mobile phone using the beam of police helicopter searchlights.”

This year among the chosen submissions to the Taylor Wessing Photographic Portrait Prize at the National Portrait Gallery of London an IPhone captured photograph was commended and part of the exhibition.

Such acknowledgement lends proof to the timely and exciting journey we are embarking on as we take our place within current discussion in the history of photography.

This being Oculus Arts’ first publication we are at the starting block to developing a successful track record. Nevertheless, it is important to note that within this, our first year of existence, Oculus Arts has exhibited three photographic artists in Toronto and have had sales from every show.

Oculus Arts was created by Becky Parsons in March 2012. We are a growing team, now of four, applying our skills and experience to the representation and promotion in Canada of the photographic arts.

The Oculus Arts team:

Becky Parsons –a photographic artist and cinematographer based in Toronto, born and studied in London, England. Now after 15 years experience within the photographic arts is building Oculus Arts, an art enabler for artist representation and sales. There is a portfolio of her work on the Oculus website: http://www.oculusarts.com/bio_becky.html and a sampling of her cinematography on her personal website: http://beckyparsons.com/reel1/index.html. Currently she is making a documentary film about the late photographer Margaret Watkins.

Ernesto at QSQ Giclee Boutique –A master archival printer in Toronto of Giclee and supporter of Oculus Arts, he has given us his gallery walls for our bi-monthly exhibitions.  http://www.qsqinc.com

Mark McNeilly –Oculus Arts web and graphic designer. Mark creates all our posters and cards and designs everything Oculus. He currently works in multimedia and digital design at an advertising agency.

David Strutt  -A career graphic artist and project manager who works within the promotional marketing industry, he works in support of the Oculus Team offering insight into marketing and promotion.

‘Like’ us on Facebook at http://Facebook.com/OculusArts and follow us on twitter at http://twitter.com/OculusArts. Visit regularly our website: www.OculusArts.com to keep up with our artists and photographic ventures.

story:
PetNow has gone viral among Pet LOVERS!

 

 

Know your dog better by understanding their perspective

See what your dog is doing at home with a unique dog’s perspective through your phone anytime, anywhere. Record the funniest moments of their day and share it on social media. Understand your dog better by seeing the world through their perspective. You will feel closer to your pet than ever before. Share their adventures on Youtube or Instagram and make them a star! 

 

 

Monitor your furry loved one through a variety of perspectives

Keeping track of one’s pet can be difficult with energetic dogs. In a moment they can be out of sight and out of voice range. Having a way to monitor them is essential. We provide a 1080P HD live monitoring system that you control from your smartphone. Switch from 1st POV to 3rd POV by simply taking the camera off and placing it on the base to monitor a large area. 

 

 

Capture the funniest moments

Using the PetNow app, you can instantly capture pictures and videos of your pup that can be saved directly to your smart devices or TF card on board. Whether you want to capture a cute moment or record evidence of some naughty puppy behaviors - you’ll never miss an important event.

 

 

Create a superstar with PetNow, your dog can be famous

Your dog can be a superstar by going viral on social media. There are so many hilarious and funny moments of your dog’s life that you can capture and share with your friends and family. PetNow supports real-time social media sharing. 

 

 

Communicate and pet them even if you have to work overtime

Built-in night vision makes seeing in the dark possible. Emergencies like sudden power outages won’t affect your ability to ensure your dog’s safety at night because PetNow has an on-board battery.

 

 

Communicate with your dog anytime anywhere

Convenient 2-way audio lets you easily communicate with your dog and hear what is going on around them. With PetNow, you are never far away.   

 

 

Stress-free and comfortable camera harness

The secure fit PetNow camera harness is made of a material with soft padding underneath and breathable lightweight mesh lining for a comfortable fit for your dog. The customized mount holds the camera in place and won’t slip even on active dogs. It’s easy to put on and take off with fast-release buckles. Select an appropriate size for your furry loved ones and adjust the strap to get a perfect fit.

 

 

Buy one get three styles!

Replaceable camera ears come with three cute styles to fit your dog’s personality and look: little demon, hamster or bear. Easily change by swapping out camera ears. 

 

 

 

 

Our story started years ago, when had my first Shiba dog. He was great, but also very energetic and a bit naughty! I always wondered what his day had been like while I was away. So I decided to buy him a pet camera as a birthday gift. Unfortunately, pet cameras at that time didn’t work too well and gave disappointing results. So I decided to create a better one, which would let me see through his perspective and communicate with my dog directly from my smartphone.

The results were incredible and I finally learned about the unique way that my pet sees and interacts with the world. Now, I can share this special camera with the world and help to bring pets and their owners closer together.

story:
THE PROJECT:

I began this project in 2007 while shooting live music commissions for different publications. I have attended and have documented around 3000 concerts ranging from hip hop and electronica to heavy metal, punk rock, pop and everything in between. The project grew organically as a natural offshoot to event photography and I ultimately became fascinated by the sea of die hard fans packed tightly against each other in the front row like sardines. Given my proximity to the bands and performers, I naturally turned my camera on their fans' ball of energy and the youth culture music experience that revolves around concerts. 

Anthrax

WE WERE THERE is a hardcover book dedicated to concert fandom, shot over a decade in Austin, Texas  2007-2017.  This project explores the symbiotic relationship between rock concert fans, the bands, and myself, the photographer at music festivals. It is also a self-portrait of a music fan, musician, and photographer, who has been on both sides of the stage, barrier, and photo pit. Without the band there are no fans; without the fans, there is no band. One just cannot exist without the other!

I've done my fair share of cramming down the front, playing onstage and now, after 10 years I'm ready to make a book for the fans.

FUN

“Sandy Carson's We Were There book is a unique and wonderful take on the live concert experience. These photographs of people watching musicians perform, tell their own story in a way that a collection of images of bands never could.”- Stuart Braithwaite, MOGWAI.

Touche Amore

I have exhibited WE WERE THERE several times over the last couple of years, including at Houston Center for Photography, Austin City Hall and at Lawndale Arts Center  during FOTOFEST 2016, which sparked interest with the prestigious art publisher, Daylight Books to publish the project as a book.  It has always been my dream to put this out as a coffee table hardback and  I thought, why not include a 7-inch record with band's who's fans are also featured within the pages of the book? 

Your kind donations towards WE WERE THERE will directly involve you in the production of the hardbound book and vinyl record, making you a part of the Austin music history, keeping physical media alive.

Odd Future

THE BOOK:

Physical media has a very special place in my heart as well as my book shelf and record collection. Print and vinyl serve as a totally different live experience to the digital platform. WE WERE THERE offers a look into the atmosphere and confined spaces that fans occupy at concerts, crammed down the front row, you can almost smell the sweat and I'm glad this is not a scratch and sniff book!

With your generous help, a hardback edition of WE WERE THERE will be published by the well respected Daylight Books in the fall of 2017, with a target print run of 1000 books and vinyl, 250 of which will be signed and exclusive only to Indiegogo back​ers.

​

An artist dummy of the monograph and vinyl.  I am working closely with the Daylight team to ensure this comes as close to the concert experience as it can within the pages of a book. We are also working on a photo pass wristband that will wrap around the book 

Projected book specs:

  • 96 pages
  • 50 color photographs
  • 160gsm MAGNO MATT paper or similar
  • 7-inch flexi disk insert
  • Photo pit wristband book wrap
  • Ephemera
  • Book foreword by Alyssa Coppelman
  • Essays by Dr Katherine Parhar and Sandy Carson.
  •  

THE VINYL:

I am also, with the help of this campaign, pressing a limited-edition collectors 7-inch flexi disk record featuring unreleased tracks by two of my favorite Austin bands, The Black Angels and The Sword. I'm really excited to have both these bands getting behind this project, and having them on the same record is the icing on the cake, erm... book.  It's gonna be a really unique split collaboration record of heavy metal/ punk and psychedelia. The records are manufactured in the Czech Republic at the last place left in the world to make these. So get yourself one of these analogue beauties before they are gone forever!

The vinyl and signed book will be available to backers at the $75 reward level and above, with a mention in the acknowledgements and a solid high five or a Glasgow Kiss next time I see you. Whichever you prefer ;)

Slayer

"I love the We Were There project. Simple, obvious even, but really well done. I like the cross section of bands covered in this book. Really great." -Mark Murrmann, Photo Editor, Mother Jones Magazine.

Against Me

THE GOAL:

The ball is already rolling on this project with Daylight Books and the only hurdle we face is raising enough funds to send the book and record to press. With your kind financial contributions, we can get this book in your hands by October 2017.

My goal is $27,800, which covers all costs related to production of the book and pressing of the record. This includes art and design, editing, proofing, distribution, music license fees, flexi disk pressing, printing and film.

I'm thrilled to be working with a world class publishing house who have consistently created contemporary art books for over a decade and excited to share the final product with your help and have it land on your coffee table.

Daylight Books predicts the book to be published and shipped in October 2017.  I will keep all backers informed during the production process due to any potential hiccups or changes in schedule via the update page.

Black Flag

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Publishing a limited edition fine art book and a vinyl record is a huge challenge and daunting task these days. Luckily we have publishers like Daylight, who get behind artists in crowdfunding their dream books, making bodies of work become reality. With Indiegogo as a fundraising platform there is no risk to invest money in this project, as no money will change hands until the fund goal is met. When it does, you will receive this awesome book and record that you helped see the light of day with the additional rewards for support. 

A giant cheers to you for supporting this project campaign by becoming a backer as well as sharing this others. Let's do this!

ABOUT THE PHOTOGRAPHER:

Your name is not on the guest list, mate! (photo; Karen Skloss)

Sandy Carson is a self-taught documentary and commercial art photographer, musician and cyclist who grew up in Scotland, and has been based in Austin, Texas, since 1998. He studied communications at University before touring the UK and Europe, playing in punk bands and making fanzines. After moving to the States in the '90s to pursue cycling, He travelled the world for 20 years as a professional BMX rider where he honed his skills a photographer. His work is an intersection of two careers that have been the recipient of numerous awards. His work has been published and exhibited nationally and internationally. Sandy's long term photography projects and documentary works are represented by INSTITUTE.

Dag Nasty

"People that skate and ride bikes are the best people to do live shots when bands are playing, 'cos they know exactly when to catch what’s going on and this book is a really great example,"   - Tim Kerr, Artist / Musician, BIG BOYS

Santigold / Slayer

ABOUT THE PUBLISHER:

 Daylight Books is a non-profit organization dedicated to publishing art and photography books. By exploring the documentary mode along with the more conceptual concerns of fine-art, Daylight’s uniquely collectible publications work to revitalize the relationship between art, photography, and the world-at-large. I have been a big fan of this publishing house forever and they have published some of my favorite monographs that sit on my bookshelf.

Big Freedia

"Art has the power to connect people of all ages and backgrounds and the experience of live music has, for some, been amongst the most influential moments of their lives. We Were There documents these moments of revelry and provides a window onto youth culture today."              

 -Daylight Books

Lionel Richie

"In his new book of photographs WE WERE THERE, Sandy Carson captures the most enthusiastic fans in the front of the crowd and puts you right in there with them. Revel in the power and intensity of OFF!, Earthless and Odd Future; the joy of Monotonix and Opeth; the Ecstacy induced ecstacy of Ghostland Observatory; swoon with your parents to Lionel Ritchie or with your children to Spencer Ludwig; reach for Peaches’ rump; turn your back and play it cool to The Jesus And Mary Chain; or do whatever the f*ck it is that Coldplay does to people. With a copy of We Were There in your hands, you don’t have to go to a show and get squished and sweaty to experience the excitement," -Mark Arm- MUDHONEY/SUB POP RECORDS

Peaches

A very special thanks to Austin Reedy for cutting the killer campaign video and to one of my favourite bands ever- The Redneck Manifesto, for the lovely tunes. Collaboration is everything!

 

PERKS:

TOUR T SHIRTS-

 

A mock up of the Michael Sieben collaborative Tour T-shirt special  with Sandy for WE WERE THERE campaign. Tour dates of 10 years of earthly stoke printed on the back with a shout out to all the local fest and clubs in the book.

ART PRINTS

I am offering limited-edition photographic prints, 24x36" and 11x17", printed by the pros over at Holland Photo Imaging.

WE WERE THERE exhibition perk prints at Lawndale Arts Center in Houston. 

10 custom SKATE DECKS 

As a labor of love perk, I am hand printing 10 LTD edition inkjet prints onto lovely polished Skateboard decks. They come hand varnished to hang on your wall as a piece of art, or ready to shred the local curbs! 

 3 SOUND ON SOUND passes

Sound On Sound Festival are also kicking in three weekend passes to their annual music fest weekend 10-12 November 2017, to chill out in McDdade, Texas, courtesy of Margin Walker Presents. If it was anything like last year, you'll be blown away by the line up rocking the Sherwood Forest.

 

 3 MENTORSHIP PERKS

3 backers will have a chance at a mentorship with me, shadowing a live music at a gig at a club here in downtown Austin, as well as getting hands on production of your photos afterwards. * Gigs subject to schedules and band permission. Travel not included but a killer night on the town sure is!

 3 FAIRDALE PERKS

Two Fairdale Coasters and one Fairdale Weekender Archer bike perks are up for grabs! These are my go-to commuter bikes and 3 lucky folks will roll away into the sunset on them! Package comes with tour t shirt and a 2 month supply of KIND snacks.

 3 HOMEY package PERKS

I have teamed up with my generous cycling sponsors and kind homeys to make three banger campaign packages from  VANS, KIND Snacks,  LEVIS , and local Program Skates  to create special reward perks for backers.

A VANS march care package including shoes, hat, shirt and sunglasses.

A slick pair of bike friendly LEVIS commuter denim jeans.

Austin's Program Skates are throwing in these three decks for with art from  Michael Sieben. 

Also 2 months of vegan powered yummy KIND Snacks. 

5 HAPPY CAMPER PERKS

Betabrand are chipping in 5 of my signature 'Storrist' camera bag / adventure backpacks and 5 pairs of their durable reflective Bike to Work Britches. Camper perk also comes with a box of KIND snacks and Flat Track coffee .

Any backers rewards that I cannot deliver personally by bicycle here in Austin, will be sent out via USPS.

 

In addition to supporting WE WERE THERE financially, there are other ways you can help support this book and record! 

  •  Please feel free SHARE the campaign through your social media accounts using the URL igg.me/at/WeWereThere . Every click and share helps the project.
  •  EMAIL your buddies and music fans and who might be interested in this book. If you know someone who might really enjoy this book or appreciate the vinyl for their collection, shoot them a quick email with a link to the campaign.
  • If you have a cool idea or item that you would like to DONATE as A PERK? Please let me know by emailing EMAIL HERE. I would love to surprise backers with a new perk midway through the campaign. 
  • Make a MATCH. If you plan to donate to the campaign, consider offering to match the donations of others. Email me if you'd like to become a MATCHING DONOR.

story:
We, The Photo People, are a group of Middle School students from a Montessori school, that are trying to fund raise enough money to reach Me to We Windsong Ranch to spend our next immersion week there. Every contribution that you make will get us one step closer to our ultimate goal of reaching Windsong, every contribution helps. 

In order for us to reach our goal we must raise $2000 for us to be able to go to Windsong. We will do this by selling you mugs, calendars, pillows, bookmarks, ,key chains, and magnets. We are also taking head shots, so bring in your family and friends to come take a picture here on the following eight Fridays. After ordering tell us the image number you want on each perk in the comments section on our page. 

Now on to what Me to We Windsong is and what we do when we are staying there. Me to We is an international social enterprise dedicated to helping and empowering children all over the world to make a difference in the world. Me to We was founded by the Canadian brothers Craig and Marc Kielburger in 2008. At the Windsong ranch we help around with chores at the ranch, we learn about kid's experiences who have to cross the border to get to school, home, or simply just living next to the border, we also do activities that help us bond with our classmates. This is why Windsong is so important to us and why your contributions are so important to us.

The only challenge that we will and had in our campaign is our ability to plan our field trips, but we get always get out of those predicaments thanks to our wonderful teachers. Because they always have a back up plan.

Remember, even if you don't want to buy one of our products, you can always make a flat donation to help our campaign. No matter what type, how small, or how big, any contribution helps.

Thank YOU,

The Photo People
story_txt:
We, The Photo People, are a group of Middle School students from a Montessori school, that are trying to fund raise enough money to reach Me to We Windsong Ranch to spend our next immersion week there. Every contribution that you make will get us one step closer to our ultimate goal of reaching Windsong, every contribution helps. 
In order for us to reach our goal we must raise $2000 for us to be able to go to Windsong. We will do this by selling you mugs, calendars, pillows, bookmarks, ,key chains, and magnets. We are also taking head shots, so bring in your family and friends to come take a picture here on the following eight Fridays. After ordering tell us the image number you want on each perk in the comments section on our page. 






Now on to what Me to We Windsong is and what we do when we are staying there. Me to We is an international social enterprise dedicated to helping and empowering children all over the world to make a difference in the world. Me to We was founded by the Canadian brothers Craig and Marc Kielburger in 2008. At the Windsong ranch we help around with chores at the ranch, we learn about kid's experiences who have to cross the border to get to school, home, or simply just living next to the border, we also do activities that help us bond with our classmates. This is why Windsong is so important to us and why your contributions are so important to us.
The only challenge that we will and had in our campaign is our ability to plan our field trips, but we get always get out of those predicaments thanks to our wonderful teachers. Because they always have a back up plan.
Remember, even if you don't want to buy one of our products, you can always make a flat donation to help our campaign. No matter what type, how small, or how big, any contribution helps.
Thank YOU,
The Photo People

story:
About me and the Project

My name is Michael Boyd and i've been practicing photography for about two years, and in that span i've been able to cover a lot of ground. I've shot product campaigns, had work on billboards, worked with agencies, actors, designers, and published a few times by magazines. During this time i've developed skills and now I want to show people what I've been working on. So much so I took the opportunity to showcase the more artistic side of my work and a new direction I want to go with photography.

The project, that is untitled at the moment, will have elements in surrealism, scanography as well as parallels to classical artists with a contemporary styling and intricate set design. Consisting of six 4ftx2ft glass panels suspended from the ceiling, the panels will be arranged around the guest to encompasses and provide a unique experience to every person viewing. 

On the panels there will be two 1ftx1ft Silver Aluminum Finish prints of my work, the prints, as stated before, will have elements of surrealism and scanography. Something to blur the lines between photography and visual (fine) art.  

 

What is needed?

Additional funds to off-set the overhead costs of the materials needed to build the actual instillation and printing. The Actual amount needed is around $510 but the extra $40 will be allocated for miscellanous costs. 

It breaks down like this:

the 4x2 glass panels are 50$ a piece, multiply that by 6 and that brings the total up to 300

the high strength invisible hanging line costs 5$ for an 8pack, that brings up up to 305

the Silver Aluminum Finish prints are 12.00 a piece multiply that by 17 and we're at 509.

the remaining 41 dollars will be for miscellaneous needs, like ties, adhesives, bits etc. 

Even if the goal isn't met, the money donated will go to the project to make do with what was raised. 

To the 5 top contributors, a large format Silver Aluminum Finish print will be fed ex'd to them for them to hang or mount in home. 

After the festival is concluded the entire instillation will be donated to an art foundation or schools art program, that will be disclosed soon.

Thank you for taking the time to read over the project. 

If there are any questions feel free to email me at Mike@thepicturehouse.us

and check out my website ThePictureHouse.us

story:
Hi! My name is Mia and I am a relatively new photographer from Staunton, VA (originally from TX), and I want to make it my goal to self publish my own book.

Originally I approached a publishing house that I wanted desperately to be a part of, only to be told initially that my images were too editorial. Later I submitted a different branch of images that I wasn't very comfortably with, they were from a time in my life where I wasn't doing so well, and the publishing house liked them. But ... I couldnt use them. They weren't who I am now. They reflected a time when I, as a person, was in shambles and I didnt want that to be how the world viewed me. There are enough depressing things to live with right now!

Publishing this book means the world to me. Its my chance to leave a visible mark on the world around me and to leave something to my children- proof that art is alive in all of us!


The funding from this campaign will go towards ordering copies of the book to be sold in local shops in hopes that someone will see it and realize it should be seen more. I dont have many perks to offer, but for helping me reach my goal, you can tell me what sort of photo you would like to see and I will try to take it for you, or add a thank you with your name in it in the book. I can even send you a personalized print or gift! 

Whether or not I reach my entire goal, all money raised will go towards printing as many copies of my book as possible!

story:
Our Story

A few years ago I produced a documentary about a forgotten community in Bangladesh. This is the so-called "bihari" or urdu-speaking community. After the devastating war in 1971, the urdu-speaking community of the newly created Bangladesh came to be seen as collaborators in the war. They were rounded up and put in internment camps for their own safety. Years went by and this community languished in over-crowded and unsanitary camps.


The documentary received the 2nd prize at the Kathmandu Film Festival, out of 39 film documentaries from south asia, and managed to raise a lot of awareness about the issue. It has played in festivals throughout the world. 


We then decided to put together an exhibition of photographs taken by camp children (passionately organised by Hannah Sholder) and outsiders on the meaning of citizenship for this desperate community. The result was the successful 2010 Ummid competition and exhibition held at the Alliance Francaise de Dhaka, Bangladesh.


My next goal is to produce a book of a selection of the 500 photographs we received. Some are by children from the camps who were given disposable cameras and some by community people and professional photographers. These photos show that despite the horrendous conditions, life goes on and there is resilience and humour and love.

The Impact

Biharis are marginalised people. They have never been included to join mainstream life. To be part of a project where their lives are depicted through photographs and text and which is then published would be a cultural milestone for this community and for Bangladesh, as it takes tentative steps to becoming an inclusive country.


What We Need & What You Get

We will be printing in Bangladesh where high quality printing is affordable. For a run of 1500 books we need £3500. We need a further £1000 for the design/layout/proofreading/colour conversion ( a sum we have raised through supporters and friends). The format will be interestingly large! Full colour on art paper.  


You get a mention in the book for only $20! You get a mention and a free book for $35!! And if you contribute $100 or $200 - you get a bundle that will leave you speechless! Check the right hand side for the lowdown. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please help spread the word by liking us on Facebook ( page coming) or sending this page around to friends.

story:
Short Summary

Raechel Alexis Gasparac was born March 17th 1983 in Montreal Canada.  The first eleven years of her life were worry free until her father's company moved to Dallas Texas, where she would learn the meaning of racism ( a previously forien concept to her), and the perils of puberty.  Along the way she made mistakes, but learned for every one of them.  Eventually she would find a selection of wonderful people she would come to cherish.  Through all this time she saught to practice photography, a hobby she shared with her father.

She earned her associates degree in Graphic Design and is currently going back to college to obtain a bachelors in Art.

Two years ago she lost her father to lung cancer, which resulted in a downward spiral of depression. Thankfully she has picked herself up and wishes to accomplish her dream of begining her own art/ photography studio.  You can help.

This campain seeks to provide funds for any and all startup costs of opening up buisness.  Raechel A. Gasparac's family has been hit hard finacially by the untimley death of her father, of which he was the primary breadwinner. With your help we can fund her startup. 

Each donation will put her one step forward to realizing her goal. No donation is too small.  Times are hard, and each of us can only do what we can.

What We Need & What You Get

What we are hoping to do with said funds:

  • Hopeful Studio Space
  • Basic Renovation of said Studio Space.
  • Purchase samples
  • Print out a stunning portfolio
  • Advertizing
  • Publication of her first Photo Book

What we can offer you:

  • Signed Prints
  • Personalized Illustrations
  • If you are in the DFW area, a FREE photosesion

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Every artist is unique, and thier perspective of the world is even more so.  If you put ten photographers in a room with a model, they would produce ten differing views in contrast to each other.

Raechel A. Gasparac has been awarded for her use of Black and White Photography on Deviantart.com, along with several publications of her artwork in various magazines.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can afford to help, and that is okay.  All we ask is to share this posting, and help will find it's way!

story:
Geek Pride Cosplay Calendar 2014

www.geek-pride.co.uk
www.cancerresearchuk.org

We at Geek Pride are passionate about small business ventures and love to support the little people, so we decided to set out on a small venture of our own. This September we are embarking on a mission to bring you a truly unique cosplay calendar, created by and featuring the Geek Pride writers and contributors, alongside guest artists who will be donating their artwork to the calendar.

We are selling these calendars to raise funds for Cancer Research UK. The reason we chose to donate all proceeds instead of keeping them to ourselves is because cancer has affected almost every single one of us, whether that be family or friends that have suffered, or even ourselves. We feel that this is a worthy cause and would love to make as many pennies for them as humanly possible.

A calendar you say?

Yes indeed! A cosplay calendar to be precise. This means that our writers and contributers will be cosplaying (a fancy way of saying "dressing up") as beloved comic book, film and gaming characters. I don't want to give away too much too soon - *spoilers* - but you can expect to see Wonder Woman in a prom dress, what more could you want?

We will release teaser pictures as the month goes by to give you a flavour of where we are going with the calendar and on the day of the photoshoot we will be filming for a behind the scenes DVD and podcast which we will release as a perk.

We have some awesome cosplayers on board, some of which can be seen below:

(Please note these are NOT the final images, the photoshoot is on the 22nd September)

 

We also have other perks too! We have gone all out in getting some amazing artists to do some artwork for the calendar which will be available as prints. They're working hard to produce unique and original artwork to fit with each month of the calendar! Check out the updates and our facebook page for more information on them but here's a small example of some of their varied work! (More info soon to come!)

Tshirts as a perk? Show me, show me!

So where do I come in?

As it stands we have covered all the costs of the costumes, the studio (with a little help from NQ Photography in Manchester), the props and scenery, the design costs and all the other little costs that keep cropping up in association with the creation of our masterpiece, but when it comes to printing costs we are a little stumped for cash.

We tried to raise sponsorship from companies to get the money together, but were faced with nothing but rejection letters left right and centre - it seemed all hope was lost until someone suggested Indiegogo.

Your donation will cover the costs of the printing, and ALL profit will be sent to Cancer Research UK.

Working off the basis that we hit our £1000 target, we have been able to keep the calendar printing costs down thanks to the wonderful people at Bamford Print, which means that if we hit our target we can raise around £750.00 for Cancer Research UK!

What difference will it make?

Please excuse me for taking this directly from the Cancer Research UK website but I think you'll find they can say it better than I ever could:

"There are more than 200 different types of cancer, each with different causes, symptoms and treatments. We’ve made some great progress over the years but there’s still so much to do.

Here are some examples of what your donation can do:

  • £10 could buy enough glass slides for a scientist to examine 300 tumour samples down a microscope.
  • £100 could equip four scientists with a lab coat and a pair of safety goggles. These help protect against harmful chemicals and prevent experiments from getting contaminated.
  • £500 could fund one cancer information nurse for four days. Our experienced cancer information nurses provide a confidential service for anyone with concerns about cancer.
  • £1,000 could cover the basic costs for ten women to take part in a clinical trial to improve survival for post-menopausal women with early-stage breast cancer."
Together we can raise this money to push forward with the fight against cancer.

What happens if you don't raise £1000?

If we don't hit our target, never fear! We will still print up the postcards/calendars that we have managed to sell and send them out to you - printing costs will be slightly higher so this will mean a lower % donation to Cancer Research UK - however thanks to Bamford Print we will still be able to donate a good amount.

But what if I can't afford to donate?

Don't worry! If you can afford to donate even a fiver, we will provide you with a postcard sized photo of all the cosplayers to say thank you.

If you can't donate anything please don't worry, but feel free to share this around with your friends and family, as you might find someone out there who can. I am reliably informed that using the Indiegogo share tools is a good way to spread the word!

Thank you for your time and we hope you can get on board.

story:
Artist's Statement

Nothing screams “ I’m rich" more than top-of-the-line designer fashion. I mean really; you did spend  good money on this artisanal clothing, so you shouldn't care what you look like. This forward-thinking along with the collaborative efforts of lead Parisian designers lead to the creation of one of the most cutting edge, avant garde fashion lines ever invented. I present The Hard Up Collection: A Reflection on the Cost of Being "Hip".

Mission

The goal of this project is to use old clothing and photography  as a medium to materialize the financial impact that over-priced clothing has on individual's wallets. Once enough photographic sets are compiled, I will publish the series in a magazine-like format. You can preview the current works of art on my web page: The Hard Up Collection

What I Need

Your monetary contribution will help cover the cost of printing materials from MagCloud, transportation, modeling expenses, and any additional lighting equipment. Of course, with every donation, there will be special perks. I'm not going to skimp; a $5 contribution will get you an e-book of the series in PDF format and so on. However, if we do not reach the goal amount, the funds will be used to purchase as many magazine copies as possible for distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

I also need models to participate!! If you can donate your time for the project, that would also be a huge help. You can use the 'Contact Me' link on my webpage here.

If you can't contribute funds or modeling time to this project, please spread the word. Direct your friends to the webpage, share on Facebook and other social media platforms, and/or get in touch with someone you know would be willing to  model for the project. Any way you can help would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Summary

I'm Walter Elliott, and I want to share something special with you.  I'm a photographer with a passion for nature and I sell my work through my small business, Images by Walter E. Elliott LLC.  There are many beautiful corners on this planet, but one in particular draws me back time and time again.  The Great Lakes region is unique, and Michigan's Upper Peninsula (the U.P.) is the crown jewel.  The first image below was photographed in May of 2014 at Eagle Harbor, just south of Copper Harbor at the tip of the peninsula.  Breathtaking, isn't it?!  Waterfalls, lighthouses, the Mackinac Bridge, and many more sights make the U.P. a treasured trip.  With your help, I'll share more of this beauty with you and offer some great merchandise in return for your generosity!

    What We Need & What You Get

    I'm raising $4,500 to purchase a new computer for editing, a new lens for my camera, and to fund travel expenses for a week.  A lofty goal but the best part of contributing - what you get in return!  At every level you receive a signed print of your choice.  The bigger the contribution, the bigger the print.  The higher levels offer t-shirts, sweatshirts, and digital rights to the images.  For $500 you get a signed 24x36 print, a t-shirt, a sweatshirt, and the use of a guaranteed minimum of 50 images!  Here are a few more examples of my work: 


    What happens if I don't reach my goal?  I'm still going!  (thanks to my wife for watching our 5 children while I'm gone!)  I'll travel for a shorter period of time, meaning less shots, and rent lenses if I must, but you'll still receive the value of your contribution. 

    The Impact

    I guarantee you will not be disappointed with what you see and get.  If you have never traveled to see Lake Superior, or the waterfalls, or the lighthouses, or Da Bridge (Mackinac), this just might get you excited enough to cross it off your bucket list!

    Risks & Challenges

    It is a lofty sum to raise and this is my first fundraising campaign.   Beyond that, I believe the challenges are minimal.  I've traveled to and explored the U.P. at least once a year since the late 1990's, but never solely to photograph.  I'm excited to embark upon this campaign with that goal in mind, and I'll shout it from the top of Marquette Mountain to get people's attention!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Don't have the money to help at this time?  I understand.  You can still help by sharing this on social media and telling your family and friends.  For that, I would be greatly appreciative!!!
story_txt:
Summary
I'm Walter Elliott, and I want to share something special with you.  I'm a photographer with a passion for nature and I sell my work through my small business, Images by Walter E. Elliott LLC.  There are many beautiful corners on this planet, but one in particular draws me back time and time again.  The Great Lakes region is unique, and Michigan's Upper Peninsula (the U.P.) is the crown jewel.  The first image below was photographed in May of 2014 at Eagle Harbor, just south of Copper Harbor at the tip of the peninsula.  Breathtaking, isn't it?!  Waterfalls, lighthouses, the Mackinac Bridge, and many more sights make the U.P. a treasured trip.  With your help, I'll share more of this beauty with you and offer some great merchandise in return for your generosity!
  What We Need & What You Get I'm raising $4,500 to purchase a new computer for editing, a new lens for my camera, and to fund travel expenses for a week.  A lofty goal but the best part of contributing - what you get in return!  At every level you receive a signed print of your choice.  The bigger the contribution, the bigger the print.  The higher levels offer t-shirts, sweatshirts, and digital rights to the images.  For $500 you get a signed 24x36 print, a t-shirt, a sweatshirt, and the use of a guaranteed minimum of 50 images!  Here are a few more examples of my work: 








What happens if I don't reach my goal?  I'm still going!  (thanks to my wife for watching our 5 children while I'm gone!)  I'll travel for a shorter period of time, meaning less shots, and rent lenses if I must, but you'll still receive the value of your contribution.     The ImpactI guarantee you will not be disappointed with what you see and get.  If you have never traveled to see Lake Superior, or the waterfalls, or the lighthouses, or Da Bridge (Mackinac), this just might get you excited enough to cross it off your bucket list!

story:
Hello there, we are I Must Be Dead and Mohawk! Photographers based out of Phoenix, Arizona. This year we'll be going to Burning Man for the first time in our lives, and we thought it would be really neato if we could document our stay for you guys in the form of a photography book and behind the scenes video! We believe if we were was sent out there with the right equipment and such, that we could capture Burning Man in a way that hasn't been done before. We plan to produce some really amazing images for you guys, and slap them all in a fine art book for all your damn coffee tables. This is a non-profit book, and will only be given the donators of this project! In additon we also plan to film the whole thing, and whatever kind of shinananigans we get ourselves into, and if you guys follow our work, you know we get into some weird ass shit. So we think it would be lots of fun for everyone to send us on this adventure, and let us produce the best flippen Burning Man Photo Book anyone has seen!

UPDATE!!!! - There has been some concern about whether Burning Man would allow this to happen or not, and just wanted to let you know we have their official go ahead and blessing yay!

Before we explain what exactly the funds are needed for, let us show you some samples of our work to get you excited about what type of stuff you can look forward to seeing in the book!

 

 

 

 

 

 

- Ok now that you are back, we'll explain to you why exactly we need the funding!

 - The main reason we are going to need funding for this book is because it will be non-profit. We aren't allowed to sell a book involved with burning man, so all the printing cost have to be upfront from donators, and donators will be the absoloute only people who get the book! 

- In addition, getting to burning man with the right equipment and set up is costly, we want to make sure we have all the right tools and materials at our exposure in order to take the type of photographs we want. This requires large vehicle rental and photo equipment rental.

 

A Sample of what the book might look like, this is a mock up I Must Be Dead book, to give you an idea of what you will get. Also a picture of postcards!

 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Try using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Blast us around on Facebook

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
BACKGROUND

My name is Joseph Hansen, and I am an 18 year old grade 12 student at the Constantia Waldorf School in Cape Town. Waldorf has an interesting curriculum and is unorthodox in today's society as students get the opportunity to understand and learn the world and their environment by seeing and doing, instead of reading what a textbook tells them. The final requirement for a student to obtain the Waldorf certificate is to undertake an individual project of his or her choosing, that challenges them unlike anything before.

This is where my story comes in. I am passionate about space and what lies beyond the boundaries of this Earth, and this project is an opportunity to explore this avenue. Of course it is nearly impossible for a student, especially from South Africa, to try and reach space with our current technology, as it is just too expensive. However, it is possible to reach the edge of space. This is done by use of meteorological weather balloons and Helium or Hydrogen. Essentially, one is able to simply attach a camera to the balloon, and let it rise to the boundaries of space while it clicks away at the beauties below. 

However it is not that simple. Housing needs to be designed and manufactured so that the instruments don't freeze. Tracking equipment needs to be used to track and predict the landing of the payload when it returns to Earth. Software needs to be built to work with the tracking systems. Cameras need to be modified to be controlled remotely. These, and many other (relatively) expensive operations need to be completed before liftoff.

Most of the designing and building operations are being done by me, however the purchasing of the equipment (cameras, weather balloons, trackers and manufacturing costs) is the one thing holding me back and keeping me from obtaining that goal. Your contribution, no matter the size, will help immensely to reach T minus 0.

FUNDING

Transparency goes a long way, so I have created a breakdown of the budget allocations so that you know exactly where the money is going:

  • Photography equipment:
    • GoPro Hero 4 Silver with Battery BacPac: R2300 ($170)
    • Canon Powershot SX500IS: R2500 ($180)
    • Canon Powershot SX620HS: R1300 ($95)
    • 16GB MicroSD card: R80 ($5)
    • 32GB MicroSd card: R110 ($8)
  • Payload housing and manufacturing:
    • Polystyrene and Sondor manufacturing: R2000 ($150)
    • Parachute manufacturing: R500 ($35)
  • General equipment:
    • Sounding balloon (Pawan 1000g) - sponsored by Intermet Africa: R1500 ($110)
    • Radiosonde tracking unit - sponsored by Intermet Africa: R2500 ($180)
  • Other Expenses:
    • Petrol: R1200 ($90)
    • Miscellaneous: R500 ($35)

Although cheaper then sending a rocket to space, it is still a stretch for a student budget. I have already found backers for the general equipment and part of the photography, however it is the cost of the remaining photography equipment and the housing manufacturing that is the most daunting.

IMPACT

High altitude photography has been around for a long time in other countries, but is very scarce in South Africa. Since it began, there have only been a handful of launches in the country, only two of which have been done from Cape Town, both of which were by companies, not individuals. Although the weather service sends up balloons every day, none of them are visually recorded from its perspective, so we never get to see what the balloon sees.

Through this project, I am trying to excite people of South Africa about space exploration, and show them that it is possible for anyone. The project is mostly aimed at students and young adults, as it could serve as inspiration for any dreams or aspirations they may have thought unattainable.

The project does not need to elaborate. In fact, it would be possible to send up cheap cameras in homemade polystyrene boxes, instead of compact cameras. However, in an attempt to start a new interest in space exploration, one needs to make people excited about it. In order to achieve this, the photos and videos taken have to be out of this world. Literally.

Your contribution could help in restarting something that excites and terrifies many: exploring the unknown.

RISKS

This kind of project is risky. Essentially, a balloon carrying thousands of Rands worth of equipment is let go and the wind carries it away, with no intervention or control possible. After the balloon bursts, a parachute deploys and is it the complete mercy of the winds. Because of this, the package could land in the sea, on a mountain, somewhere unreachable, etc. Not to mention that if it gets too cold, the cameras could freeze and shutdown before the end of the mission, rendering the entire mission useless. 

However these challenges have been foreseen and hopefully overcome. Prediction models have been made and are available to anyone online, which calculate the weight of the balloon, the ascent rate, the predicted wind speed and direction for a given time and day and will be able to predict, with decent accuracy, the vicinity where the payload will land, with all the flight data. However, this is not good enough, so a Radiosonde tracker uses GPS to determine the location and altitude of the payload every second and sends back the co-ordinates via radio waves to a portable ground station that is interpreted by software on a laptop in real time. In addition to this, I have built custom software, which integrates with Google Earth, which will read the data from the ground station, and map a 3D path inside Google Earth, as well as a predictive algorithm that, combined with the online predictive method, provides almost 100% accuracy of where the package will land, giving me enough time to drive to the location and retrieve the payload intact. 

The freezing problem has been addressed with two methods. The first is by using polystyrene housing and Sondor as a soft foam inner. This will retain the heat generated by the cameras and should be enough to keep them at operating temperature. To be extra sure, foot warmers will be placed in the box as well, just as a precaution.

Although the risks are high, they have been carefully thought out and through this have been lowered significantly.    

CAN'T DONATE? NOT A PROBLEM

I understand that some of you can't, or don't want to contribute, which is understandable. However it would be appreciated immensely if you could share this project with anyone you think may be interested. This will greatly increase the chance of liftoff and interest in edge of space exploration.

story:
This photography project was founded by Los Angeles-based photographer Dusti Cunningham and Jacob Rostovsky, a transgender activist whose life passion is working for the advancement of the community. 

One of our goals with this project is to showcase the beauty of those who have custommade and bent gender to make it their own. 

We are also working with the nonprofit organization Trans United with Family and Friends (TUFF), the mission of which is to give financial assistance toward transition costs for gender-nonconforming individuals.  All proceeds made beyond our goal will go towards this organizations mission.

We have been collecting video interviews in addition to the photographs, which we in turn hope to create a documentary. These interviews well really help to give an indepth look at the diversity our culture has in regards to gender identity and expression.

Eventually we would like to publish a book of the work and also showcase the photos with gallery shows across the country. 

Buck Angel: transgender filmmaker, motivational speaker, and advocate

 

"Dusti Cunningham is an incredible artist and photographer. His images capture the beauty and soul of our community. I love how his work not only transcends traditional gender archetypes but actually redefines what we think as 'queer' with his eloquent, singular and brilliant eye. We are lucky to have Dusti Cunningham as the visual archivist/activist/anarchist of our generation. Generations to come will know us intimately from what he's captured."

—Margaret Cho 


"The series is titled "gender bent” and will contain photos of people who have bent, blurred the lines, and custom-designed gender to better suit them—people like Buck Angel, Margaret Cho, Sonique, Mathu Andersen, and Ian Harvie. Also included are families with trans children, drag queens and drag kings, MTF, FTM, MTFTM and many others. These people are parents, uncles, aunts, brothers and sisters. Their professions range from students to porn stars to homemakers to comedians and executives. Some make a living entertaining as a gender other than their birth gender, others are mistaken for the opposite gender while some identify with neither. While some are more fluid, others have made permanent physical changes in creating their gender. The one tie that binds together everyone in the series is the ability to evolve and adapt. "

-Dusti Cunningham; Photographer and developer of the genderbent project. 

What We Need

The money raised with this campaign will fund travel to multiple major cities for photo shoots and interviews with these non-traditionally gendered individuals.
The money will cover transportation, food and printing of the photos for an exhibit. 

Accommodations in each city have already been provided; therefore no proceeds from this fundraiser go towards lodging. 

Breakdown of costs:

60% travel expenses

32% printing expenses and perk fulfillment 

8% Indiegogo fees and services

Please help us by donating what you can and check out the perks starting at $10! All donations are tax-deductible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word!

Please donate now and share this campaign with your friends.

Like us on Facebook. 

If interested in participating, please email genderbentinfo@gmail.com.

story:
What is this?

Eksod is a visual and sound art  installation. It will tell a story with printed photographs and sounds recorded on location. The script and characters have been based on interviews and research in Albania. This campaign is an ask for support to capture Eksod - scheduled to begin production in March '16.



The Artform

We are very familiar with the emotive power of cinema. As a still photographer and sound designer, I've been exploring cinematic alternatives that are equally capable of providing sensory enrichment. Eksod is the culmination of that exploration. 

A walk thru this architectural exhibit is a walk thru an immersive story which changes depending on the path and pace chosen by the viewer. While television and film sound design requires sound programs that are locked in a linear synchronous format, Eksod will tear apart the assumptions of where, when, and how we receive the auditory sensation of the story. Each region of the gallery represents a scene - each zone in the room will pair photographs with the sounds of the Albanian conflict and landscape. Part fiction, part non-fiction, the exhibit will employ a mix of art directed images and sounds, along with street photography and  authentic interviews from the streets of Albania. 


The Story

Fraught with a long history of political and social upheaval, poverty, and rampant corruption - Albania is home to Europe's highest emigration rate. Eksod (Albanian for exodus) tells a story of a movement of people that seek an escape from their unfulfilled lives. Eksod delivers this story through an experiential exhibit using live performance, sound design, and photography to depict an Albanian's struggle to emigrate to a different country at any cost. 



The Significance

Eksod is a reduction of architectural acoustics, filmmaking, sound design, and photography. I have emphasized combining these fields because they are my historical foci, and because innovation has a track record of occurring when cross-disciplinary fields merge.

Justin installing "Peacock Farm" in Brooklyn, NY 2015

To date, I've installed in cafes and art expositions. Eksod will be the first presentation of a narrative story in a purposefully designed acoustical environment as it was originally perceived to be executed. 

I moved from the United States to Albania in an attempt to realize this dream and began pre-production in January of 2016. I need your help. 


What's Needed & What You Get

This Indiegogo campaign is required to fund the production costs associated with capturing the mixed media story in Tirana, Albania. No funds are being asked for gear. This campaign is not allocated for the printing and physical construction costs of the exhibit. Grants and sponsorship have been earmarked for the post-production stage and are outside the scope of this campaign.

The production costs that your contributions will fund are as follows:

  • Rental car costs on 6 shooting days - $350
  • Food for the supporting cast and crew on 6 shoot days - $600
  • Cost for access/permission to shoot at locations (A Butcher Shop and an Albanian Home) -$200
  • Additional baggage cost to transport camera, lighting, and sound gear round trip from NYC to Albania - $350
  • Production Office for 3 months - $900
  • Production and fullfillment costs of perks - $450
  • Wardrobe designer on 3 shoot days - $450
As a thank you, artwork will be provided to contributing supporters - details provided in the "Perks" section.


Impact of your Donation

Installment of Eksod represents more than a completed artwork. I left behind my commercial sound recording business in the states that had been my means of meeting my cost of living.  Eksod is a gateway from the technical to the creative stage of my career. It's my aim to create exhibits like Eksod on behalf of organizations, other collaborating artists, and small businesses that value and need to express in sensory immersive ways. By supporting this project, you are giving me the traction I need to transform a career, you are bringing attention to a struggle facing a beautiful Balkan region, and you are acquiring artwork for your personal collection.


Challenges

Organizing this project in a foreign country comes with a range of obstacles. Yet the pre-production task of finding a local cast, crew, location, and accommodation have all been resolved as of the start of February of 2016. I've managed to escort a sound, camera, and lighting kit capable of meeting this projects needs into Albania. All the pieces are in place and I would like to begin shooting in March. The last puzzle piece to overcome is the financing that will allow production to commence. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to support, but know someone that would have interest in this project please let them know.
If you are interested in seeing Eksod installed in a city near you, and if you're familiar with an arts organization/venue that may be a good fit, send along your ideas.
