more equal distribution of the land. The Movimiento Sim Tierra/Chico Mendes
III farm is run as a cooperative.  The members gave us tours of their farms, gardens, and adobe homes.  We witnessed their sustainable techniques and partook in a delicious, homegrown organic lunch.  This land, damaged through years of use as sugarcane plantations littered with pesticides and fertilizers, has been reclaimed, improved and restored by the local farmer families as sustainable and productive land.Itamaracá is an island. There we worked in a community center for children and adults.  When we asked a school teacher what she thought about the World Cup near her city, she answered positively, yet said that the most important thing for her was peace, peace for Brazil, especially during this time of rivalry between countries.  At night, we were included in a
local music festival where the famous singer, Lia de Itamaracá, performed.Itapissuma, separated from Itamaracá by a bridge, is a fishing village close to the beach. Here we worked at an elementary school with children and they took us to meet the local fishermen.  We witnessed a religious festival called Festa de São Gonçalo, where a saint was carried from the sea by boat and paraded through the town.  The connection that this community to the sea is very strong.  In
Belo Jardim, in the community of Cohabi III, we worked with an organization called Lata Organica. Founded in 2010, children learn to play percussion instruments made out
of recycled goods and play as a troupe in other parts of Brazil. Playing local rhythms like Samba-reggae and Maracatu, they performed for us after a day of
taking photographs of their places, peoples and spaces.Fundação Terra: Samba de Coco Malhada was founded in 2010.  This group seeks to promote cultural activities and
an extended school day for 25 children and adolescents. Their project seeks to
create social inclusion through the arts. They showed us their surrounding arid
neighborhood and shared locally grown cashew fruits.In
Catimbau, we worked with the National
Park to recruit participants for the workshops. We worked at a school where we
gathered a combination of teenagers and park guides. The guides provided a day-long tour of the park.  During this tour, we donated an infrared camera and it was installed under a rocky precipice to monitor local wildlife populations.  We also visited a village of artisans who carve wooden sculptures from recycled wood.Back
in the city of Recife, we worked with the
Centro de Assistência Integral Novo Rebanho. Novo Rebanho promotes social
inclusion through education for all ages. They have a soccer team that was excited to talk
about the World Cup being in their home city.

story:
Hi, I'm Nikki...


I was born in a small, blue-collar, steel mill town in Pennsylvania. As you can imagine, I did not come from wealthy means. My mom worked various dead-end jobs (like a saint) to raise me and my brother after a divorce that left with her with little to no money. And although I was brought up accustomed to not having much, I still allowed myself to dream big. Cue photography. 

I fell in love with photography in high school when I was actually forced to take a photography elective to maintain credits. Little did I know it would impact me so much and change my entire life as I knew it. The Christmas following me taking the course, my mom bought me a Nikon point-and-shoot that I used constantly. Then as a Christmas/Graduation present when I was a senior in high school, my family surprised me with a DSLR which I also used to death (still do!) From there, I applied to some of the most renowned art schools in the country which landed me admission to Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, New York. Cue debt!

Attending Pratt was extremely difficult, but I was adamant. I packed my things and moved from Pennsyltuckey (local nickname for PA) to "the big city." I had several family members co-sign loans for me so I was able to attend. However, it wasn't so clean-cut. Toward the end of my time at Pratt, I ran out of family members to pester for help and with tuition increasing year-after-year, I was starting to doubt I'd ever finish. In my last year of school, my Mom even borrowed against her 401k in order to supply me with money for my fall semester. After asking Pratt for help time and time again, one Pratt financial aid worker was kind enough to present my case to the board to secure funds (AKA: more federal loans, not a scholarship) to finish out my senior year and graduate. (Something I was very thankful for considering years previous, the only "help" I was given by the FinAid department was telling me to look over a scholarship packet that had scholarships that ended 5 years ago and/or did not apply to me due to race, not being a single-mother, etc.)

Now that I'm out of school, like a lot of graduates, I'm insanely in debt and having a terrifically bad time finding a job in my field! My student loans consume 85%+ of my paycheck making it near impossible to purchase a vehicle, move out, or even update some pieces of equipment to better my photography.  


So here's my proposal...

I'm looking to raise a portion of my student loan debt to help alleviate the financial burden that going to school has put on not only me, but my family (who has been kind and supportive enough to help as much as they could by co-signing) and especially my Mom who has done everything in her power financially and mentally to see me go to and graduate from school. 

In return, you will receive a giant thank you from me, plus...


$10: A thank you on my website - so the entire internet can see how awesome you are (though we all know how awesome you are already!).


$50: A signed 11x14 print of your choice of the five I have available here from my series 'Outland.' Make sure to pick the corresponding perk to the print you want! Printed on metallic kodak endura! (Of course, your name on my website as well!)


$200: All five of the available 11x14 prints signed from my series 'Outland.' Printed on metallic kodak endura! (Of course, your name on my website as well!)


Available prints!

 


----------------------------------------------------------

If you're interested in seeing more of my work, feel free to visit www.nikkiphillipsphotography.com - and if you'd like to contact me, use that website's contact page to shoot me an e-mail!


Thanks!


Fun Facts:

What else do you do besides photography?

A: I am obsessed with video games. In fact, that's what you'll find me doing the majority of the time when I'm not working in photoshop, etc. Mostly, I play MMOs (WoW, Aion, SWTOR, FF:ARR, Tera) but grew up playing any/all console games I could get my hands on and playing Quake Arena/Unreal Tournament. 


Quick! Favorite game!

A: All-time favorite: Metal Gear Solid. Snake? Snake? SNAAAAKKKE!


Have video games affected your photography?

A: ABSOLUTELY! Sure, the proper phrase would be, "I grew up playing video games" but really it's more like, "I grew up IN video games." I played within worlds that you could only imagine and it has absolutely affected the way I create work. Immersion is a common term for developers/players of video games which obviously speaks to how it feels to be within a particular world within a game. Immersion is exactly what I strive for within my photography. I want my audience to have a sense of being within the world(s) of my work. 


First world problems of being a PC gamer and a photographer: The Never-Ending Battle of Hard Drive Space.


Do you do any portrait photography?

A: Yes! But mostly it's been animals. I'm a huge animal lover and I find animal portraits to be incredibly fun.

story:
About me

 

My name is david biene. I live in Berlin/ Germany and work as a freelance photographer. I did a lot of music photography, portraits of creatives and fashion shootings. Lemmy Kilmister, Mike Ness, T.C. Boyle and Josh Homme are only some I had the pleasure to work with.

Aside of this I work on free projects for exhibitions that got shown in Lebanon, Japan, Chile and Germany so far. But the biggest of the projects I realized so far is HOPPED-UP. Itâ€™s my first fine art photography coffeetable book. And itâ€™s what all this is about.

Iâ€™ve been into old motorcycles and cars for ever. Even as a little boy I was fascinated by the forms and looks and of course the sounds- and thatâ€™s what Iâ€™m still. Also looking at my music favourites one could always find rockabilly and rhythmâ€™nâ€™blues with my records of punkrock and that kind.

 

 

What â€˜Hopped-Upâ€™ is about

 

In 2001 this suddenly all came to live discovering that there was actually a lively scene for all this. And even more: people actually built those cars by themselves and race them! There were bands playin wild rockabilly and rhythmâ€™nâ€™blues themselves! It was simply amazing.

I stepped into a small world of adrenalin, gas and oil on the one hand and friendship, music and partying on the other.

It felt like a counterpart to todayâ€™s computerized life and thatâ€™s what fascinated me even more.

For me as a photographer it was like a reflex action: I had to document this. It didnâ€™t take me long to decide that I would like to make a book about this culture.

To show the realness of this scene and the authenticity I decided to shoot this project entirely on film. Also I determined thereâ€™d  be no staging and no retouching of any of the photographs.

Every photo you see is the way I found it along my way.

And this very way lead me to several places all over Germany, Sweden, Finland, Norway, over in the UK, Belgium and all the way down to Spain in the south. Iâ€™ve been to races, Parties, barbecues and to peopleâ€™s homes and garages to take photos and do interviews. 

From developping the concept and starting to work on it in 2003 it took me over 5 years for travelling around and collecting material. Another 1,5 years it took me to put it all together and finally publish it in 2009.

For those 5 years I paid all the expenses for traveling and film material from my own pocket and invested massive amounts of my time to make this what I wanted to be my book like.

 

 

The book

 

With the help of the amazing graphic designer (and since then good friend) Sascha Minde I put together  240 pages of mainly black-and-white photography, an introductional text written by me as well as 11 interviews all in English language. Printed on two different kinds of paper the pages found themselves in a hard cover of 12 to 9 inch ( 30 x 22,5 cm ) 

To round up the whole experience I wanted the ears of the spectator to get into it, too. So I recorded one of the hot rod races and put it as a 1 hour soundsphere on a CD. A second CD that I compiled from the great Rockabilly and Rhythm'n'Blues archives of Rhythm Bomb Records plays 13 rare songs. The first song even is exclusively written and recorded by Berlin guitar legend Tex Morton for the book and is only available with it.

 

 

Great success and seeing it let die

 

HOPPED-UP was released by a small publishing house situated in Berlin Kreuzberg in June 2009.

Only 3,5 months later the first print run of 1000 pieces was sold out.  My book was no longer available though a lot of people were still asking for it.

While signing the contract it was said weâ€™d start with 1000 copies having the option to print it again at any time. And thatâ€™s what I expected and with me a lot of people as the international interest for the book didnâ€™t die.

But: IT DIDNâ€™T HAPPEN.  My book was a great success but they just let it die.

Fact is: that publishing house will not release a 2nd print run of my book HOPPED-UP Iâ€™ve been working for more than 5 years and still do.

I was pretty shocked. Then I started looking for another way to get it out again.

In 2011 I found a new publisher who is totally into the book and would love to get it out again. But for them itâ€™s a risk as the book already was another publishing companyâ€™s product.

They need 10000 â‚¬ or 12500 USD of the printing costs to be covered by me.

Thatâ€™s a great offer of a very sympathic and high quality publisher.

But: I donâ€™t have 10000 â‚¬ or 12500 USD.

 

 

 

It's YOU who can bring it back to life!

 

This is why I need you out there! You lovers of photography! And lovers of the ANALOGUE photography, of the true and the real! Lovers of the lively niches of society and of youth cultures! You over there, enthusiasts of the style of the American 1940s- 50s. You and you with your love for racing and hopped-up engines on the track. And you with your dancing shoes loving the Jive and the Blues Boppers.

Itâ€™s all in here. Hopped-Up is a manifest for a passionate, lively and true scene made out of love and fascination.

Please support me to bring Hopped-Up to a second print run.

 

 

Love is black&white.

        Uncle Sally*s magazine (GER)

 

 Straight from the core of life. STERN.de magazine (GER)

                        Essential.  LODOWN Magazine (GER)

    Ageless & beautiful   WARP Magazine (JAP)

 

Passion is the fuel. Great Book!

         Cole Foster/ Salinas Boys, So-Cal, USA

 

 

 

Where your money goes and what youâ€™ll get for it

 

I think I put together some nice Thank-you-gifts and packages for your funding. Check them out â€“ I hope you like my stuff!

Your money is needed and will be used for covering one half of the printing costs. The other half the new publisherâ€™s goin to cover.

 

If we should not be able to successfully fund this 10.000 â‚¬ or 12500 USD the book is not gonna get reprinted anytime soon. It would be a very hard throwbag for me as the work of all in all 7 years would have been for nothing. I really count on you people and Iâ€™m sure youâ€™ll like what you get as did the 900 buyers of the first print run.

 

If there should even be more money coming in I would be really grateful because thatâ€™d mean we would be able to put the two CDs in the book again. Also I would try to still have two different kinds of paper in your book, too, as it was in the first ones. So we wouldnâ€™t be forced to only offer the sounds as a download link and shrink down to just one paper kind.

 

Well and then Iâ€™m hoping and planning to get some new exhibitions on. Money is needed and greatly appreciated for this part of it too.


If for whatever reason we can't make it and do not reach the goal of course I'll send back the money you submitted. However, if you want to get your shirt or print anyways even if there's not enough funds to print the second print run of the book I'll make you these and send them out to you.

 

 

Your help on all channels

 

But you can help much more and beyond the financial part.

Iâ€™d love to see that you spread the word about this book to your friends. If you become a fan of this Iâ€™m sure there are friends around you who will love it to. Tell them!

And also Iâ€™d be very happy to get your help on the exhibition issue. If you run a gallery or you know someone who does please have close look!

Even if you live next to a gallery that you love and where my work would fit in:  Iâ€™d be very happy to get some clues on this from you, too!

story:
Hello, Namaste!

Pursuing a spiritual quest, I started reading about Buddhist philosophy and remember falling in awe before the power of the Buddha’s teachings. The simplicity of his words resonated deep within, urging me to start my journey along this spiritual path.

A few years later, I traveled to Nepal for the first time.

I have often experienced reading meaningful words or seeing pictures which impacted and shifted my mindset, making a big difference throughout my day. 

That is the reason why I wanted to share this book with you. I have selected some photographs from my last visit in Nepal and included some inspirational quotes of the Buddha.

I do hope that you will find these photographs, together with the quotes, an inspiring source of reflection.

    "Each morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most."                    Buddha

            

Risks & Challenges

I have really enjoyed this journey so far. All the photographs and the quotes have been selected carefully .

To my eyes the biggest challenge is reaching you and distributing the book. Now I need your help to reach the finish line.

By pre-ordering a copy today, you will bring Nepal Diary to life!

"Learn to be happy with what you have."

Buddha

        

 How much is it going to cost?

I aim for 5,500 euros, the amount needed for a high quality Hardcover 84 pages book, format 20x27cm with high quality matte paper (150g/m2).

This amount is flexible, depending on how many backers there will be. 150 or 250 books will be printed.

The book  is both in english and french.

            

How will the funds be used?

- Funds will be used for printing, binding and shipping worldwide from Paris, France.

- Indiegogo and card fees equal 8% of total money contributed .

Any funds raised beyond my goal will pay for more printings in offset. If I get less money than I need? I will just print less amount of books! 

                               

"Do not dwell on the past, do not dream of the future, 

concentrate the mind on the present. »

Buddha

 

               

The Perks

From the jump, I want to say that your support no matter how small is, will help to bring this book to light.  So Thank-You!

- 5 euros= I will send you a Thank-You mail 

- 10 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro prints from the book   

- 30 euros+ shipping= 1 Fine Art Print - format 25 x 20 cm 

- 40 euros+shipping= Nepal Diary hardcover edition

- 50 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro Prints + Nepal Diary hardcover edition

- 50 euros+ shipping= 1 Signed & Numbered of Nepal Diary hardcover edition

- 70 euros+ shipping= 1 Fine Art Print+ Nepal Diary hardcover edition

- 80 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro Prints + 1 Fine Art Print (25 x 20 cm)+ Nepal Diary hardcover book

- 90 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro Prints + 1 Fine Art Print (25 x 20 cm)+ Nepal Diary signed and numeroted hardcover book

- Other Ways You Can Help:

If you like what I'm doing , please share this Indiegogo link with your own social media community. 

I look forward to your help and shipping out the books from september 2017 !

             

                                                      ----------------------------------

Bonjour, Namaste !

En quête de recherche personnelle, j'ai découvert la philosophie bouddhiste. Je me souviens avoir été fascinée par les enseignements du Bouddha. Sa simplicité et sa puissance m'ont marquée et m'ont engagée à  commencer un chemin spirituel.

Quelques années plus tard, ce chemin m'a naturellement guidée au Népal.

J'ai souvent constaté que la lecture de citations inspirantes ou certaines photos avaient une réelle influence sur mon état d'esprit.

C'est pourquoi j'ai voulu vous offrir ce livre. J'ai sélectionné des images du Népal auxquelles j'ai ajouté des citations du Bouddha.

J'espère sincèrement que ce livre représentera une source de réflection pour vous.

"Chaque matin, nous renaissons à nouveau.

Ce que nous faisons aujourd'hui est ce qui importe le plus. »

Bouddha

 

Risques et défis

Les photos et citations ont été sélectionnées. Mon plus grand défi est désormais de l’imprimer. J’ai maintenant besoin de votre aide. En pré-commandant aujourd’hui un exemplaire de Nepal Diary nous pourrons ensemble réaliser ce projet.

Quel sera le coût?

Pour une impression de haute qualité d'un livre couleur avec couverture cartonnée, je dois rassembler  5 500 euros.

Le montant est flexible, car en fonction du nombre de "supporters", j’imprimerai 150 ou 250 exemplaires.

Le livre est en français et en anglais.

 

"On peut allumer des milliers de bougies . A partir d'une seule sans en abréger la vie.

On ne diminue pas le bonheur en le partageant. »

Bouddha

 

Comment seront utilisés les fonds?

- les fonds seront utilisés pour l’impression, la reliure, et le transport.

- payer la commission d’Indiegogo et les frais de carte bancaire (soit  8% du montant récolté)

Si le montant prévu est dépassé, l’argent servira à imprimer plus de livres en qualité offset et si la   somme n'est pas atteinte, j’imprimerai juste moins de livres!

Les récompenses 

Tout d’abord, je tiens à vous remercier pour votre contribution! Quel que soit le montant de votre soutien, il me permettra de réaliser ce projet!

- 5 euros= un mail pour vous dire Merci ! 

-  10 euros +livraison= un set de 3 photos rétro du livre

- 30 euros+ livraison= une impression 25x30 d’une photo du livre

- 40 euros+ livraison= le livre Nepal Diary

-50 euros+ livraison=  le livre Nepal Diary, signé et numéroté

- 60 euros+ livraison= un set de 3 photos rétro du livre + le livre Nepal Diary

- 70 euros+ livraison= une impression 25x30 d’une photo du livre+ le livre Nepal Diary

- 80 euros+ livraison=un set de 3 photos rétro + une impression  Photo 25x30  + le livre Nepal Diary

- 90 euros+ livraison= un set de 3 photos rétro + une impression  Photo 25x30 + le livre Nepal Diary, signé et numéroté

- Vous pouvez aussi m’aider en partageant le lien Indiegogo sur vos réseaux sociaux.

 Avec votre soutien, le livre sera imprimé et livré début septembre 2017 !

 

"Nous sommes ce que nous pensons. Tout ce que nous sommes résulte de nos pensées. 

Avec nos pensées, nous batissons notre monde. Parlons et agissons avec un esprit pur et le bonheur ne nous quittera plus. »

Bouddha
story_txt: Hello, Namaste!Pursuing a spiritual quest, I started reading about Buddhist philosophy and remember falling in awe before the power of the Buddha’s teachings. The simplicity of his words resonated deep within, urging me to start my journey along this spiritual path.A few years later, I traveled to Nepal for the first time.I have often experienced reading meaningful words or seeing pictures which impacted and shifted my mindset, making a big difference throughout my day. That is the reason why I wanted to share this book with you. I have selected some photographs from my last visit in Nepal and included some inspirational quotes of the Buddha.I do hope that you will find these photographs, together with the quotes, an inspiring source of reflection.    "Each morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most."                    Buddha            Risks & ChallengesI have really enjoyed this journey so far. All the photographs and the quotes have been selected carefully .To my eyes the biggest challenge is reaching you and distributing the book. Now I need your help to reach the finish line.By pre-ordering a copy today, you will bring Nepal Diary to life!"Learn to be happy with what you have."Buddha         How much is it going to cost?I aim for 5,500 euros, the amount needed for a high quality Hardcover 84 pages book, format 20x27cm with high quality matte paper (150g/m2).This amount is flexible, depending on how many backers there will be. 150 or 250 books will be printed.The book  is both in english and french.            How will the funds be used?- Funds will be used for printing, binding and shipping worldwide from Paris, France.- Indiegogo and card fees equal 8% of total money contributed .Any funds raised beyond my goal will pay for more printings in offset. If I get less money than I need? I will just print less amount of books!                                "Do not dwell on the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present. »Buddha                The PerksFrom the jump, I want to say that your support no matter how small is, will help to bring this book to light.  So Thank-You!- 5 euros= I will send you a Thank-You mail - 10 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro prints from the book   - 30 euros+ shipping= 1 Fine Art Print - format 25 x 20 cm - 40 euros+shipping= Nepal Diary hardcover edition- 50 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro Prints + Nepal Diary hardcover edition- 50 euros+ shipping= 1 Signed & Numbered of Nepal Diary hardcover edition- 70 euros+ shipping= 1 Fine Art Print+ Nepal Diary hardcover edition- 80 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro Prints + 1 Fine Art Print (25 x 20 cm)+ Nepal Diary hardcover book- 90 euros+ shipping= 1 set of 3 retro Prints + 1 Fine Art Print (25 x 20 cm)+ Nepal Diary signed and numeroted hardcover book- Other Ways You Can Help:If you like what I'm doing , please share this Indiegogo link with your own social media community. I look forward to your help and shipping out the books from september 2017 ! story:
The Mission: To explore the streets of England for four months, photographing its captivating faces and places.

The Goal: To print and frame an exhibition of the work for Alley Cat Gallery in San Francisco.

The Artist:

I’m Cammie Toloui. Thanks for visiting my fundraising page. I have been a photographer for most of my life, exploring places and people with a documentary eye. My work has been shown in the Tate Modern, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art and many other galleries over the years.

Street photography is one of my favorite types of photography. I did a lot of it in my 20s, capturing the vibrant Gilman Street music scene, the colorful San Francisco street life, punk kids in Soviet Russia and backstage in the sex industry.

I have always been drawn to document people on the fringes whose lives are perhaps invisible or misunderstood. My work has shed light on worlds that most people would never have a chance to see or even know about.

When I was 26, I had a child and raised him as a single parent, putting my work as a street photographer on hold. In 2006 I took a trip to Europe and started shooting again, wandering the streets of Italy and France and becoming re-acquainted with my favorite style of shooting.

This year, my son is going off to college and I want to take this opportunity to continue my street photography project, this time in England.

I was there briefly in 2010 when my work was selected for the Exposed exhibition at the Tate Modern, and I was inspired by London’s diversity and charm, its bustling districts and also its deserted side streets. While there, I knew that I needed to return for a longer stay so I could really wander and shoot.

I would like to go to London in September and October to rekindle my creative passion, do more street photography and create a body of work that I can then show in a gallery.

I have been offered a place to stay in Lewes, England beginning in late October (until mid-December) and I plan on continuing my photography project there and in other towns throughout the region.

I will create a blog so that I can upload new images daily for everyone to see my progress and then when I return, I will create prints, frame and show my work at Alley Cat Gallery in San Francisco and hopefully also in galleries elsewhere. I will also show the body of work on my portfolio website so that everyone can see them. In addition, I'm offering a custom postcard during my travels to everyone who donates $20 or more.

In January 2013, backers will receive a request to order prints and they will be shipped beginning in February 2013.

I'm super excited to re-connect with my street photography roots in beautiful, quirky London, England and beyond and share them with the world.

Thank you for your kind and generous support!

story:
Summary

The calendar exclusively features photographs taken by Peace Corps volunteers throughout Ecuador.  It features stunning images of both the gorgeous scenery and the people of this beautiful and diverse country.  


Watch the video above to see all the amazing photography in the calendar.

Funds raised from calendar sales go toward volunteer projects here in Ecuador.  Here is a list of the projects funded from last year's sales (photos below not featured in the calendar).

1. Lindsay McGeehon (Natural Resources Conservation Volunteer) – Grant to build a greenhouse and composting system, give environmental classes, and to print an environmental education manual for teachers at the schools where she teaches in Archidona, Napo. 

 (photo below not featured in the calendar)

2. Heather Parker (Natural Resources Conservation Volunteer) – Grant to buy materials to start a school garden and hold an Earth Day event to initiate the project and begin teaching the children and their mothers about gardening and nutrition in Sigsipamba, Imbabura. 

3. Amanda Brinton (Natural Resources Conservation Volunteer) – Grant for her community of Campo Cocha, Napo to build trash and recycling bins to be placed strategically around the community to teach people to separate recyclables, organic and inorganic waste. 

4. Peter Bobbs (TEFL Volunteer) - Grant for his high school in Machala, El Oro to build a giant Scrabble board to be used during classes and at the after-school English club so the students will have a fun way to practice and learn English.

5. Rich Flowerday (Natural Resources Conservation Volunteer) - Grant to buy a router to make new wooden signs to promote community tourism in Bucay, Guayas. 

6. Nikki Rowley (TEFL Volunteer) - Grant to fund a workshop day with her English teachers in Cuenca, Azuay to make classroom materials they can share and use among themselves to improve classroom methodology.

7. Chloe Pete (Community Health Volunteer) – Grant to start a women's income generation project in Chalaguan, Chimborazo making traditional Kichwa jewelry while also teaching the women business skills. 

(photo below not featured in the calendar)

8. Cherith Chapman (Natural Resources Conservation Volunteer) – Grant to print informational tourism brochures to place in the tourism information center in Bucay, Guayas. The brochures will also be used to teach the locals how to distribute them at a tourism center.


What We Need & What You Get

With funds from this Indiegogo campaign we will:

  • Print & ship calendars (we sold 300 last year, hoping for at least 400 this year)
  • Support volunteer projects through grants
  • Each $100 pledged funds a grant that can go a long way in Ecuador

When supporting this campaign at the $15 level you will get a beautiful 2014 Peace Corps Ecuador calendar.  Contributions at higher levels entitle you to receive more calendars that make fantastic gifts for friends and family.  

The Impact

Calendar proceeds fund great volunteer projects like those above in villages and communities across Ecuador.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

(breve sommario) 

Produrrò 3 brevi short-film che mostrerannò la strada via terra in solitaria dall'Italia all'Australia in modi veloci e originali. Nei video potrai viaggiare in pochi minuti da Milan (ITA) a Darwin (AUS) attraverso posti pazzeschi. Io inizierò a mangiare una mozzarella a Milano e la finirò in Austrlia e ogni morso sarà in un posto diverso lungo il cammino. Tutti gli aggiornamenti dal viaggio su www.mozzarelleria.com

I'll produce short-videos that will show the street overland from Italy to Australia in quickly and original way.  In the videos you'll can travel fast like the light from Milan (ITA) to Darwin (AUS) through amazing places. I'll eat a mozzarella cheese from Italy to Australia and every bite will be in a different place down the road. All updates from the trip on www.mozzarelleria.com                                                                                       

  • "Mozzarelleria delle immagini" è un sito internet nato del 2013 durante un viaggio in Africa via terra per supportare progetti di sviluppo di ONG con video e foto professionali e dando visibilità ai progetti. Creatore, io, Emanuele Alberto Crippa un professionista della fotografia del video
    "Mozzarelleria delle immagini" (www.mozzarelleria.com) is a internet site born in 2013 in a African overland travel to support NGO development projects with professional video, photos and visibility. Creator: me, Emanuele Alberto Crippa, professional photographer and movie maker.                                                               
  •   Nel 2014 nasce il secondo capitolo "Mozzarelleria TransAsiatica". Una traversata via terra dall'Italia all'Australia.                                                             2014 start a second chapter : "Mozzarelleria TransAsiatica". A crossing overland from Italy to Australia.                                                                                        
  • in programma la realizzazione di video che mostreranno in tragitto via terra dall'Italia all'Australia in modi veloci e simpatici                                                         in program the realization of VIDEOs, showing the overland and sea street from Italy to Australia in fast and funny ways.                                                                         
  • Rimarranno obbiettivi del viaggio il supporto a progetti di sviluppo e la creazione di un album fotografico del viaggio. con belle foto in HD dedicate agli amici che aiutano e seguono il progetto                                                                        In the travel remain the desire to find and support nice development NGO projects, and the creation of a cool photobook of the trip, with beautifull hd photos dedicated for the supporters                                                                                  

What We Need & What You Get

(di cosa ho bisogno e per quale scopo)

  • Ho messo da parte l'80% del budget, 8000 Euro. In parte già utilizzato per acquisto degli strumenti tecnici e attrezzatura da viaggio. Parte dei fondi già usati invece per burocrazia (visti, permessi, passaporto). Il resto servirà per gli spostamenti, visite, cibo e pernottamenti. Sto cercando di recuperare il restante 20% del budget, utili per poter fermarmi in caso di bisogno più tempo lungo il percorso per aiutare bei progetti di sviluppo. Ci sono infine alcune deviazione al momento fuori budget (Lasha (tibet), Hong Kong, Luang Probang (Laos), Isola di Komodo), mi aiutereste a inserire alcune di queste spettacolari mete nel programma.                                                                                                   Stored the 80% of the budget for this project, 8000 Euro. With part of the budget I bought  technical and travel materials. I've use a part of the budget for bureaucracy (visas, permits, passport). The rest of the budget is for low cost displacement,visit, nights and food. I try to find a 20% more to be relaxed if I've to stop in nice NGO project to help them. I I've some deviation in addition out off budget (Lasha (Tibet), Hong Kong, Luang Prabang (Laos), Komodo island (Indonesia)  I'd like to add some of these spectacular places to the route.                                                                                                                         
  • Se non raggiungerò l'obbiettivo finale i fondi verrano utilizzare per conseguire il miglior risultato possibile secondo gli obbiettivi                                                          If I don't reach my entire goal, the found will go to support the best result possible following the goals.                                                                                         


The Impact, Risks & Challenges

(Impatto , rischi e sfide)
  •  In questo viaggio voglio mostrare che nel 2014 è ancora possibile andare piano, stare coi piedi per terra, e raggiungere grandi risultati. Imparare e mostrare cosa c'è ancora di bello nel mondo e che solo andando lentamente è possibile coglierlo. Ma i video non saranno cosí lenti e noiosi!                            With this travel I want to show in 2014 it is still possible to go slowly, keep your feet on the ground, and reach big goals. Learning and showing what's even beautiful in the world and just going slowly you can see it. But the videos will be not so slow and boring!                                                                                                    
  • i rischi maggiori riguardano il trovare la barca finale che mi porterà in Australia, la sicurezza del file foto-video ed eventuali problemi politici e burocratici (in Russia ad esempio). In caso di completa impossibilità a continuare via terra prenderò l'aereo.                                                                                                      greatest risks are do not find a final boat for Australia, the safety of photos-video files, bureaucratic and political problems (Russia for ex.). In case of complete inability to continue overland take the plane                           
  •  Il raggiungimento di tutti gli obbiettivi ha un 70% di possibilitá di realizzarsi. Ma gran parte degli obbiettivi penso hanno un 90% di possibilitá di essere realizzati. Ma é sicuro al 100% the sarà qualcosa di straordinario per me e per gli amici che mi seguiranno                                                                                           goal it's 70% chance to be reach and 90% chance for the most of the objects. But I'm 100% sure it will be something extraordinary for me and for all my supporters                                                                                                                

    Other Ways You Can Help

    (Altri modi per aiutare)

    •  Il raggiungimento di tutti gli obbiettivi ha un 70% di possibilitá di realizzarsi. Ma gran parte degli obbiettivi penso hanno un 90% di possibilitá di essere realizzati. Ma é sicuro al 100% the sarà qualcosa di straordinario per me e per gli amici che mi seguiranno                                                                                           the economics supports, also little, will be precious. If you like the project, but you can't help with an offer, you can support going to the site www.mozzarelleria.com, or to the official FB page, write me something, say hallo and make a smile                                                                                                         
    • puoi anche aiutare condividendo il mio progetto indiegogo sulla tua pagina Facebook o su Twitter e condividere i miei post e foto                                         also can share my indiegogo project on facebook and Twitter, and share my post and photos
story_txt:
Short Summary (breve sommario) 
Produrrò 3 brevi short-film che mostrerannò la strada via terra in solitaria dall'Italia all'Australia in modi veloci e originali. Nei video potrai viaggiare in pochi minuti da Milan (ITA) a Darwin (AUS) attraverso posti pazzeschi. Io inizierò a mangiare una mozzarella a Milano e la finirò in Austrlia e ogni morso sarà in un posto diverso lungo il cammino. Tutti gli aggiornamenti dal viaggio su www.mozzarelleria.comI'll produce short-videos that will show the street overland from Italy to Australia in quickly and original way.  In the videos you'll can travel fast like the light from Milan (ITA) to Darwin (AUS) through amazing places. I'll eat a mozzarella cheese from Italy to Australia and every bite will be in a different place down the road. All updates from the trip on www.mozzarelleria.com                                                                                       


"Mozzarelleria delle immagini" è un sito internet nato del 2013 durante un viaggio in Africa via terra per supportare progetti di sviluppo di ONG con video e foto professionali e dando visibilità ai progetti. Creatore, io, Emanuele Alberto Crippa un professionista della fotografia del video"Mozzarelleria delle immagini" (www.mozzarelleria.com) is a internet site born in 2013 in a African overland travel to support NGO development projects with professional video, photos and visibility. Creator: me, Emanuele Alberto Crippa, professional photographer and movie maker.                                                               


  Nel 2014 nasce il secondo capitolo "Mozzarelleria TransAsiatica". Una traversata via terra dall'Italia all'Australia.                                                             2014 start a second chapter : "Mozzarelleria TransAsiatica". A crossing overland from Italy to Australia.                                                                                        

in programma la realizzazione di video che mostreranno in tragitto via terra dall'Italia all'Australia in modi veloci e simpatici                                                         in program the realization of VIDEOs, showing the overland and sea street from Italy to Australia in fast and funny ways.                                                                         
Rimarranno obbiettivi del viaggio il supporto a progetti di sviluppo e la creazione di un album fotografico del viaggio. con belle foto in HD dedicate agli amici che aiutano e seguono il progetto                                                                        In the travel remain the desire to find and support nice development NGO projects, and the creation of a cool photobook of the trip, with beautifull hd photos dedicated for the supporters                                                                                  


What We Need & What You Get (di cosa ho bisogno e per quale scopo)

Ho messo da parte l'80% del budget, 8000 Euro. In parte già utilizzato per acquisto degli strumenti tecnici e attrezzatura da viaggio. Parte dei fondi già usati invece per burocrazia (visti, permessi, passaporto). Il resto servirà per gli spostamenti, visite, cibo e pernottamenti. Sto cercando di recuperare il restante 20% del budget, utili per poter fermarmi in caso di bisogno più tempo lungo il percorso per aiutare bei progetti di sviluppo. Ci sono infine alcune deviazione al momento fuori budget (Lasha (tibet), Hong Kong, Luang Probang (Laos), Isola di Komodo), mi aiutereste a inserire alcune di queste spettacolari mete nel programma.                                                                                                   Stored the 80% of the budget for this project, 8000 Euro. With part of the budget I bought  technical and travel materials. I've use a part of the budget for bureaucracy (visas, permits, passport). The rest of the budget is for low cost displacement,visit, nights and food. I try to find a 20% more to be relaxed if I've to stop in nice NGO project to help them. I I've some deviation in addition out off budget (Lasha (Tibet), Hong Kong, Luang Prabang (Laos), Komodo island (Indonesia)  I'd like to add some of these spectacular places to the route.                                                                                                                          Se non raggiungerò l'obbiettivo finale i fondi verrano utilizzare per conseguire il miglior risultato possibile secondo gli obbiettivi                                                          If I don't reach my entire goal, the found will go to support the best result possible following the goals.                                                                                          
  
The Impact, Risks & Challenges

(Impatto , rischi e sfide)

 In questo viaggio voglio mostrare che nel 2014 è ancora possibile andare piano, stare coi piedi per terra, e raggiungere grandi risultati. Imparare e mostrare cosa c'è ancora di bello nel mondo e che solo andando lentamente è possibile coglierlo. Ma i video non saranno cosí lenti e noiosi!                            With this travel I want to show in 2014 it is still possible to go slowly, keep your feet on the ground, and reach big goals. Learning and showing what's even beautiful in the world and just going slowly you can see it. But the videos will be not so slow and boring!                                                                                                    

i rischi maggiori riguardano il trovare la barca finale che mi porterà in Australia, la sicurezza del file foto-video ed eventuali problemi politici e burocratici (in Russia ad esempio). In caso di completa impossibilità a continuare via terra prenderò l'aereo.                                                                                                      greatest risks are do not find a final boat for Australia, the safety of photos-video files, bureaucratic and political problems (Russia for ex.). In case of complete inability to continue overland take the plane                           

 Il raggiungimento di tutti gli obbiettivi ha un 70% di possibilitá di realizzarsi. Ma gran parte degli obbiettivi penso hanno un 90% di possibilitá di essere realizzati. Ma é sicuro al 100% the sarà qualcosa di straordinario per me e per gli amici che mi seguiranno                                                                                           goal it's 70% chance to be reach and 90% chance for the most of the objects. But I'm 100% sure it will be something extraordinary for me and for all my supporters                                                                                                                


  Other Ways You Can Help (Altri modi per aiutare)

 Il raggiungimento di tutti gli obbiettivi ha un 70% di possibilitá di realizzarsi. Ma gran parte degli obbiettivi penso hanno un 90% di possibilitá di essere realizzati. Ma é sicuro al 100% the sarà qualcosa di straordinario per me e per gli amici che mi seguiranno                                                                                           the economics supports, also little, will be precious. If you like the project, but you can't help with an offer, you can support going to the site www.mozzarelleria.com, or to the official FB page, write me something, say hallo and make a smile                                                                                                         
puoi anche aiutare condividendo il mio progetto indiegogo sulla tua pagina Facebook o su Twitter e condividere i miei post e foto                                         also can share my indiegogo project on facebook and Twitter, and share my post and photos

story:
What’s all this about?

I am Suzie Blake, a professional photographer and artist currently working in Melbourne, Australia. I am also a mother of two boys, 3 year old Maximiliano and 8 month old Xavier. 

I am also a breastfeeding advocate.

My next big photography project is called ‘What Does Breastfeeding Look Like?’

Self Portrait with Maximiliano and Xavier, 2015

Why did I start this project?

In the media, I feel there is a distinct lack of authenticity in images of women breastfeeding. Most photos are highly stylized, fetishistic or unrealistic; many are sheer fantasy. Whether it is the angelic mother in her clinical white perfection or some model on the front of a fashion magazine. I’m tired of images that fail to show the realities of breastfeeding for most women.

This project is about portraying breastfeeding in all its beautiful messiness. This is about tired eyes and no make up. This is about milk leaks and ratty hair. This is about giving in to all the demands of your 2 year old while you try to feed your newborn. This is about dishes pilled up in the kitchen and dirty laundry building in the corner. This is about puke on your shoulder and toys on the floor. This is about let down milk sprays in cafes and engorged breasts at the park.

-----

This is about empowering women.

This is about the amazing thing that only we, the women humans of this earth, can do; sustain another humans life with our own.

-----

I have been documenting the project here. 

Nat, 2015

Lena, 2015

What's so important about breastfeeding?

The WHO recommends ‘breastfeeding up to 6 months of age, with continued breastfeeding along with appropriate complementary foods up to two years of age or beyond.’

As a mammalian species the normal way of providing our young with the nutrients they need for healthy growth and development is through breastfeeding. Most mothers can breastfeed, provided they have the right information, family support and the support of the health care system and society at large.

In spite of the WHO recommendations and scientific research, women are faced with innumerable challenges, both in the west and the developing world.

-  It is estimated that improved breastfeeding practices could save some 1.5 million children a year. Yet few of the 129 million babies born each year receive optimal breastfeeding and some are not breastfed at all. Early cessation of breastfeeding in favour of commercial breastmilk substitutes, needless supplementation, and poorly timed complementary practices are still too common. Professional and commercial influences combine to discourage breastfeeding, as do continued gaps in maternity legislation.[1]

-  Formula-fed infants are at higher risk for ingestion of lead, aluminum, and other heavy metals as well as iodine[2]

-  The use of infant formula from birth doubles the risk of infant death for American babies[3]

-  If every child was breastfed within an hour of birth, given only breast milk for their first six months of life, and continued breastfeeding up to the age of two years, about 800 000 child lives would be saved every year[4]

-----

I believe it is a human right for all people to be breastfed. Mothers should not have to face additional challenges in their attempts to breastfeed their young; simply learning the art of breastfeeding is challenge enough.

-----

Marta, 2015

Kimberley, 2015

What I need?

I need an initial amount of USD$4000 to take the project to the UK.

Why the UK? 

Europe has the lowest breastfeeding rates in the world, and within Europe the UK has among the lowest breastfeeding rates. This is an alarming statistic, especially in light of the fact that the UK has comparatively good paid maternity leave. What’s going on here? Well, that’s what I want to find out. I want to meet these mothers and learn about their breastfeeding experience. I also want to show how amazing the women who are breastfeeding in the UK are. I need to be in the place that needs the most breastfeeding advocacy – the UK is that place.

Marcella, 2015

Where will the money go? 

The amount I’m asking for will cover travel costs – flights, train tickets, car hire and petrol. I will shoot breastfeeding mothers all over the country and already have several lined up!

I will be documenting the mothers I encounter on this trip on the blog, and will also include stories of these women.

Sheri, 2015

So, what do you get?

Other than feeling absolutely awesome cos you’ve contributed to such a valuable cause, you’ll receive updates on social media and (depending on how much you want to contribute)

-  a personal shout out on Twitter, Facebook and/or Instagram

- our First Edition E book featuring never before seen outtake photos

- our First Edition Zine with artwork, outtake photos, stories and musings 

-  a beautiful signed postcard from the project

-  a set of 5 stunning signed postcards from the project

-  a ‘What Does Breastfeeding Look Like?’ T shirt, vest or onesie

-  a 1 hour photo session if you're based in Melbourne (any time) or London (at the time of travel). Perfect for baby pics, family portraits or a headshot for your LinkedIn profile.

-  a 2 hour photo session if you're based in Melbourne (any time) or London (at the time of travel). Ideal for kids birthday parties, christenings, bah mitzvahs or a family portrait session.

-  an 8 hour photo session: I am yours for a whole day! Get me to shoot your wedding, hen party or special event. You will receive over 100 hi res digital photographs to treasure forever. Available if you're based in Melbourne (any time) or London (at the time of travel)

For my wedding work click here and kids and babies here events here and here and parties here. For a general overview please browse my website here :)

Press

The project has recently been trending on Bored Panda with 175k views in 3 days and recently featured in The Huffington Post, Vanity Fair, Creative Boom, Stylist, The Motherish, The Bump, Kidspot, Creative Boom and more.

To see all the press clippings refer to the updates section here. 

What happens if we don't reach the target amount?

If we don't reach the USD$4000 target amount then the project won't travel to the UK and nobody receives their perks. Now that would be a massive bummer, right.

But it doesn't have to be that way! In order to make sure the project goes ahead we need to spread the word and encourage lots of people to pitch in.

So if you've made a contribution (#thankyosomuchIloveyou) spread the word to your family and friends. Stick this on your Facebook Page or Tweet about it. The more people involved the more likely we are to succeed and for everyone to get their perks whoop whoop!

Thanks so much for your involvement.

Suzie xxx

[1]Breastfeeding and complementary infant feeding and the postpartum effects of breastfeeding. Haggerty PA, Rutstein SO.  DHS Comparative Studies No. 30. Calverton MD: Macro International, 1999.

[2]Risks, Rights and Regulation, National Network on Environments and Women’s Health, Penny Van Esterik, 2006

[3]Breastfeeding and the Risk of Postneonatal Death in the United States, Aimin Chen, MD, PhD; and Walter J. Rogan, MD, Pediatrics, Vol 113 No. 5, May 2004 

[4] Maternal and child undernutrition and overweight in low-income and middle-income countries, Black RE, Victora CG, Walker SP, The Lancet, Volume 382, No. 9890, p427–451, 3 August 2013

story:
Manta Rays and the ocean are the focus on this project.  My name is Shawn Pudsey and this is me:


The two constant passions in my life are curiosity about the world, and water. I am a sailor, a SCUBA diver, a lawyer and a photographer.

BRIEF SUMMARY:
This project is about funding equipment to photograph these remarkable animals. Manta Rays are glamourous and magical creatures, sleak underwater flying machines. I intend to capture not only images of them, but of the ocean and the Great Barrier Reef itself.  I offer two things in return: an 17 x 22 print from my expedition AND a photograph from my existing, land-based collection (click the GALLERY tab near the top of the page - under the headline word REEF). PLUS, during the expedition, I will be sending an email update to every contributor. These will be notes from the field and will including snapshots and stories of life on the reef.

WHERE AND WHEN?
A not-for-profit research team works off the east coast of Australia documenting the Mantas as they feed and migrate. I will join this project for one week and continue to dive on the Great Barrier Reef at the conclusion of the project through a local diving club. The hosted part of the trip is operated through the reputable and respected organization, Earthwatch; the program is designed to watch and study Manta Rays.

I will seek to join the next possible dates following the campaign closure in the end of September. I am hoping for a November 2014 start date.
 
WHY?
I am fascinated by water and by flight. Manta Rays capture both and many iconic underwater images focus on these animals.

HOW?
This project exists to fund the purchase of underwater equipment ($5,100) and expedition cost ($3,600). These figures include the money necessary to produce the perks that are rewards for contributors.

IS THERE SOMETHING UNIQUE HERE?
Yes. The prints will be produced on Shawn's high-end photo printer by Shawn himself so that he can control the color and the print quality. The end result will be that you helped participate in an underwater adventure and you'll have the proof in your own home to prove it. Much the way patrons of the arts or funders of expeditions have their trophies.

WHAT STANDS IN THE WAY?
My body of work today is land-based. The water images I do have are taken from docks, rafts and the shore. I want to get underwater, to capture images of water underwater and on-water. This project began with a keen desire to focus on water and has emerged with my growing interest in rays.

WHAT EXPERIENCE DO YOU HAVE AS A PHOTOGRAPHER?
I was the official photographer for a winter snow festival in Ottawa in the winter of 2014. This was a multi-day event taking indoor photos both portraits and candids. 

In September 2014, four of my images from other work are being hung at Jak's Kitchen, an upscale bistro in Ottawa. (Contributors are invited to join us for my opening).


My Skin in the Game

I will pay from my own money for the airfare to Australia. So - your contributions pay for equipment, I pay for the travel.


Perks? Yes, you get perks!

As a thank you for participating in this project, you will receive:

  • a frameable print from the Manta Ray expedition, printed and signed by me (various sizes of prints)
  • a print from the existing land-based collection (see the GALLERY tab above the video at the top of this page).

RISK: What if the project is not fully funded?

If I do not reach my financial goal, then backers will receive an additional print from the existing land-based collection in place of the print/gift from the Manta Ray expedition. This would be highly disappointing, of course, and underlines why your assistance is needed!

Questions and Answers:

Q:  I don't see a place to choose the photo I want!

A:  When the campaign ends, I will contact you and you let me know then which photo you want. If you haven't heard from me within a week of the campaign closing date, then email me: shawn@shawnpudsey.ca

Q:  What risk is there?
A:  The expedition relies on my ability to join the Earthwatch group, subject to their space availability. Without an available space, I will need to wait until the next opening.  This may delay the delivery of the Manta Ray prints. I may also be hit by lightning and swallowed by a shark, in which case all bets are off.

Q:  When will we receive the perks?
A:  The print from the existing collection will be to you before December 15th, just in time for the holidays - or for Christmas giving. While I will attempt to do the same for the Manta Ray print, this is subject to the space availability before November of
a place on the Earthwatch expedition.

Q: What about sizes? Not all photos are exactly 8 x 10 or 11 x 14 or 17 x 22?

A: Very true. All photos will be close if not exactly each of those sizes.  There are some photos that are odd sizes. If precise size is important to you, please raise this issue when I get in touch with you.

The SMALL PRINT

Q:  Can I get anything framed?

A:  Framing is highly personal. If you want me to do it, then please contact me: shawn@shawnpudsey.ca.

Q:  The small print doesn't say x, y or z. So ... pay me!

A:   At all times, this proposal is subject to reasonable expectations. I want you to be happy with the print. If it arrives damaged, I'll replace it. If you hate it when you see it, contact me. Let's see what we can work out.

PLUS, during the expedition, I will be sending an email update to every contributor. These will be notes from the field and will including snapshots and stories of life on the reef.WHERE AND WHEN?A not-for-profit research team works off the east coast of Australia documenting the Mantas as they feed and migrate. I will join this project for one week and continue to dive on the Great Barrier Reef at the conclusion of the project through a local diving club. The hosted part of the trip is operated through the reputable and respected organization, Earthwatch; the program is designed to watch and study Manta Rays. I will seek to join the next possible dates following the campaign closure in the end of September. I am hoping for a November 2014 start date. WHY?I am fascinated by water and by flight. Manta Rays capture both and many iconic underwater images focus on these animals.HOW?This project exists to fund the purchase of underwater equipment ($5,100) and expedition cost ($3,600). These figures include the money necessary to produce the perks that are rewards for contributors.IS THERE SOMETHING UNIQUE HERE?Yes. The prints will be produced on Shawn's high-end photo printer by Shawn himself so that he can control the color and the print quality. The end result will be that you helped participate in an underwater adventure and you'll have the proof in your own home to prove it. Much the way patrons of the arts or funders of expeditions have their trophies.WHAT STANDS IN THE WAY?My body of work today is land-based. The water images I do have are taken from docks, rafts and the shore. I want to get underwater, to capture images of water underwater and on-water. This project began with a keen desire to focus on water and has emerged with my growing interest in rays.WHAT EXPERIENCE DO YOU HAVE AS A PHOTOGRAPHER?I was the official photographer for a winter snow festival in Ottawa in the winter of 2014. This was a multi-day event taking indoor photos both portraits and candids.  In September 2014, four of my images from other work are being hung at Jak's Kitchen, an upscale bistro in Ottawa. (Contributors are invited to join us for my opening).
My Skin in the Game
I will pay from my own money for the airfare to Australia. So - your contributions pay for equipment, I pay for the travel. 
Perks? Yes, you get perks!

As a thank you for participating in this project, you will receive:

a frameable print from the Manta Ray expedition, printed and signed by me (various sizes of prints)

a print from the existing land-based collection (see the GALLERY tab above the video at the top of this page).



RISK: What if the project is not fully funded?
If I do not reach my financial goal, then backers will receive an additional print from the existing land-based collection in place of the print/gift from the Manta Ray expedition. This would be highly disappointing, of course, and underlines why your assistance is needed!
Questions and Answers:
Q:  I don't see a place to choose the photo I want!
A:  When the campaign ends, I will contact you and you let me know then which photo you want. If you haven't heard from me within a week of the campaign closing date, then email me: shawn@shawnpudsey.ca Q:  What risk is there?
A:  The expedition relies on my ability to join the Earthwatch group, subject to their space availability. Without an available space, I will need to wait until the next opening.  This may delay the delivery of the Manta Ray prints. I may also be hit by lightning and swallowed by a shark, in which case all bets are off.Q:  When will we receive the perks?A:  The print from the existing collection will be to you before December 15th, just in time for the holidays - or for Christmas giving. While I will attempt to do the same for the Manta Ray print, this is subject to the space availability before November of a place on the Earthwatch expedition.Q: What about sizes? Not all photos are exactly 8 x 10 or 11 x 14 or 17 x 22?
A: Very true. All photos will be close if not exactly each of those sizes.  There are some photos that are odd sizes. If precise size is important to you, please raise this issue when I get in touch with you.
The SMALL PRINT

Q:  Can I get anything framed?
A:  Framing is highly personal. If you want me to do it, then please contact me: shawn@shawnpudsey.ca. 
Q:  The small print doesn't say x, y or z. So ... pay me!
A:   At all times, this proposal is subject to reasonable expectations. I want you to be happy with the print. If it arrives damaged, I'll replace it. If you hate it when you see it, contact me. Let's see what we can work out.

story:
On December 30th, just a few days before the New Year, my car was broken into while fully loaded on a road trip. The back window of my car was smashed and a lot of gear was stolen including my workhorse cameras, laptop, lighting equipment, and more. The damage to my back window alone has already cost me $980 and I haven't even started to replace the lost equipment.  

I'm looking for help to raise funds to recoup my losses so I can get back out there to keep working!

WHAT I LOST...

When my car was broken into I was in the middle of a week long photo trip. This means I was packed to the gills with equipment, clothes, and personal items. Some of the items can never be replaced, including about fifteen rolls of film that had been exposed but not yet developed, and a journal where I kept about ten years of development notes. That being said, I'll give you the highlights of items I hope to replace:

  • Pentax 67ii Medium Format Camera w/two lenses
  • Sony A7 Full Frame Digital Camera and four memory cards
  • 50mm Zeiss Planar f/2 lens
  • 90mm Leica Summicron f/2.5 lens
  • 17" Dell Laptop
  • Handheld Lightmeter
  • Camera Tripod
  • Two 500w photo floods with light stands and soft box
  • Heavy duty photo backpack capable of carrying medium and large format equipment
  • Twenty rolls of unexposed Medium Format black and white film. 

GREAT INCENTIVES!!

Now I have to admit I was very hesitant to start up this campaign. Despite the massive blow this has been, I'm not a believer in just accepting money for nothing. So with that being said I'm prepared to offer some really great incentives for people who donate.

$10 Donations

For those who can donate at the $10 level I will be sending out postcards by mail featuring an image of mine (an implied nude to make it post office safe) with a personal thank you message from me.

$30 Donations

Thirty dollar donations will receive an inkjet print signed and dated by me. I make my inkjet prints with archival inks on matte surface paper. The print will measure 8 inches by 12 inches and will come to you packed in a sturdy tube via the US Postal Service.

$55 Donations

Now here is where things get interesting!! I am prepared to send out an 8 x 10 Silver Gelatin Print of an image I have never published or exhibited anywhere in the public eye. Basically, I will be doing a photo shoot at the end of this campaign and the results will be going directly to my donators. These aren't images I've been keeping in a back drawer because I didn't like them. I will never publish the image on Tumblr, Facebook, my website, Twitter, Instagram, etc. It will be for your eyes alone!

What I can say now about the image is that it will be a nude, or a nude portrait, and will be made on old school black and white film. All prints will be signed and dated on the back and made in a traditional wet darkroom on Silver Gelatin Paper. No two wet darkroom prints are quite the same so this is a truly unique item at a rock bottom price. 

Silver Gelatin Prints look great when matted and framed or they are just as nice stored away in a private art collection.

$100 Donations

Same as the $55 incentive level but a larger print size of 11 x 14. Personally, this is my favorite size to make prints. Large enough to make a presence when put on a wall but not so large that they take over the space. When doing gallery shows, I always prefer to print at 11 x 14. 

$275 Donations

Not one, not two, but five... yes... FIVE exclusive 8 x 10 Silver Gelatin Prints featuring images I will never publish or display on the internet or in a gallery. This will be an exclusive series of five brand new images made specifically for this campaign and never seen or published again by me.

All five prints will be made in a traditional wet darkroom, signed, and dated on the back. 

$500 Donations

Same as above but in the larger 11 x 14 size.

THANK YOU!!

If you've made it this far down the page I want to say thank you for looking and for considering helping me out. I truly appreciate the support of my audience and I'm hoping to get back on my feet soon to make lots more lovely images!

story:
Hello! My name is Karmen. I've really loved photopraphy for awhile now, and it is a huge passion of mine. Whenever I was able to get my hands on a camera, I will take TONS of pictures, just because I liked to so much. I've been made the "photographer/the person in charge of taking pictures" on trips, or just when someone would like me to. There's always that person!  Photography is something that just comes natural to me, I "have an eye" for it, as I've been told. I see something, I take a picture, it comes out wonderful. I always have moments where I wish I had a camera that would be able to capture every detail of what I'm seeing. 

Recently I discovered a thing called "Site Modeling". It is like normal modeling, but not professional and on Facebook, (of course) rather than for magazines and all that professional jazz. A lot of people who started out site modeling became actual models/merchandise models, which is a big reason I've been trying it out and continuing it. It's kind of like practice for professional modeling. I think it would be fun to try out professonial modeling of course, and I just keep getting more and more interested in doing it the more I see it!
Another thing is l would really like to take other peoples pictures. I have a lot of friends who live around me that are site models with me, and I think it would be fun to do unprofessonial shoots for them, or really anybody who is interested. Family pictures, "photoshoots", ect. All I need is the camera! Maybe then I could take the path of becoming a professional photographer! With a camera, I now realize that there are many things I could get into. 
Anyone who contributes to this is helping me out more than I can express through words. Photography is a passion of mine, and I've just always wanted a nice camera. I cannot raise or find this money on my own, though I am trying very hard to.  Anything helps. You will help me prusue my modeling and photography, and any other path I take with my camera.


I am going to need quite a bit of funding, to be completely honest, but I do understand that what I want is a LOT to ask for and can be seen as unreasonable to some. Just bare with me! I have done TONS of research on the camera I have my eye on, and I really know that it is what I want. The camera I would like is the Nikon D5200. Nikons are durable, and if you know me, then you know that durability is important. I am very clumsy! I don't want a point and shoot camera, I want something I can customize and something that will help me learn more about photography and cameras. The camera is high quality, and everything I am looking for. I have my mind set on this one, after hours of looking through hundreds of cameras. It would make me SO happy to get this, but even I have to settle for a level lower of the camera, I will be content. This camera will help me with my site modeling, photography, and everything else. I wont go into detail about the camera, I don't think many are interested, but if you are,  here's more information about the camera: http://www.nikonusa.com/en/Nikon-Products/Product/dslr-cameras/1501/D5200.html
I guess I should show you some of my photography at this point, as well as my site modeling, so here goes!

Everytime I've been to my Grandparents, I've always loved the view from the side of their house, so of course I took a picture!

My grandmothers kitten, Puff <3 


-All the pictures above were taken with a cameras I currently do not have access to, I am just showing that I have the ability to take them. Also, sorry for sideways pictures, there isn't any way to flip them.-

    If I can't raise enough money to get the camera, please know that I will still be saving to get it, even if it takes me a year. If I'm going to be spending a large amount of money, I want to spend it on a camera I know I will love. Anything helps, just sharing this helps me. So please get the word out about my campaign! 


    Thank you so much to anyone to contributes, and know your contrabution makes me extemely happy and helps more than you know. Sorry for any spelling/grammar errors, I am still learing how to be a good writer!
