story:
Teaser Song "Mr. Right" by Eighties Nights on BANDCAMP

Wichtig
Bitte achtet darauf eins der Perks bzw. Pakete zu bestellen, anstatt einen Geldbetrag einzugeben. Sonst fehlt nämlich Eure Adresse und ich weiß nicht wohin mit dem Buch!
 

Worum geht’s
Jeder Fotograf hat seine Geschichte zu erzählen. Meine beginnt sehr einfach. Unzufrieden und gelangweilt von alle den Bildern, die ich ausschließlich digital geschossen hatte, ließ mich der Gedanke nicht los, dass sich irgendetwas ändern musste. Irgendwas fehlte mir einfach in meinen Bildern. Wer hätte gedacht, dass die Lösung des Problems so einfach um die Ecke kommt. Kurz vor Weihnachten 2015 schenkte mir mein Schwiegervater seine alte Pentax ME Super Kamera mit ein paar Objektiven, die er beim aufräumen auf dem Dachboden gefunden hatte und so fing ich an mich mit der anaolgen Kamera zu beschäftigen. Fast zeitgleich hatte ich beim Aufräumen und Stöbern im Keller alte Familienbilder und VHS Kassetten gefunden. Fotos wie ich stolz meine erste Polaroid Kamera in den Händen halte, wie ich strahlend auf meinem neuen BMX saß oder als ich mit meiner Pepsi im Sommer vor dem Laden von meinem Vater stand, und noch viele weitere schöne Erinnerungen. Als ich dann noch die alten VHS Kassetten in meinen verstaubten Videorekorder steckte, war es plötzlich so offensichtlich. Die Kameras, Filme wie “Airborne” oder Serien wie “Baywatch” auf meinen alten VHS Kassetten - ich musste mal eine kleine Zeitreise machen. Es überkam mich sofort dieses Gefühl von früher als die Fotografie für mich als Kind so einfach und unkompliziert war - einfach auf den kleinen Knopf drücken und dann das ungeduldige Warten bis die Bilder entwickelt wurden. Es war sofort um mich geschehen! Im Januar 2016 habe ich dann euphorisch und recht planlos mit einer Hand voller Filme angefangen und ich bin so unbeschreiblich glücklich darüber wie es sich entwickelt hat. Es liegt ein absolut verrücktes Jahr hinter mir, mit so vielen wundervollen Menschen, die mich dabei begleitet haben. Und ich bin Jedem einzelnen, der bei meinen Blödsinn bisher mitgemacht hat, so dankbar. Ach was freue ich mich darauf wenn ich später alt und faltig bin meinen Kiddies davon erzählen zu können!
 

Was ist eigentlich “Suburban Neverland”?
Es sind schlicht gesagt Schnappschüsse aus einer Zeit die so magisch und wundervoll ist, wie keine Andere. Suburban Neverland erzählt eine Geschichte, die eigentlich schon seit vielen Jahren in meinem Kopf steckte und nur darauf gewartet hat endlich von Leuten gesehen zu werden. Das Gefühl von Unbeschwertheit, heißen Sommertagen, einer eiskalten Pepsi und die Schmetterlinge im Bauch, wenn du das Mädchen von Nebenan auf der Straße entdeckt hast. Übrigens, viele unveröffentlichte Aufnahmen sind ebenfalls im Buch enthalten.
 

Ich will ein Buch veröffentlichen
Ganz einfach. Ich habe da diesen kleinen Traum von einem Fotobuch, in dem all diese Erinnerungen und Emotionen stecken. Um diesen Traum zu realisieren und mein Buch produzieren zu können, brauche ich euch! Mit jedem Kauf eines Exemplares rückt die Erfüllung meines Traumes ein kleines Stück näher. Je mehr Geld zusammen kommt, desto schicker und exklusiver kann ich mein Herzensprojekt für euch gestalten. Es bedeutet mir sehr viel, dass ihr die Möglichkeit bekommt meine Bilder gedruckt an zu schauen und nicht einfach nur lieblos auf irgendwelchen Online Portfolios oder Social Media in mieser Qualität. Weg von dem ganzen Onlinewahn hin zu Papier in der Hand! Ich möchte das ihr es durchblättert und dieses Gefühl vergangener Tage mit mir teilt. Dass ihr euch das Buch anschaut und den Drang verspürt, alte Bilder aus eurer Jugend oder von euren Eltern aus dem Keller zu kramen, auf dem nächsten Flohmarkt einen VHS Recorder oder eine alte Knipse, die vielleicht noch funktioniert, zu kaufen. Zum Einstimmen habe ich für Euch auch noch die passende Playlist auf Spotify erstellt.
 

Hier noch ein paar Details zum Buch

• Format 210x270 mm
• Softcover
• ca. 200 -220 Seiten
• Premium Offset Papier
• Paperback
• Texte auf Englisch
 

Wie ihr mir helfen könnt?
Das ist eigentlich recht einfach. Ich benötige genau 6.800 Euro um die wichtigsten Kosten zu decken. Okay, eigentlich brauche ich etwas mehr als 6.800 Euro aber damit sind erstmal die Hauptkosten gedeckt. Den Rest bekomme ich hin. Ich will so sehr, dass es Realität wird und ich und vorallem ihr mein Buch in der Hand halten könnt. Wie das immer so ist, kommen noch Steuern dazu und dann wollen PayPal und Indiegogo auch noch ein bisschen was haben. Verpackung und Versand sind aber bereits im Preis der Perks bzw. Pakete enthalten. Ich habe mir für euch ein paar schicke Perks ausgedacht, die Euch hoffentlich gefallen werden. Sollte ich warum auch immer die angestrebten 6.800 Euro nicht erreichen, was ich natürlich nicht hoffe, bekommen alle automatisch ihr Geld zurück und es war eine fette Ente! Please not!!!!
 

Wie wird das Buch denn aussehen?



 

Hier sind noch ein paar weitere Beispielbilder


Wie werden die Goodies in den Perks aussehen?
Hier ist eine kleine Preview der Goodies made by Neil Productions

 

 
Yachtfotograf Bob Sala und David Anthony laden Euch zum Mahalo-Workshoptag ein. Im April fahre ich gemeinsam mit allen Unterstützern, die sich für das Mahalo-Package entscheiden, für einen Tag zu Bob nach Paderborn. Bob und ich werden Euch ein ziemlich abgedrehtes Programm bieten. Angefangen wird mit „The Big Wave“, einem biertrunken konzipierten Vortrag, in dem Bob auf Themen wie „Was ist meine Stimme in der Fotografie?“, „Authentizität und natürliche Bildwirkung“ und „Planung eines Shootings“ sowie „Kriterien der Locationwahl“ eingehen wird. Im Anschluss werden wir auf technische Aspekte unser beider Fotografie eingehen. Dabei geht es nicht um Kameras und Technik, sondern vor allem um das Sehen, Identifizieren und die Nutzung von natürlichem und Umgebungslicht. Wir halten die Gruppe an diesem Tag absichtlich klein, da wir intensiv auf jeden Teilnehmer eingehen möchten. Ein extrem lächerliches Hawaii-Hemd, Pizza, Bier und Rum sind inklusive. Wer länger anreisen muss oder eventuell des Autofahrens nicht mehr mächtig sein wird, bringt nen Schlafsack mit und darf gern mit uns bei Bob übernachten. Zum Frühstück gibts dann White Russian und nen Teelöffel Vegemite. Euer signiertes Limited Edition Paket gibt’s obendrauf. Wahlweise vor Ort oder vorher per Post.
Sobald alle perks gekauft sind oder wenn die Kampagne zu Ende ist und erfolgreich war, stimmen wir gemeinsam mit allen Teilnehmern einen Termin ab.
 
Übrigens, solltet Ihr Bob Sala noch nicht kennen, dann schaut mal undedingt hier vorbei:
 
The Rum Diary
Instagram
Facebook
Tumblr
 
 
Publikationen in Magazinen

Hier findet ihr ein paar Strecken aus dem letzten Jahr, die vielleicht noch ein bisschen mehr über mich und meine Arbeit erzählen. Wenn ihr mögt, schaut gerne rein. Als kleine Einstimmung auf das Buch gibt's hier noch ein kurzes Making-Of Video. Das komplette Making-Of Material wird dann als ca. 10-15min Schnittfassung auf VHS Kassette dem Buch im 60€ Perk bzw. Paket beiliegen. Ihr dürft euch also freuen! Ich glaube zusammen mit Euch könnte das Ding echt groß werden!

Rekt Magazine - Valeska Curier
Flake Magazine  - Kathy & Franzi
AirMag Magazine - Elena Mpoura
B-Authentique - Antonia Flach
Apple Pie Magazine - Marie & Alina
Liebe Nachbarn - The American Dream
 

Making Of Suburban Neverland

Mehr Making-Of Videos gibt es hier!
 

Wer ist eigentlich dieser ominöse Dave
Das bin dann wohl ich. Ich arbeite als Mediengestalter und Fotograf. Möglicherweise habt ihr schon ein paar Bilder von mir online gesehen, wenn nicht dann mal hop hop den Link unten folgen. Ich bin durch Zufall in die Produkt- und Werbefotografie gerutscht und habe u.a. Lookbooks für verschiedene Unternehmen geshootet. Jetzt habe ich endlich das gefunden, wo mein Herz dranhängt. Analog. Amerika. 80er. 90er.
 

Wie lange muss man warten bzw. wann kommt das Buch?
Also der Plan sieht folgendermaßen aus. Wenn alles klappt und wir das Geld zusammen bekommen, wird es ab Februar ernst.

• Mitte Januar werde ich die letzen Bilder anpassen und bearbeiten
• Anschließend schreibe ich noch ein paar kleine Geschichten
• Und dann werde ich das Buch layouten
• Ab Ende Januar werde ich das Merchandise produzieren
• Mitte / Ende Februar geht das Buch in den Druck
• Mitte März ist dann der offizielle Release von “Suburban Neverland”
• Und dann sollten es alle Supporter pünktlich im Briefkasten haben!
 

Warum soll ich jetzt schon bestellen und nicht bis zum Release warten?
Also. Ich will es mal so sagen. Ich kann das Buch nicht einfach so selber produzieren bzw. komplett selbst finanzieren. Wenn nicht zumindest die Druckkosten inkl. Verpackung und Versand hier per Vorbestellung reinkommen, kommt das Buch leider erst gar nicht zu Stande. Wäre doch schade, oder? Ach und die Pakete bzw. Perks gibt es nur hier. First come, first get.
 

Du bist so Broke wie ich und hast eigentlich keine Lust auf das Buch.
All good. Wie wäre es, wenn du mich einfach ein wenig supportest und diese Kampagne teilst. Egal ob online oder ob du deinen Freunden und Bekannten davon erzählst und so dieses Projekt ebenfalls realisierbar machst. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat or whatever. Dafür kannst du auch die Tools von Indiegogo weiter unten nutzen. Du würdest mir eine riesen Freude machen und ich wäre dir ewig dankbar, dass du ein Teil von meinem Herzensprojekt bist!
 

Let’s make it happen
Ich würde mich über eure Unterstützung sehr freuen und ihr würdet mir helfen einen Traum zu verwirklichen, den ich auch noch mit euch teilen kann - Here we go!
 

Danke für Euren Support, Eure Zeit und Eure Hilfe. Wenn es irgendwelche Fragen gibt, ich stehe euch per Mail unter indiegogo@david-anthony.com und auf Facebbok jederzeit Rede und Antwort.

www.david-anthony.com
www.instagram.com/thisisdavidanthony
www.facebook.com/thisisdavidanthony
www.thisisdavidanthony.tumblr.com


Cheers,

 

 

Attention
Please make sure to order one of the perks or packages instead of paying an amount of money. Otherwise your address is missing and I don´t know where I should send your book to.
 

What it's all about
Every photographer has his own story to tell. My story starts very simple. I was unsatisfied and bored of all the pictures I had made with my DSLR and more frequently I thougt that something had to change in the way taking pictures. There was just something missing in my pictures but I didn't knew what. Who would have thought that the solution of this problem would be so easy. My father in law gave me his old Pentax ME Super camera from the attic. And so I started to deal with it - the analogue camera and film. Almost at the same time I found some old family pictures and videocassettes while cleaning up the cellar. Photos on which I proudly hold my first Polaroid camera in my hands, where I sat on my new BMX bike with pure happiness on my face or one where I stood in front of my dad´s old grocery store with a cold Pepsi in my hand on a hot summer day, and many more beautiful memories. When I started watching the old VHS tapes on my dusty videorecorder it was just so obviously for me. The camera, films like "Airborne" or my favorite series like "Baywatch" on my old VHS tapes - I had to do a journey back in time. The feeling of the past just overtook me. How simple it was for me taking pictures as a child. Photography was so uncomplicated, simple and fun – you just had to push the small button, that's it. I will never forget this feeling while waiting for the pictures to be developed. It was all up with my mind! In January 2016 I started really euphorically and without any plan just with a handful of films and my analogue camera. Now I'm so happy how this all comes so far. This was an absolutely crazy year with so many wonderful people I met on this journey. And I'm so thankful for every single person who had taken part in my weird ideas so far. Oh my, I can not wait to be old and wrinkled telling my kids about that crazy trip.
 

What the hell is Suburban Neverland?
Very simple, it's just snapshots from the most magical and wonderful time I can remember. Suburban Neverland tells a story that has been in my head for many years and just waited for people to be seen an hopefully now printed on paper. The feeling of easiness, hot summers, ice cold Pepsi and butterflies dancing in the belly, when you've seen the girl next door on the street. oh, and be sure a lot of unpublished shots will be included in the book.
 

I want to publish a book
I have this little dream of a book that contains all these snapshots, memories and emotions. To realize this dream and to be able to produce my book, I need you! With the purchase or let's better say the pre-order, the realization of my dream is a little step closer. The more money comes together, the better I can design and produce the book for you. It means so much to me that you get the chance to look at my pictures printed and not just swipe online in bad quality. I wanna jump off from the whole online madness into paper in your hands! I want you to flick through it and share this feeling of the good old days with me. I want you to look at the snapshots and feel the need to browse trough old pictures from your youth or from your parents, to go to the next flea market and buy an dusty videorecorder or an old camera. To get you in the right mood for it I have created an playlist on Spotify especially for you.
 

Book details

• Format 210x270 mm
• Softcover
• 200 -220 pages
• Premium offset paper
• Paperback
• English texts
 

How can you help me?
This is actually quite simple. I need exactly 6.800 euros to break even the most important costs. Okay, actually I need a little bit more than 6.800 euros, but with this amount nearly the main costs are covered and I will manage the rest of it. I want this so badly, to hold my own book in my hands - I want you to hold my book in your hands. I hope we can make it happen. As you know, there are still some taxes to pay, and then PayPal and Indiegogo want also a piece of the pie. Packaging and shipping are already included in the price of the perks. There are some really cool perks and I hope you will like them. If I don't get the amount of 6.800€, by the way what I really don't hope that this will happen, you will automatically get your money back!
 

Publications in magazines
Here you can find some photo series of the past year to give you an quick insight into my work and to get to know me as a person a little bit better. So head over and have a look. To get you into the right mood for the book, HERE are some more videos that will be also included as a 10-15 minutes cut version on original FUJI VHS in one of my perks. I believe together with you guys this is going to be nuts!

Rekt Magazine - Valeska Curier
Flake Magazine  - Kathy & Franzi
AirMag Magazine - Elena Mpoura
B-Authentique - Antonia Flach
Apple Pie Magazine - Marie & Alina
Liebe Nachbarn - The American Dream


Nice, but who is this guy named Dave?
Hey Kids, that's me. I work as a media designer, filmcutter and photographer. Maybe you have already seen some of my works online, if not just use the link below. By a happy coincidence I slid into the product and advertising photography and worked for companies like WuTang Brand, for which I designed cloth and shoot the lookbook. Now I've finally found what I really love to do. Analogue. America. 80s. 90s.
 

How long will it takes or how long do I have to wait for the book?
The plan is simple. If everything goes well and I reach the amount of 6.800 euros, it will be going serious from February on.

• In the middle of January I will adapt and edit the last pictures
• Afterwards I'll write a few small stories and then layout the book
• From the end of January, I will produce the merchandise.
• In the middle / end of February, the book goes straight into print
• In middle of March you should have the book in your mailbox!
 

Why should I order the book now and not when it is released?
I cannot produce or finance the book completely on my own. If not at least the printing costs incl. packaging and shipping costs are covered by pre-orders it is not possible for me to produce it. Would be a pity, right? Oh and you will only get the packages / perks here. First come, first get.
 

If you're as broke as I am and not really liking a book.
All good. So just show some love for my project and support me by sharing my campaign. Whether you share it online or if you just tell your friends about it, it means a lot to me and it will help to realize my project. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat or whatever. You can also use the tools of Indiegogo below. That would be awesome! I would be so happy about your support. So please help me to realize this dream that I can share with you!
 

Thank you for your support, your time and your help. If there are any questions, please do not hesitate to ask me: indiegogo@david-anthony.com and of course on Facebook.

www.david-anthony.com
www.instagram.com/thisisdavidanthony
www.facebook.com/thisisdavidanthony
www.thisisdavidanthony.tumblr.com

Cheers,

 

 

Show some love package
Postcard with californian design and a personal and handwritten thank you straight from my heart for supporting me.

Earlybird package
As one of the first 25 supporters you get the book with some 80s themed stickers and a secret goodie for a special earlybird price so you will save 10 euros.

Signature package
You’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with personal dedication and numbered. There are also some 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.

Surprise package
You’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with personal dedication and numbered. There are also 2 original photo prints, a framed slide, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.

Lifeguard package
You’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with personal dedication and numbered. There is also a high-quality fabric patch in the original Baywatch design, double-sided poster in 420x590mm exclusively desiged by Arkuma Hiyomoto and Baywatch themed design, 2 original photo prints, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.

Glossy package
You’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with personal dedication and numbered. There is also included a glossy acrylic print exclusively designed by Arkuma Hiyomoto in 300x300mm, 2 original photo prints, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.

VHS package
You’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with dedication and numbered. There is also a videocassette with 10-15min behind-the-scenes footage with all models starring in Suburban Neverland, 2 original photo prints, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.
story_txt:
Teaser Song "Mr. Right" by Eighties Nights on BANDCAMPWichtigBitte achtet darauf eins der Perks bzw. Pakete zu bestellen, anstatt einen Geldbetrag einzugeben. Sonst fehlt nämlich Eure Adresse und ich weiß nicht wohin mit dem Buch! Worum geht’sJeder Fotograf hat seine Geschichte zu erzählen. Meine beginnt sehr einfach. Unzufrieden und gelangweilt von alle den Bildern, die ich ausschließlich digital geschossen hatte, ließ mich der Gedanke nicht los, dass sich irgendetwas ändern musste. Irgendwas fehlte mir einfach in meinen Bildern. Wer hätte gedacht, dass die Lösung des Problems so einfach um die Ecke kommt. Kurz vor Weihnachten 2015 schenkte mir mein Schwiegervater seine alte Pentax ME Super Kamera mit ein paar Objektiven, die er beim aufräumen auf dem Dachboden gefunden hatte und so fing ich an mich mit der anaolgen Kamera zu beschäftigen. Fast zeitgleich hatte ich beim Aufräumen und Stöbern im Keller alte Familienbilder und VHS Kassetten gefunden. Fotos wie ich stolz meine erste Polaroid Kamera in den Händen halte, wie ich strahlend auf meinem neuen BMX saß oder als ich mit meiner Pepsi im Sommer vor dem Laden von meinem Vater stand, und noch viele weitere schöne Erinnerungen. Als ich dann noch die alten VHS Kassetten in meinen verstaubten Videorekorder steckte, war es plötzlich so offensichtlich. Die Kameras, Filme wie “Airborne” oder Serien wie “Baywatch” auf meinen alten VHS Kassetten - ich musste mal eine kleine Zeitreise machen. Es überkam mich sofort dieses Gefühl von früher als die Fotografie für mich als Kind so einfach und unkompliziert war - einfach auf den kleinen Knopf drücken und dann das ungeduldige Warten bis die Bilder entwickelt wurden. Es war sofort um mich geschehen! Im Januar 2016 habe ich dann euphorisch und recht planlos mit einer Hand voller Filme angefangen und ich bin so unbeschreiblich glücklich darüber wie es sich entwickelt hat. Es liegt ein absolut verrücktes Jahr hinter mir, mit so vielen wundervollen Menschen, die mich dabei begleitet haben. Und ich bin Jedem einzelnen, der bei meinen Blödsinn bisher mitgemacht hat, so dankbar. Ach was freue ich mich darauf wenn ich später alt und faltig bin meinen Kiddies davon erzählen zu können! Was ist eigentlich “Suburban Neverland”?Es sind schlicht gesagt Schnappschüsse aus einer Zeit die so magisch und wundervoll ist, wie keine Andere. Suburban Neverland erzählt eine Geschichte, die eigentlich schon seit vielen Jahren in meinem Kopf steckte und nur darauf gewartet hat endlich von Leuten gesehen zu werden. Das Gefühl von Unbeschwertheit, heißen Sommertagen, einer eiskalten Pepsi und die Schmetterlinge im Bauch, wenn du das Mädchen von Nebenan auf der Straße entdeckt hast. Übrigens, viele unveröffentlichte Aufnahmen sind ebenfalls im Buch enthalten. Ich will ein Buch veröffentlichenGanz einfach. Ich habe da diesen kleinen Traum von einem Fotobuch, in dem all diese Erinnerungen und Emotionen stecken. Um diesen Traum zu realisieren und mein Buch produzieren zu können, brauche ich euch! Mit jedem Kauf eines Exemplares rückt die Erfüllung meines Traumes ein kleines Stück näher. Je mehr Geld zusammen kommt, desto schicker und exklusiver kann ich mein Herzensprojekt für euch gestalten. Es bedeutet mir sehr viel, dass ihr die Möglichkeit bekommt meine Bilder gedruckt an zu schauen und nicht einfach nur lieblos auf irgendwelchen Online Portfolios oder Social Media in mieser Qualität. Weg von dem ganzen Onlinewahn hin zu Papier in der Hand! Ich möchte das ihr es durchblättert und dieses Gefühl vergangener Tage mit mir teilt. Dass ihr euch das Buch anschaut und den Drang verspürt, alte Bilder aus eurer Jugend oder von euren Eltern aus dem Keller zu kramen, auf dem nächsten Flohmarkt einen VHS Recorder oder eine alte Knipse, die vielleicht noch funktioniert, zu kaufen. Zum Einstimmen habe ich für Euch auch noch die passende Playlist auf Spotify erstellt. Hier noch ein paar Details zum Buch• Format 210x270 mm• Softcover• ca. 200 -220 Seiten• Premium Offset Papier• Paperback• Texte auf Englisch Wie ihr mir helfen könnt?Das ist eigentlich recht einfach. Ich benötige genau 6.800 Euro um die wichtigsten Kosten zu decken. Okay, eigentlich brauche ich etwas mehr als 6.800 Euro aber damit sind erstmal die Hauptkosten gedeckt. Den Rest bekomme ich hin. Ich will so sehr, dass es Realität wird und ich und vorallem ihr mein Buch in der Hand halten könnt. Wie das immer so ist, kommen noch Steuern dazu und dann wollen PayPal und Indiegogo auch noch ein bisschen was haben. Verpackung und Versand sind aber bereits im Preis der Perks bzw. Pakete enthalten. Ich habe mir für euch ein paar schicke Perks ausgedacht, die Euch hoffentlich gefallen werden. Sollte ich warum auch immer die angestrebten 6.800 Euro nicht erreichen, was ich natürlich nicht hoffe, bekommen alle automatisch ihr Geld zurück und es war eine fette Ente! Please not!!!! Wie wird das Buch denn aussehen? Hier sind noch ein paar weitere BeispielbilderWie werden die Goodies in den Perks aussehen?Hier ist eine kleine Preview der Goodies made by Neil Productions

 
 Yachtfotograf Bob Sala und David Anthony laden Euch zum Mahalo-Workshoptag ein. Im April fahre ich gemeinsam mit allen Unterstützern, die sich für das Mahalo-Package entscheiden, für einen Tag zu Bob nach Paderborn. Bob und ich werden Euch ein ziemlich abgedrehtes Programm bieten. Angefangen wird mit „The Big Wave“, einem biertrunken konzipierten Vortrag, in dem Bob auf Themen wie „Was ist meine Stimme in der Fotografie?“, „Authentizität und natürliche Bildwirkung“ und „Planung eines Shootings“ sowie „Kriterien der Locationwahl“ eingehen wird. Im Anschluss werden wir auf technische Aspekte unser beider Fotografie eingehen. Dabei geht es nicht um Kameras und Technik, sondern vor allem um das Sehen, Identifizieren und die Nutzung von natürlichem und Umgebungslicht. Wir halten die Gruppe an diesem Tag absichtlich klein, da wir intensiv auf jeden Teilnehmer eingehen möchten. Ein extrem lächerliches Hawaii-Hemd, Pizza, Bier und Rum sind inklusive. Wer länger anreisen muss oder eventuell des Autofahrens nicht mehr mächtig sein wird, bringt nen Schlafsack mit und darf gern mit uns bei Bob übernachten. Zum Frühstück gibts dann White Russian und nen Teelöffel Vegemite. Euer signiertes Limited Edition Paket gibt’s obendrauf. Wahlweise vor Ort oder vorher per Post.Sobald alle perks gekauft sind oder wenn die Kampagne zu Ende ist und erfolgreich war, stimmen wir gemeinsam mit allen Teilnehmern einen Termin ab. Übrigens, solltet Ihr Bob Sala noch nicht kennen, dann schaut mal undedingt hier vorbei: The Rum DiaryInstagramFacebookTumblr  Publikationen in MagazinenHier findet ihr ein paar Strecken aus dem letzten Jahr, die vielleicht noch ein bisschen mehr über mich und meine Arbeit erzählen. Wenn ihr mögt, schaut gerne rein. Als kleine Einstimmung auf das Buch gibt's hier noch ein kurzes Making-Of Video. Das komplette Making-Of Material wird dann als ca. 10-15min Schnittfassung auf VHS Kassette dem Buch im 60€ Perk bzw. Paket beiliegen. Ihr dürft euch also freuen! Ich glaube zusammen mit Euch könnte das Ding echt groß werden!Rekt Magazine - Valeska CurierFlake Magazine  - Kathy & FranziAirMag Magazine - Elena MpouraB-Authentique - Antonia FlachApple Pie Magazine - Marie & AlinaLiebe Nachbarn - The American Dream Making Of Suburban NeverlandMehr Making-Of Videos gibt es hier! Wer ist eigentlich dieser ominöse DaveDas bin dann wohl ich. Ich arbeite als Mediengestalter und Fotograf. Möglicherweise habt ihr schon ein paar Bilder von mir online gesehen, wenn nicht dann mal hop hop den Link unten folgen. Ich bin durch Zufall in die Produkt- und Werbefotografie gerutscht und habe u.a. Lookbooks für verschiedene Unternehmen geshootet. Jetzt habe ich endlich das gefunden, wo mein Herz dranhängt. Analog. Amerika. 80er. 90er. Wie lange muss man warten bzw. wann kommt das Buch?Also der Plan sieht folgendermaßen aus. Wenn alles klappt und wir das Geld zusammen bekommen, wird es ab Februar ernst.• Mitte Januar werde ich die letzen Bilder anpassen und bearbeiten• Anschließend schreibe ich noch ein paar kleine Geschichten• Und dann werde ich das Buch layouten• Ab Ende Januar werde ich das Merchandise produzieren• Mitte / Ende Februar geht das Buch in den Druck• Mitte März ist dann der offizielle Release von “Suburban Neverland”• Und dann sollten es alle Supporter pünktlich im Briefkasten haben! Warum soll ich jetzt schon bestellen und nicht bis zum Release warten?Also. There is also a high-quality fabric patch in the original Baywatch design, double-sided poster in 420x590mm exclusively desiged by Arkuma Hiyomoto and Baywatch themed design, 2 original photo prints, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.Glossy packageYou’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with personal dedication and numbered. There is also included a glossy acrylic print exclusively designed by Arkuma Hiyomoto in 300x300mm, 2 original photo prints, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.VHS packageYou’ll get Suburban Neverland The Book. Signed, optionally with dedication and numbered. There is also a videocassette with 10-15min behind-the-scenes footage with all models starring in Suburban Neverland, 2 original photo prints, 80s themed stickers, a californian design postcard, a floppy disk design beer coaster and a secret goodie included in this perk.

story:
We are 'The Glitterati Syndicate', a small group of dedicated, passionate photographers, with our own individual styles. Currently in the third year of a BA(hons) photography degree at Edinburgh Napier, it is time to really put our work out there and start making a name for ourselves. We each will be producing work that deals with our own take on human intimacy.

'Human Intimacy' - Humans feel a fundamental need to connect, love and be loved, to share and essentially to be intimate. Intimacy is an elusive and ambiguous term within society and perception of it varies largely throughout cultural and historical models. 

The diversity and multitude of meanings attached to the term 'intimacy' is what will be explored; it's definitions, analytical potential for understanding social change and heterogeneous nature of human practices of intimacy. The visual representation of what intimacy means to each individual and the many ways in which we, as people can feel intimate or lack intimacy.  We as collective intend to explore what intimacy means to us and how important it's existence or lack of may be within life, culture, society, health and relationships.

The funds donated will be used to finance the production of the exhibition.

 

The exhibition will be held at The Biscuit Factory, Edinburgh, Scotland on 6th-12th April 2018. Free admission.

 

Introducing the photographers:

Charlotte Fitton, funding & venue coordinator // Fitton Photography

Beathan Halbert, sponsorship liaison // Beathan H Photography

Rowan Knox, promotion & publicity // Knox Box-Studios

Skye Lyon, curator // Skye Lyon Imagery

Simone Reid, exhibition production // Simone Reid Photography

 

If you have any questions, contact us at glitteratisyndicate@gmail.com or on our Facebook page.

Instagram @gsphotocollective

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise £1150 to help out with costs related to the production of the exhibition.

This includes, but is not limited to:

  • Venue hire
  • Printing costs
  • Promotional material (eg. flyers, posters)
  • Opening night
  • Artwork hanging

The more we raise, the more we get to use for the work itself!


In return we have various perks to offer and extend an invitation to our exhibit so you can enjoy what your contribution has gone towards.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Still want to help us out but not in a position to offer financial support? No worries, you're in luck! You can follow our social media accounts, share our Indiegogo page, share us on your social media, tell your friends about us and spread the word in anyway possible. We are grateful and value any contribution you make to us!

In addition, it would be fantastic to see you at the exhibition, and extend a warm invitation!

story:
The lightweight and dynamic SIRUI Swift M1 and P1 Gimbals provide a three-axis stabilization system to capture smooth shots while on the move. With easy to use, built in control buttons for access to several creative features, these high value models will inspire you to create your own Cinematic art in motion.

 

Swift M1 Gimbal

Produce dynamic videos with easy to use control buttons by access to many creative features!

Easy Balance Adjustment with a Great Load Capacity

Turn the Balance Adjustment Knob to balance the clamped mobile phone in the portrait or landscape position.

Supports a load capacity up to 300g/0.66lbs to easily shoot with the SIRUI Anamorphic Lens or any of the other family of SIRUI Mobile Lens.

Four Modes Switch

Master every movement to create your own Cinematic art with a quick switch to one of four modes: Tilting-Following Locked, Tilting Following, Triaxial Following Locked, POV (Roll Follow Mode).

Tilting-Following Locked

Tilting Following

Triaxial Following Locked

POV (Roll Follow Mode)

 

OLED User Interface

Options in use are in clear view on the OLED UI for full mode/motion switching and instant app control.

Auxiliary Wheel Dial

Press down the wheel dial to select one of the 4 motion settings. Turn the dial to smoothly control zooming, focusing, panning and tilting.

Intelligent IS System

The IS system provides smooth stabilization to capture high quality images as you move.

Active Track

Set for automatic facial tracking with the AI Algorithms or frame the object manually and position the subject in the center of the frame to actively shoot real-time.

Instant Scene Transition

The powerful motor drives the Gimbal to instantly proceed to move onto the next scene for a smooth transition.

Create Cinematic Shots with the Hitchcock Mode

Move the Gimbal back and forth as you zoom in/out while shooting a stationary object to create a striking dynamic vision for a cinematic vertigo effect.

Spin to change your view in POV Mode

Seeing is believing as you spin to turn your world upside down with the optical illusion and cinematic scene interlacing effect.

Go beyond the lens to see the world around you.

Pan the Gimbal 90°/180°/360° to capture a 3x3 ultra-wide-angle panoramic shot in just one click.

Path Lapse Mode

Vary scenes in streams of light and shadows.

Instant App Control via Bluetooth Connection

The Gimbal will automatically connect with the mobile Bluetooth when powering up. Press the App Control button to access more features on the App for shooting in different settings.

Function Keys for Quick Axial Setup

Press and hold down the corresponding function key to activate “Panning Following”, “Tilting Following” or “Triaxial Follow Locked” Modes.

Press the lower function key twice to reset all axes without manual adjustment.

Portable and Comfortable Fit

Comfortably capture stabilized handheld footage. Lightweight and portable, the Gimbal folds easily to a compact fit.

Or support the Gimbal with the mini tripod for extensive shoots.

 

 

Swift P1 Gimbal

The powerful motoroptimizes anti-disturbance performance and provides smooth stabilization with the AI Algorithmsto capture steady footages in motion.

The SIRUI P1 Gimbal is compatible with mirrorless cameras, card cameras, action cameras and mobile phones.

Instant Shot Control

Options in use are in clear view on the OLED UI for precise shooting control with the auxiliary wheel dial and other feature buttons. Easily unfold the tripod legs for support to capture steady shots.

Four Modes Switch

Master every movement to create your own Cinematic art with a quick switch to one of four modes: Tilting-Following Locked, Tilting Following, Triaxial Following Locked, POV (Roll Follow Mode).

Universal Calibrated Quick Release Plate

With the detachable Quick Release Plate, easily remove a camera from the P1 to attach it to a tripod.

Precisely balance the camera with the imprinted scale mark.

Focusing Control at your Fingertips

Need to focus quickly? With a simple connection, the focusing button will do it all.

Bevel Gimbal Arm

While framing shots, the bevel arm and a camera will vary in height to provide a clear camera screen view.

Instant Scene Transition

The powerful motor drives the Gimbal to instantly transition between scenes to capture every motion.

POV (Roll Follow Mode)

See the world from a new perspective. With the Roll Follow Mode activated, easily spin to turn your world upside down with the optical illusion and cinematic scene interlacing effect.

Path Lapse

With an easy setting of shooting points, speed and time, customize your path shots to create your own visual video art without repeated manual adjustments.

Active Track

Set for automatic facial tracking with the AI Algorithms or frame the object manually and position the subject in the center of the frame to actively shoot real-time.

Function Keys for Quick Axial Setup

Press and hold down the corresponding function keys to activate “Instant Scene Transition”, “Tilting Following” or “Locked” Modes. With a double press of the Function Key 2, the Gimbal will automatically reset all axes.

Comfortable Handheld Shoot

The comfortable anti-slip strips located on the sides of the control handle provide a firm grip to capture stabilized handheld shots.

 

 

 

Optional Mobile Accessories

SIRUI VD-01 Anamorphic Lens (compatible with the SIRUI Swift M1)

With our retro-style anti-reflection coating, the SIRUI VD-01 1.33x Anamorphic Lens can create a 2.4:1 cinematic, wide-screen, letterbox imagery with spectacular Sci-Fi light and flares on your mobile phone.

Magnification: 1.33x Horizontal Extrusion

Resolution: Center Field of View 500lp/mm, Edge Field of View 300lp/mm)

Video Aspect Ratio: 2.4:1

Size: 35*32*21mm/1.38*1.26*0.83inch (Length*Width*Height)

Weight: 19g/0.041lb

 

Product Kit

Swift M1 Gimbal

Swift M1 Gimbal + VD-01 Anamorphic Lens

Swift P1 Gimbal

Swift P1 Gimbal + VD-01 Anamorphic Lens

 

Why join in the crowdfunding of SIRUI Swift Gimbal?

SIRUI’s October crowdfunding event is a pre-launch of our new product line and an opportunity for vloggers and cinematic enthusiasts alike to be the first to experience the SIRUI Swift Stabilizers in advance of our official launch.  

 

About SIRUI

Since 2001, SIRUI has always strived to move forward towards expanding the SIRUI Brand. With innovative R&D, an excellent manufacturing process and worldwide marketing, SIRUI has become a global enterprise to develop, manufacture and market photographic products.

As one of the SmartImage Industry leaders in China, SIRUI attracts exceptional and talented people to its photographic product manufacturing base covering over 30,000 square meters equipped with the latest technology. SIRUI can be found domestically in 31 provinces with showrooms in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, etc, as well as worldwide in more than 60 countries with over 300 sales locations, which include Germany, Japan, USA, Canada, EU and the Middle East.

Manufactured with high standards, SIRUI innovative photographic products have received numerous recognition and awards at notable international events which include the German Redot Design Awards 2018, German Design Award 2018, CES 2019 and NAB Show 2019. SIRUI greatly appreciates the ongoing support and confidence received from our customers and professional photographers.

SIRUI is committed to providing excellence in product performance and functionality. Drawing on our experience in product development, design and production, it is our goal to provide our customers with high quality innovative photographic products to advance the progress of the Imaging Industry.

story:
Emotions! is the first international photographic exhibition of Paralympic sports and its major players today.

In 2016, the Exhibition will show the works of 10 international photographers and will be held in Turin, Rio2016, and Rome.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS IMPORTANT!

Your support will help us to achieve our biggest target, to get to RIO2016 with the Exhibition and to organize and promote the workshops related to the Exhibition. Your support will help make the setting-up and the meetings become a reality.

YOU

You are a real part of our project: as a backer of EMOTIONS! you will find your name on the "special thanks" panel at the entrance to the Exhibition and you will truly be part of an amazing Project of cultural and social importance in sustaining values such as equal opportunities and achieving self-confidence through sports.

THE IMPACT

Our target is to drive positive EMOTIONS! and create curiosity about disabled people sports, a subject that still needs to be discovered and supported. The cornerstones of the Exhibition are promoting social solidarity, celebrating sports as an instrument for cooperation between people and countries, and sustaining sports as a tool for recovery for both mental and physical conditions.

THE CONTENT

30 photographs about paralympic sports and its players. Images that tell important stories about athletes or situations, from the perspective of both the athletes and the photographers. In addition, the Exhibition will also feature educational and promotional workshops.

THE PHOTOGRAPHERS

There will be 10 international photographers: Mauro Ujetto (Italy), Roberto Serratore (Italy), Laurent Bagnis (France), Lieven Coudenys (Belgium), Inge Handebrink (Holland), Marcus Hartmann (Germany), Yonathan Kellerman (Canada), Ralf Kuckuck (Germany), Luc Percival (France), and Helene Wiesenhaan (Holland).

Choose a perk for the donation, and you will receive a unique expeience in photography!

WHAT IF we don't reach the entire goal?

Don't worry, we will carry out the project anyway, using the amount we get and making changes to project's content where necessary. You will receive updates in our newsletter.

OTHER ways you can help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help: we ask you to get the word out and make noise about our campaign, using the Indiegogo share tools!

Italiano
Emotions! È la prima mostra fotografica internazionale sugli sport paralimpici ed i suoi protagonisti ai giorni nostri.

Nel 2016 esporranno 10 fotografi internazionali a Torino, Rio2016 e infine a Roma.

Il nostro obiettivo sono le EMOZIONI positive: creare un atteggiamento di curiosità nei confronti dello sport disabile, dove molto c’è ancora da scoprire e da sostenere. Promuovere l’integrazione sociale, celebrare lo sport come elemento costitutivo del dialogo e della cooperazione fra i paesi, sostenere lo sport come strumento di recupero dell’indipendenza e della fiducia a seguito di un trauma, sono i temi portanti della Mostra.

Il contenuto: 30 fotografie sugli sport paralimpici e i suoi protagonisti. Immagini con una storia importante da raccontare, dal punto di vista dell'atleta e del fotografo. Workshop formativi e divulgativi completeranno la rassegna.

I 10 fotografi internazionali: Mauro Ujetto (Italia), Roberto Serratore (Italia), Laurent Bagnis (Francia), Lieven Coudenys (Belgio), Inge Handebrink (Olanda), Marcus Hartmann (Germania), Yonathan Kellerman (Canada), Ralf Kuckuck (Germania), Luc Percival (Francia), Helene Wiesenhaan (Olanda).

IL TUO SOSTEGNO CI PERMETTERA' DI

Stampare le immagini: 30 fotografie in grande formato e in alta qualità, con il racconto delle storie che hanno portato i fotografi a cogliere quelle immagini e che ci fanno conoscere meglio gli atleti rappresentati.

Realizzare l'allestimento: creare il progetto architettonico con un carattere espositivo moderno e accattivante, dove un percorso uditivo e tattile per non vedenti verrà creato mediante la tecnologia della stampa 3D. I materiali ecologici saranno alla base del nostro allestimento. 

Fare formazione all’interno della rassegna: workshop di formazione per giornalisti sulle tematiche del rapporto fra la comunicazione aziendale e gli atleti protagonisti degli sport paralimpici e workshop sullo sport e disabilità aperti al pubblico. Incontri con le scuole e incontro con i fotografi.

Cosa succede se non raggiungeremo la somma stabilita? Non ti preoccupare, il progetto verrà realizzato in ogni caso. Con il 20% realizzeremo la Mostra solo a Torino, con il 50% la faremo anche a Roma, con il 100% riusciremo ad andare anche a Rio2016. Sarai informato sull'utilizzo dei fondi ricevuti tramite la nostra newsletter!

story:
Please note:

A number of people have informed us that the the "Back it" button is not functioning reliably on this site. If you experience any difficulties please select a "perk" to the value you would like to donate, and this should work. You do not have to accept your "perk" , of course, and we will be in touch with you after the appeal closes about this. Many thanks for your patience. We are in touch with Indiegogo about this fault in their system.

The "Network of Photographers for Palestine" is a small organisation with big ideas. We have already exhibited in Palestine, major cities in the UK and the US, the Scottish Parliament in Edinburgh, as well as small villages such as Al Mas'ra, near Bethlehem and Lochinver in the Highlands of Scotland. By showing the highest quality photography, we aim to let Palestinians  tell their own stories.  In so doing we wish  to counter prevailing  representations of Palestinians  as either "victims" or "terrorists".

Mahmoud al Kurd is indeed one of the most outstanding creative spirits in Palestinian  photography today. His unique vision has won him acclaim throughout the world. (In 2014 Mahmoud exhibited in Paris, and in 2017 he won the Karimah Aboud Photography Award). 

 We plan to host a tour of Scotland for Mahmoud in April of this year when he will be exhibiting and speaking in the three major Scottish cities of Edinburgh, Glasgow and Inverness. He will also be open to invitations from other parts of the UK after completing his Scottish tour.  

In 2016, NPP hosted a highly successful tour for the prominent photo-journalist Hamde Abu Rachme , and  we have built up extensive experience in curating exhibitions of Palestinian photography and associated events.

Cost Breakdown: However travelling to and from Gaza is not cheap. Visas have to be purchased and access is only reliably possible via Amman in Jordan at the present time.We would therefore ask you to support our attempts to raise sufficient funds to make this visit possible.

Your contributions will cover the following:

Cost of British Visa: £70

Return Travel Amman- London: £650

London-Edinburgh + return: £101

Travel costs - Scotland Tour : £200

Framing and Printing: £240

Indiegogo Costs: £200 approx.

N.B. Subsistence costs (food and accomodation) will be covered by NPP members.

Risks & Challenges:There are, of course, certain risks in funding a trip such as this. Firstly, the British visa authorities can be unreliable in granting a visa to anyone travelling from the Middle East. We  encountered this with Hamde Abu Rachme, but through persistence and political pressure we managed to prevail in the end. We are confident that Mahmoud's endorsement by three Members of the Scottish Parliament, as well as support from two local Members of Parliament in Westminster will strongly enhance his application. At this point, it is also unclear if and when the two border crossings (Erez & Rafah) will be open. However, we are informed that things have improved in this respect recently, and we hope this will continue throughout 2018. It should be noted that once a visa is issued it is highly unlikely that Mahmoud would be obstructed at Erez as negative diplomatic consequences would likely arise. 

Throughout the course of the next few months we will keep you updated on Mahmoud's progress. We will inform you when his visa has been approved, and  then when he has arrived in Jordan. After that, we will let you know when he has arrived in the UK and what dates he has selected to exhibit in Scotland.

We will also inform you if Mahmoud does not get permission to travel and give you the following options: Either we will return your donation to you in full or we will retain your donation and continue to campaign that Mahmoud should be allowed to visit the UK. The choice will be yours. Our last campaign to bring Hamde Abu Rahme to the UK was successful on the second attempt, after his first application was turned down.

We hope you will be able to help us bring this outstanding talent to the UK. His vision and skill are truly exemplary in these dark times, and a tribute to the spirit of survival typical of Palestinians today.
story_txt:

A number of people have informed us that the the "Back it" button is not functioning reliably on this site. story: I am a retired Ad executive who has always had an interest in photography. I am fortunate enough since retiring to have spent more time at my house in Columbia County New York. This campaign on Indiegogo will allow me to fund my self-publishing project. I hope you will agree that the "Sunsets" I was able to capture were so extraordinary that it would be a shame not to share them with the world at large. I hope you will contribute to my first endeavor in this medium. I have other projects in the works for example I am just finishing my next book "Autumn in New York". I hope you agree that the photographs I have included in this book are wonderful and exciting and that the perks I offer through Indiegogo are something you will value for years to come. Please share my ideas with as many of your friends and colleagues as possible. If in fact I don't reach my target in funding I intend to still go ahead and I will make up the difference in funding myself.So please help me start off on a strong footing and let there be many more images to share.

story:
The Kingdom of Original Man by Martin Dixon

My name is Martin Dixon and I am a commercial photographer based in New York City. From 2011 - 2013 I was based in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia working for a number of NGOs. While many people only know about Ethiopia from past famines and difficulties, the present reality is strikingly different. 

In the past 40 years Ethiopia has had two leaders: Mengistu Haile Mariam, a communist dictator from the Southern Amhara region and Meles Zenawi, a capitalist dictator from the Northern Tigray region. Ethiopians have never known true democracy. Instead, they are offered “restricted” democracy. Their votes aren’t counted and their disapprovals are blatantly ignored. But as one of Africa’s most populous nations, and the seat of the African Union for the past 50 years, the kettle is beginning to boil. An old and proud race of people, directly linked to the origins of our human ancestry, is growing weary and angry.

  Dissidents are arrested as terrorists, exiled or killed. The government has taken a page from George W. Bush’s Patriot Act playbook and placed nearly every aspect of civilian life under the umbrella of “anti-terrorism” legislation - thereby legalizing martial law.

  The Arab Spring uprisings have emboldened the most oppressed citizens to fight for equality and a voice in the global arena. In Ethiopia, to quash these angry mummers, all access to media is state controlled and censored for objectionable content. Opposition parties are banned under any pretext. Television news is used as state propaganda to showcase the extent to which economic greed has lowered the international rankings of major western countries like America and Spain. But criticism within Ethiopia is never tolerated. Ethiopia, the “Lion of Judah,” can do no wrong. Any attempt at transparency and accountability is a ploy to further gain foreign investments and aid.

  As a staunch ally of The United States in the War on Terror in the Horn of Africa, Ethiopia is our Christian buffer against the rising tide of Islamic militants in Somalia and the region. Ethiopia and Kenya, as well as other AU member states provide a reasonable Maginot Line along their boarder so that we don’t have to suffer the embarrassment of another “Black Hawk Down.” And for their efforts, we western nations turn a blind eye to humanitarian abuses and questionable election practices.

  Every country has a wealthy, privileged class and a poor, working class. And it would be wrong to think there is a unanimous consensus on which policies will benefit the most people and generate the most good. To those affiliated with the ruling elite, change represents a grave risk to their livelihood and economy. While the working poor desperately want income parity. Because those with the least greatly outnumber those with the most, true democracy, as practiced by the ballot, is a serious threat to the leaders and their constituents. In other words, a functioning democracy is not a universal ideal.

No one will argue that better roads are always needed, and that new luxury hotels are a boon to the tourism industry. But one must also ask who will drive on those new roads and who will stay in those luxury hotels?

  The Kingdom of Original Man is a photographic document of Ethiopia’s capital city Addis Ababa. For two years I have met and photographed these strikingly beautiful, quiet, reserved people. I have attended their wedding celebrations and their funerals. I have shared their meals and danced to their music. I even learned a little Amharic in the process.

  But most importantly, I showed my Ethiopians friends that it’s okay to poke humor at the ridiculous and the inane. And they in turn, felt free to just let go and laugh at themselves. Ethiopians want the same thing that everyone wants: to live and let live. They want to travel freely. They want to see what the world has to offer. And they want the chance to make it on their own or fail by their own to live and how to die.

  The time for a book on Ethiopia has never been better than it is now. A longstanding Prime Minister - that had no plans of ever leaving office voluntarily - has died. The elections next year are an open door for new leadership and strategic planning. But rumors abound that Azeb Zenawi, the powerful widow of Meles Zenawi, may throw her name on the ballot, thereby extending her powerful empire. The Ethiopian constitution has been amended to allow for three Deputy Prime Ministers instead of one. This does not bode well for PM Hailemariam Desalegn re-election campaign. In short, the deck is stacked against a free and fair election.

These persistent frustrations hint at an inevitable “Arab Spring” style uprising. A revolution is brewing in Ethiopia.  But as a country that does not allow public dissent, civil rebellion could lead to massive loss of life. It is my sincere belief that this book project must come to fruition and soon.

What I need to get this project launched is $18,000 subsidiary funding.

I have already been contacted by an academic publisher in the UK who is interested in doing the project. But because the book is not a very commercial project and deals with a very remote area of Africa, they don't expect enough sales to offset the cost of a large, color, coffee table book.


I have also contacted Rene Lefort, a writer with OpenDemocracy.net and Martin Schubbye, one of the Swedish journalists arrested in 2011 for entering Ethiopia illegally while reporting on Somalia. He served 14 months in prison.


These two journalists, as well as art critique writer, Robert Thill from The Cooper Union, would provide extensive references for my work as well as political context. No one has ever dared to do what I have done, openly discuss Ethiopia's political climate in an art book.


I estimate I need a minimum of $18,000 for preproduction costs and to pay my writers. I have invested thousands of dollars myself and believe that this project is of historical importance. Ethiopia may very well experience a violent revolt following the upcoming election in 2015.

The Impact

I have published a number of books in the past. My first book, Brooklyn Kings: New York City's Black Bikers was published by powerHouse Books. It was a cult classic. The MAAFA Suite was a book about the TransAtlantic Slave Trade. It was published by St. Paul's Community Baptist Church in Brooklyn, New York. My last book, Living the Spirit, was a 20 year retrospective by Ifetayo Cultural Arts Academy. They have just recently received an Arts and Culture award by the White House for their fantastic work in inner-city Brooklyn.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute funding, please spread the word or invite me to speak at universities or colleges. As the saying goes, "freedom isn't free." I enjoy my life in America and have photographed in 29 countries. What we enjoy here is the envy of many other societies. We must continue to lead by example.

story:
THROTTLE MERCHANTS MAG - VOL. 4

The fourth volume of our photo-book is nearly complete and ready to be published.

All issues are soft bound, with approximately 100 pages of black & white and color photos of local friends and builders in the Southern California area.

Visit www.throttlemerchantsmag.com to see more.

FEATURED IN VOL. 4

  • Tom & Billy Branch
  • Lucky Burton
  • Jason Cruz
  • Limeworks
  • Chris Casny
  • and more...

WHAT WE NEED

In the past, a volume has varied from 8,000 to 12,000 dollars to self publish.  We currently need about 5,000 more dollars to get this issue to the press.  We are only looking for enough funds to cover the rest of the printing costs.  We continue to promise a new issue to our followers, only to come up short financially.  Everyone that donates is helping us to get this culture further exposed and appreciated.

WHO ARE WE?

All photographs are shot by Matt Porter & Aileen Aquino-- two self-taught 20 something year-old photographers from Los Angeles, Calif. We work as much as we can so we can stay creative on the time we have off.  We created the original issue from a simple idea and as many contacts as we had in the hot rod industry.  We have learned a lot along the way and are still grateful for those original people who believed in us and helped us accomplish our goal.

We invest a lot of our time making contacts, setting up shoots, editing, and doing layout during our spare time and weekends.  We have met so many wonderful people along the way that we otherwise would have never made contact with.

To us, this is how we break up the monotony of life.  It doesn't pay the rent, but it fuels a passion and we have come to realize that the things we do for little financial profits seem to be the things we are most proud of.  That's what this is all about.  

 After being in a relationship for six and half years, a lot of things have changed in our lives, but we continue to agree that this is something we truly enjoy and as long as good people like you continue to support us, we will continue to put out issues.  Thanks for everything!

A PREVIEW OF OUR PAST ISSUES

story:
Hi!  My name is John Beaudine.  I am a photographer residing in Fargo, ND.  Some of my work has been featured in a few juried shows around the country.  Most recently at 1650 Gallery in Los Angeles.  I aim to start getting my work recognized around the Fargo area this year.   

I just started a new job at one of the local TV stations as a production assistant.  Since a production assistant is pretty much an entry level position, money is tight for me at the moment.  This campaign is to help raise funds for new photography supplies.  There are a few art galleries in Fargo that I am applying for to be a member.  If this happens, I will finally have the opportunity to display my work within this area.  For professional reasons, one of the requirements is to have a few of my works printed and framed.  Most of my material like mat board and frames were used up last year.  

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Anyone who is an artist knows that supplies are not cheap.  Not to mention getting your work out there for others to see.  My goal is $750.  The majority of the funding will go towards:

  • Mat Board
  • Printer Ink
  • Paper
  • Frames
  • Glass

Any of the leftover funds will be set towards entry fees for juried shows that I plan to submit my work to within the next few months.     

If I do not reach my goal, whatever funds I receive will help with purchasing a few of the supplies.  The main focus more than likey is the mat board and frames.  My personal goal to get my work framed and presented to the galleries sometime in early in May.  

The Impact

It is not easy for an artist to get their work out there.  If the goal is reached AND I am accepted into one of the galleries, then I have a chance to showcase my work to many people.  And if my work can make an impression on at least one person, then I know I've done a great job.  

Perks

Any contribution you make to this campaign will have its unique rewards. You will receive a personal thanks via email or hand written.  You may even receive a personal print signed by yours truly.  There's also an opportunity, if you live in or around this area, to have a personal photo shoot with me.  The most generous donors will receive two prints, 11 x 14 and/or 16 x 20, signed AND framed.  

Keep in mind though that some of the perks may take extra time to arrive to your home.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate any money, you can easily spread the word about this campaign by posting about it on your Facebook page or Twitter.  Believe me, any word of mouth about this cause would mean so much.  

Thank you for taking the time to come view this page!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal. story:
Our Story

Hello, I am Lee Klawans. I have been photographing live bands, models, and weddings in Chicago for the last 10 years.  A few years ago, I started a project to have a gallery show of pictures of brides in unexpected public locals. Most of the brides are my musician friends. This is that project, it needs your help. Many more sample photos here.


The Impact

My friends are surely wondering when I am going to show the photos.  They have been collecting virtual dust in my back up drive all these years.  You can help get them out of my computer and on to the walls and my pals can see their beautiful selves in large scale photos.


What We Need & What You Get

All of the money raised will be used to print and frame the photos 20 by 30 inches. It will cost $100 dollars per picture and I will show 30 of them. If I don’t meet the goal, I will scale back the size of the prints but the show will and must go on. When you contribute, you can get the print of your choice in various sizes of any photo I own, including many local, national and international music acts or any of the bride photos.  For larger contributions you can have me shoot your wedding, your live show or any event.  (The wedding photography is a great bargain!) I’ll also do portraits, baby pictures, dog or cat sittings, and headshots.  All contributors will receive an invite for 2 people to a speacial preview opening of the show with free wine and cheese!  Some of the bands I have shot are, Wilco, Spoon, The Police, Venom Lords, Tortoise, Metric, Peaches, I Fight Dragons, Reptiods, Marnie Stern, The Goldstars, Kill Hannah, The Countdown, Black Actress, Flabby Hoffman, otter petter, Hollows, Manchester Orchestra and many, many others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell you friends!!  The wedding shoot is a great deal, lock it in now and then snare your groom.  There is no expiration date. Share this with your band friends too, they can get live professional photos for $50!

story:
Syrian Eyes of the World in Shatila, Lebanon

Syrian Eyes of the World hosted in April 2014 a photography workshop to empower young Syrian refugees in Shatila, a palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon, and we're now looking forward to exhibit these pictures. 

The impacts of the workshop itself are great: young Syrians gather, discuss and learn the art of photography.

With the possibility of exhibiting the pictures, the voices of these Syrians are heard, while social, cultural and professional bridges our built between the photographers and the world.

This is our first photography workshop, given by Antoine Entabi, a great experience. If we get more funds during this campaign, we will be hosting other workshops soon.

      Syrian Eyes of the World

      This photographic project aims to take portraits of Syrians around the world by Syrian photographers.

      Are you ready to see Syrians differently?
      syrianeyesoftheworld.com

      “My dad was a well known Syrian poet and I learned one thing from him. I learned that Syria and Arabic language are alike. Arabic language is like an ocean where every word holds a thousand meaning; therefore, it will never die, just like Syria.” -Nawras Akkam, accountant and artist

story:
Crossing Morocco’s Sahara desert by camel, hot air ballooning across the captivating fairy chimneys of Turkey’s Cappadocia, sailing through Indonesia’s thousands of islands, exploring more than 40,000 kilometres across Australia in a 4WD and chasing the stars in Canada’s extreme sub-zero temperatures.

 

Travelling is the vehicle by which we can all experience what it is to live multiple lives within the one we are given. As a travel photographer, my passion is to seek out the experiences beyond those which are given to each of us and bring them to you. I seek these out in every corner of the world, near and far, accessible or otherwise.

 

Hi! I’m am Stanley, a wanderer, an adventurer and a travel photographer.

It’s always been my dream to be able to travel the world….. Ok, I lied. There was a time where all I wanted was a big house, nice cars and branded gadgets. 

Travelling and documenting hasn’t always been my way of life. In fact, it's been less than 7 years ago since a bad break-up which sent me looking for an escape.

 

A few long weekend trips to Bali slowly evolved to a 2-week snowboarding trip to New Zealand and then a 5 week trip across Europe. Before I knew it, I was holding my resignation letter, standing outside my manager’s office. 

I found myself walking away from a great job with a good salary to take a leap of faith into the unknown. To pursue something bigger, my passion for travelling and photography. 

 

I’d come to realise that having a stable income was comfortable and perfectly fine but I wanted more than a “good enough” life. It struck me that a great life was to run towards the world out there rather than let life run away from me. 

 

I wanted to travel not to simply tick countries off a list but to experience what the world has to offer. Hiking to visit stunning lakes with glass-like reflections, embracing the chill of sub-zero temperatures while enjoying the northern lights, diving into crystal clear waters to swim with majestic whale sharks and using my photography as a medium to capture these moments and share them with the world.

 

It's not glamorous and it hasn’t been smooth sailing. I often face criticism or have my own doubts about whether I made the right decision leaving the life I had behind. I regularly consider whether I should return. However, there will be moments where I’m standing in the middle of nowhere, just me and my camera, staring up at a clear sky overwhelmed by the stars and I’m reminded why I left it all behind and that I’m exactly where I’m meant to be. 

 

After a year of capturing unique memories, I started the painstaking job of converting my passion into a sustainable lifestyle. 

 

This is where you all come in. Just in time for Christmas, I am launching a series of photography products to continue my goal of capturing and sharing the impressive beauty in the world with those that want the chance to experience these locations for themselves.

 

It took me a long time to find a manufacturer who can provide a book with the quality needed to do these images and these locations they represent, justice. They are not the cheapest, but they are what is needed to bring these pictures to life into the world has before I make it standstill. 

These books will look stunning in your home or office and are something you can be proud to own and share. Something that will look beautiful on your coffee table or in your hand as you plan your own adventure. I know that getting there yourself can be challenging where time and money are concerned. So let me take you on the wicked hunt with this series of photo books. 

 

If this is something that resonates with you help me to spread the word, by sharing and inspiring your friends and family. 

 

By purchasing these books you will help me to achieve my main goal, which is to share these moments with as many people as possible whilst simultaneously helping me to continue my journey.

 

Let these be the start of your collection as you join me in collecting your life as part of the wicked hunt! 

About the book:

The 5 different books within the series are made out of Indonesia, Western Australia, Australia, The Canadian Rockies, Canada

The books are elegant, high-end layflat photo books to make the photos to seamless throughout the pages. It is printed with rich high-density printer on 0.72 mm premium photo paper so you can be confident that it will look beautiful. 

 

You can see the trailers of the books below:

Indonesia Photobook – Java, Bali, Lombok and Flores Archipelago

7 days before my last day I had my bag packed, 3 hours after I stepped out of the refinery for one last time I was catching a flight to Jakarta. When I left my goal was to explore one place deeper, instead of ticking through countries and I want to experience a deeper connection to the country.

I spent 2 months driving from the Capital city of Jakarta to East Java, cross the water to Bali and Lombok. This photobook will capture the beautiful tropic landscapes during my trip from Jakarta to Lombok as well as from my previous trip in Flores Archipelago. During this time we explore volcanos, paddy fields, beautiful pristine waters and much more.

 

 

Australia Photobook – 40,000 km in 4 months Around Australia

When I got back to Perth, I quickly plan for my trip around Australia Continent. Starting in Perth, Western Australia, we drove on my trusted Mitsubishi Triton towards North. We explore many different spots along the west coast, from the desert, beautiful orange cliffs, white sands beaches, narrow gorges and I even got the opportunity to swim with the whale sharks. It took us about a month to explore Western Australia.

Then we continued to Northern Territory visiting the two national parks, Leitchfield national park and Kakadu national park. Then I cross my way to Queensland where I drove thousands of km on corrugated gravel roads, passing through countless river crossing to reach the northernmost part of Australia.

From there we continue south towards Tasmania while we stop along the way. Some of the most memorable stops are Diving in Yongala shipwreck, sailing in Whitsunday, exploring the great ocean roads and much more. From Tasmania, we drove to the Red Center, where the most iconic rock is located, Uluru. We spent days exploring the canyons and the famous landscapes on a 50 deg C weather.

From there I drove 24 hours straight to go back to Perth passing through the Outback way (a shortcut road that was historically used to cross from North of Queensland to Western Australia).

 

 
Canada Photobook – Vancouver, Yellowknife and the Canadian Rockies
 
In January 2019 I started my journey in Canada. We flew across the world to chase the snow and the Northern Lights. We arrived in Vancouver and spent time exploring the city and the surroundings. From there we flew to Yellowknife where we experience an extreme change of weather. From 40 deg C summer in Perth to -53 deg C cold winter in Yellowknife. We spent 10 days where we were blessed with Aurora Borealis dancing in the sky for every single night we were there.
 
In April, I moved to Lake Louise in the heart of the Canadian Rockies. Since then I’ve been exploring countless hiking trails, lakes and mountains to fully experience the beautiful Canadian Rockies.

story:
About Me

My name is Amanda Fehring and I am a photographer living in New York City.  My husband and I have lived here for two years.  This remarkable place has been called the center of the universe, and rightfully so.  It is an inspiring, yet incredibly daunting and hectic place to live: the exact opposite of where I'm from.  I originally fell in love with the art of photography watching my mother shoot the incredibly beautiful landscapes in my native Montana.  I gave up the serenity that was plentiful and taken for granted, for the pursuit of dreams.  I have found this city an extraordinary place to capture moments and after comparing various images from my past I couldn't help but notice subtle and poetic connections between the two opposite worlds.  Visual comparisons of natural beauty and beauty created by humanity can be a scintillating experience.

I have created a show using landscapes and cityscape, paired in ways that reveal the  beauty of the moment while complimenting and teaching one and the other.  By donating to my campaign you will be bringing my vision to life and allowing the public and the world see what I have created with the help of the Atlantic Gallery in Chelsea.

What I Need and How You Will Benefit

Here's how you dear people can help!

  • It is my goal to raise $2500!  This sum will cover the costs of:
  •  Membership at Atlantic Gallery, in Chelsea
  • The cost of a 1 Month Exhibition in the space
  • The cost of Printing and Framing for the exhibition

By donating you not only get listed as a permanent donor on my website, to show my appreciation and gratitude you also get a personal invitation to the exhibition opening!  There are other perks too!

If the full goal isn't reached, the money that is will go directly to the Membership and as much of the exhibition costs as possible.

The Impact

In June, I sent my materials to galleries all over the City and the Tri-state area and have received lots of wonderful feedback and lots of interest in my work.  One of the interested parties was the Atlantic Gallery. This campaign will start the ball rolling, get my name and work out there, and show who I am and what I am capable of! 

Risks & Challenges

This exhibit and through it, the start of achieving my dreams would be impossible without you.  The costs of this city can inhibit established artists as much as new but with your help, I know this can come to fruition.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't donate, I so greatly appreciate the time you took to read about my campaign and my work.

    • If you like what you see, tell your friends and family, tell your co-workers, use social media!  Your help would mean the world to me!
    • There are handy-dandy tools build right into the Indiegogo website!

story:
Bring on the Heroes !

Why take on this HUGE idea? Well, we all love SuperHeroes and what better way then to get them all into one EPIC Photo Shoot!  Some of your favourite characters from the Avengers, Xmen & The Justice League will be brought together in one AWESOME Photo Shoot in Orlando, Florida.

You can view all my work here on www.facebook.com/superherophotography

This will be by far the BIGGEST & most EPIC SuperHero shoot to date !

HEROES INCLUDE:

Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern

Captain America, Ironman, Black Widow, Spiderman, Thor

Wolverine, Gambit, Rogue, Cyclops

This is where we NEED YOU !

To make this project work we will need a degree of funding to ensure that this is one of the best SuperHero Photo Shoots created this Decade!

The funding will cover Production costs, equipment & studio hire, costume/prop additions, accomodation and printing.

We have some AMAZING perks including signed photos, Behind The Scenes DVD, Tshirts, Paperback book & Limited Edition Hardback book

The SuperHero Impact

This will surely resonate through the costuming/cosplay/superhero community as one of the biggest Photo Shoots this year. Everyone is buzzing about the movies of 2012, Avengers, Dark Knight, Spiderman and so on.

What better way to pay homage to this by creating something that will be monumental.

SuperHero Sharing

Even if you can't help by funding you can help by sharing the Project Link on your Facebook page, Twitter and any Social Media.

Thank you for your time in helping us make a little bit of SuperHero History !!!
