story:
Hello everyone ! We are Bogdan Boghitoi and Sorin Vidis, two guys who at some point in their life fell in love with documentary photography and teamed up to practice it in our way. In this fast paced digital age, we take our time to explore the world in depth by engaging into long term-projects that we photograph on film. The present photobook is the direct outcome of our slow approach to tell the story of the practice of a sport that seems almost obsolete.

What is oina?

Imagine baseball being played with the same passion, but with the purity money and fame preclude. Imagine it not being the very visible sport of the world nation always  in limelight. Imagine it rather as the well-kept secret of a little-known country, somewhere in Eastern Europe. Imagine it also not as one of the most important sports there, but being barely known even in Romania, where it was born. Now you’re closer to getting a better picture about oina.

No, oina is not baseball. But it is as real as baseball. And yes, in certain respects it verily looks like baseball. This has prompted many to argue that it is its ancestor. It is an old sport. Nevertheless, few have even the slightest idea about it, even in Romania, where it faded away from public consciousness. But there are people who still practice it. And they do it with fervour. We followed them even in the most remote corners of Romania, and we discovered a world and a game that fascinated us.

After two years of labor and amazing discoveries, we put together a photographic book about the life of this ancient sport. This was the goal of the photojournalistic project we started in 2014. We self funded our project so far, we sometimes found wonderful and talented people to help us with important things, from providing us with contacts to creating the layout of the book. What we need from you now is support for us to give physicality to this amazing story. Help us print our book and you will become one of the few connoisseurs in the world of a sport that might otherwise be forgotten, like it has never existed.

What We Need & What You Get

The necessary amount was tailored around a rather small run of 300 books quotation that we got from the best printing house in Bucharest, that delivers state of the art books with the utmost care and proficiency. All of the funding is intended to go towards printing the book and fulfilling the contributor's perks.

We have designed the available perks for people that resonate with our passion and appreciate our efforts, for photography lovers, avid explorers of the underground or for people who just want to reach out and help.

All of the next perks contain one or more of the following: Oina - photo-book signed by the authors, carefully crafted post-cards with the caption of the photo and a thank you note from us and also a limited number of hand made (obviously) silver gelatin prints featuring images from the project.

If our campaign doesn’t make it above that mark, it will not mean that the book won’t be printed. It will mean that it will have a smaller print run or depending on the achieved level we may revert to one of our next in the line print houses quotations. A 5000 usd or above means first and foremost more copies.

The Impact

You may want to take a look on the project's website http://oina-project.ro or our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/oinaproject.

Media featuring our project:

http://viewfind.com/story/oina-project

http://www.oitzarisme.ro/2016/03/16/bogdan-boghitoi-and-sorin-vidis-oina-project/

http://www.feeder.ro/2015/11/19/oina/

http://www.vice.com/ro/read/oina-este-o-traditie-romaneasca-ce-prinde-la-femei-la-fel-de-bine-ca-ia-473

http://adevarul.ro/news/societate/foto-sportul-national-romaniei-unul-probabil-n-ai-auzit-mai-practica-oina-e-universul-ei-1_5537c02fcfbe376e35723ea4/index.html

http://www.re-forma.ro/sorin-vidis-bogdan-boghitoi-cel-mai-frumos-sport-proiectul-fotografic-oina-o-discutie/

http://www.vice.com/ro/read/oina-a-fost-aleasa-sportul-national-al-romaniei-dar-putini-romani-stiu-ce-i-asta-535

http://www.iqads.ro/articol/37090/bogdan-boghitoi-si-sorin-vidis-oina-project-am-vrut-sa-vedem-cum-arata-tara-asta

 

Also you may be interested in our previous work:

http://www.featureshoot.com/2014/04/sorin-vidis/#!FEBgN

http://viewfind.com/story/what-to-expect-when-you-are-expecting-in-transylvania-music-festival

http://petapixel.com/2014/04/27/people-pit-captures-disappearing-community-outskirts-bucharest/

http://www.odcloneno.com/blog/2015/2/interview-fotograf-sorin-vidis-pouzivat-fotoaparat-leica-zbran-dokumentarni-fotografie

http://edgeofhumanity.com/2015/10/22/bosnia/

http://www.antlerpress.co.uk/sorin.html

http://viewfind.com/story/the-last-people-of-the-pit

Risks & Challenges

Besides meeting the campaign's goal, that we believe we have already clarified, our next risk that comes to mind would be the fulfillment of the contributor's perks within the set deadline.

We have taken into account various delays that might incur from printing house overload to postal misfortune or bad weather. This is why we have delayed the delivery to March 2017. So, your package may very well get to you sooner.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you still like our project but you just don't feel like contributing or even if you've already did, please get the word out by means of sharing thus caring and also by word of mouth. Tell your colleagues, your brothers and sisters, your friends and family and even your worst enemies - they may be of great value to us.

Thank you for your help !

Bogdan&Sorin
story_txt: Hello everyone ! We are Bogdan Boghitoi and Sorin Vidis, two guys who at some point in their life fell in love with documentary photography and teamed up to practice it in our way. In this fast paced digital age, we take our time to explore the world in depth by engaging into long term-projects that we photograph on film. The present photobook is the direct outcome of our slow approach to tell the story of the practice of a sport that seems almost obsolete.What is oina?Imagine baseball being played with the same passion, but with the purity money and fame preclude. Imagine it not being the very visible sport of the world nation always  in limelight. Imagine it rather as the well-kept secret of a little-known country, somewhere in Eastern Europe. Imagine it also not as one of the most important sports there, but being barely known even in Romania, where it was born. Now you’re closer to getting a better picture about oina.No, oina is not baseball. But it is as real as baseball. And yes, in certain respects it verily looks like baseball. This has prompted many to argue that it is its ancestor. It is an old sport. Nevertheless, few have even the slightest idea about it, even in Romania, where it faded away from public consciousness. But there are people who still practice it. And they do it with fervour. We followed them even in the most remote corners of Romania, and we discovered a world and a game that fascinated us.After two years of labor and amazing discoveries, we put together a photographic book about the life of this ancient sport. This was the goal of the photojournalistic project we started in 2014. We self funded our project so far, we sometimes found wonderful and talented people to help us with important things, from providing us with contacts to creating the layout of the book. What we need from you now is support for us to give physicality to this amazing story. Help us print our book and you will become one of the few connoisseurs in the world of a sport that might otherwise be forgotten, like it has never existed.What We Need & What You GetThe necessary amount was tailored around a rather small run of 300 books quotation that we got from the best printing house in Bucharest, that delivers state of the art books with the utmost care and proficiency. All of the funding is intended to go towards printing the book and fulfilling the contributor's perks.We have designed the available perks for people that resonate with our passion and appreciate our efforts, for photography lovers, avid explorers of the underground or for people who just want to reach out and help.All of the next perks contain one or more of the following: Oina - photo-book signed by the authors, carefully crafted post-cards with the caption of the photo and a thank you note from us and also a limited number of hand made (obviously) silver gelatin prints featuring images from the project.If our campaign doesn’t make it above that mark, it will not mean that the book won’t be printed. It will mean that it will have a smaller print run or depending on the achieved level we may revert to one of our next in the line print houses quotations. story:
Greetings!

Thanks for checking out Pacific Wonderland. My name is Tom Moon. I am a landscape photographer. This is my second Indiegogo project. I will be creating a photo book of Oregon and pictures framed on wood available through 5/9/2014. 

You only live once, and for me, this second project is about giving my heart to something completely. I decided in January to use all of my available savings to start building my photo business. This involved setting up my website, paying for marketing, software, a studio space, and office/camera equipment. 

Over the past four years, I have traveled on many unpaved roads in the state. I’ve seen so many places that are too surreal to describe accurately, or fairly, with words. With my photo book, my goal is to give you the essence of this state, a place with almost unending varied landscapes and places to experience entirely on your own.

Sample of the cover page for Pacific Wonderland:


With this book, we will travel up and down the rugged Oregon Coast. We’ll cross through the Cascades, Crater Lake, to the deserts and alkali lakes of eastern Oregon. Then, we will visit Hells Canyon and the Eagle Cap Wilderness in the northeast part of the state, with many places in between.

In addition to creating this book, I am setting out to build a career with my photography and my goal is to share that with as many people as possible. I cannot do this on my own. With your help and my passion for seeing this through, we can make it happen.

More about Pacific Wonderland and why I am doing this project:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T5O50OuLhro


Example of Wood Panels for Sale to the right >>>>

Full list - http://thomasmoonphoto.com/etsy.htm


Friends and family have encouraged me as I took this professional risk, following my heart with no guarantee of success. I have discovered that, as tomorrow is guaranteed to no one, I must make it my mission today to share with others the remarkable sights I have seen throughout Oregon. This is my calling.

I am in touch with a publisher to print Pacific Wonderland. For my first project, I sold 100 copies of Crossing The Arctic Circle. I am offering my second book at a lower cost, assuming I can reach 150 people. If I do not, I will have to assume the added cost which is about 25% more, so there is a substantial risk involved. Anything you can do to share this project is greatly appreciated. 

I have started the process of putting a photo book together with pictures I have taken all across the state. I am aiming for it to be finished sometime in May. My goal is to eventually get to the point that I can invest in new equipment to take my work to the next level and I have begun the process of sharing my work in public spaces. 

Many Oregonians I meet, some of whom have lived here over sixty years, have never seen entire sections of this astonishing state, places that literally take one’s breath away. I love Oregon more every day and with my book I hope you will get a chance to see why. You could literally spend your entire life in this state and never find all of the hidden spots that are so amazing. If I can share a small fraction of those places with you, I will be so happy.

Other Ways to Help:

Like/Share/Follow these pages:

ETSY SHOP: https://www.etsy.com/shop/TomMoonPhoto?ref=si_shop#

Facebook Photo page. https://www.facebook.com/tommoonphoto

Pacific Wonderland page: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pacific-wonderland/x/3770852

Instagram : Instagram.com/tommoonphoto

I look forward to sharing more with you soon! Thanks for your support. 

Warm regards,

Tom Moon

story:
A gift to my fillyfans, old and new!

This came about through my tumblogs, which are mostly occupied with pony fan art. Pix of the mod (me!) were quite appreciated and we decided why not raise more money and use it to take even more (and better) pix? The sky is the limit, wheee!

What I Need & What You Get

Well...

  • I need a new camera. I really, really can't be taking the quality of pictures I want with a phone or webcam. I don't need a superduper DSLR, just a compact camera will do, but the more money raised, the better!
    EDIT: a new camera has been donated to the cause! So the money will be going to...
  • Outfits and cosplay accessories! Will need some decent locations and lighting, though that can be gotten on the cheap. Again, the more money raised, the better and more elaborate we can get!
  • In return, there are all kinds of goodies you can get for supporting this project.
  • AND EVERYBODY GETS A DIGITAL COPY OF THE FOLIO NO MATTER WHAT YOU DONATE! Generosity is magic and besides, I want to thank my fans!
  • Even if I don't raise all of my admittedly low goal, it will be spent on making the folio. Getting the camera is the main priority.
  • But the more money raised, the better stuff we get.

The Folio will:

  • Reward my fans, old and new
  • Improve the world of pony fans, cosplay and pin-ups at once, yeah, that's modest.
  • Make my tumblr even more exciting.
  • We'll have tons of FUN!
  • And y'all get goodies!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Signal boost the folio on tumblr by reblogging.
  • Discuss the project via tumblr asks
  • And if you donate money you can even determine what goes in the folio!

x0x0x0x Selina

story:
To find and foster the adventurer in each child by giving her/him a glimpse of the vibrant arts and cultures of our universe.

And for that, we have created a playful, interactive and educational travel book, for kids and dreamers, that will help children discover the wonders of the world.

Our first edition? India!

My name is Mathieu and I am 26 years old. 

3 years ago, I finished my MBA and MSc in Entrepreneurship from EDHEC Business School (France). I accepted a job with a large company as a Strategy Analyst. They posted me at their office in Mumbai, India. And, ever since, my life has taken some surprising turns. 

As a Frenchman, I was amazed by the colours of Indian culture. In one short year, I learned so many fascinating things. My experiences led me to contemplate the value of Beluga's journey more, with each passing rickshaw. 

I have always been passionate about education and travel, and it seemed like a perfect time to test my convictions.

So I quit my job and decided to pursue 'Beluga - The Travel Book for Little Adventurers' full time. 6 months later, after all the awe inspiring places I've seen, and beautiful faces I've encountered, I know, without a doubt, that sharing these experiences with children will enrich their perspective. I am confident enough in the project to invest my savings, and now, I’m turning to the IndieGoGo community to raise the added funds I need to make this a reality.

3 years ago, I used to babysit a little girl. She always had more questions than I had answers. Once, when she wanted to know about the pyramids in Egypt, she impatiently told me my responses weren't good enough. 

So she gave me her favourite toy, a cute little lamb, and made me promise to show her the world through the eyes of her sheep. That’s how my adventures with Beluga began...


I kept my promise and started writing the ‘Diary of a Travelling Sheep’, chronicling her discoveries in France, Belgium, Italy or Spain. Every time we returned from one of our trips, I would read the diary to the little girl and show her pictures of all the places we’d visited. With each chapter, she learnt something new and beautiful. And she would always listen to each story and keenly study each picture with a S-M-I-L-E on her face. 

Beluga made it possible for her to travel the world without leaving her bedroom.

Today, we want to share Beluga's adventures with thousands of children around the world.

The same way adults refer to their travel guides for information, Beluga's Travel Book allows children to explore new places, discover new cultures and have fun while they learn.

Beluga's Travel Book helps the reader to discover a culture through descriptions of people, language, cuisine, notable sights such as monuments, religious institutions, natural wonders, and countless others.

For example, if a child is ‘visiting’ Ladakh, he can flip to that chapter and learn that most people there are Buddhist (and what that means), that ‘Hello’ in Ladakhi is ‘Julley’, that most people eat Momos, that the Shanti Stupa symbolises peace and that The Himalayas are the World’s Tallest Mountain Range.

The Travel Book is playful

With illustrations, children can colour in the pictures of Beluga with a wise monk in his Maroon robes.

With quizzes and games, they can complete – 6 Across; How do you say ‘Hello’ in Ladakhi (5 letters). 

With cultural challenges, they can ‘Make a paper replica of the spiritual flags’.

There are countless such activities for little explorers.

The Travel Book is interactive

If we reach our strech goal, a website and an app will be developed to allow children access maps and click on a state for more detailed information on each subject and a wider selection of activities. Most importantly, they can join the ‘Comm-ewe-nity’ and connect with a network of other 'little adventurers'. 

Humans learn from interactions, and we believe this will multiply the opportunities to learn and adventure for each child. Kids love sharing their stories, experiences, itineraries, and travel tips!

'The Travel Book for Little Adventurers' allows readers to interact with their ‘foreign’ surroundings in a way they can enjoy. 

If children eventually visit India, they'll get more involved in the process, thanks to the ewe-some knowledge they get from Beluga.

We want to show children how spectacularly diverse the world can be so that they can dream! So they can grow up to be adventurers who appreciate diversity as a positive thing.

Francis Bacon said, ‘Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education’.

This is truer today than ever before because:

1. We belong to an increasingly interconnected world, where children need to learn to socialize with others from different cultures.

2. Exploring new places may help children find a life-long passion, for example, they may see Beluga playing a ‘tabla’ and decide to learn the Indian drum.

3. The absolutely most important reason and one closest to my heart is – 'Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all people cry and laugh, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends'… Maya Angelou

In a time when kids are exposed to so much negativity, most of which results from misconceptions and a lack of understanding of other cultures, we want to offer a new generation of children the opportunity to empathize with and appreciate one another. To become FRIENDS.

With Beluga as their travel and learning buddy, we want to empower children to:

1. Create friend-sheeps

2. Step out of their comfort zone

3. Adopt a global perspective

4. Celebrate cultural differences

So that they become thoughtful global citizens and embrace education as an adventure.

Beluga and I met many young children, a beautiful coincidence during our travels, who we know you would be inspired by too. There are so many children who lack the opportunities to exercise their potential. 

Art Culture Education (ACE) is the French not-for-profit organization I founded to make Beluga reach out to these kids and make them smile too. Combining elements of history, geography and art, ACE endeavours to organize workshops around India to open children’s minds, foster their creativity, discover and nurture their latent talents.

The proceeds from the sales of ‘'Beluga - The Travel Book for Little Adventurers’, the India Edition, will go towards a project that empower these children. Like our photography workshop at the Ladakh Arts and Media Organization which uncovered some beautiful photographers among kids who had never used a camera before! Our long term goal is to connect them with Beluga’s other #littleadventurers and create pen pals among vastly different children.


For $16,000, we will be able to complete and publish the book, so you can discover India through the eyes of a sheep by Fall 2015.

For $30,000, our first stretch goal, we will be able to launch our website and app.


More funds will enable us to add features to the website that will make our ‘network’ more interactive for the #littleadventures, with platforms to share wishlists, photos, and so so much more!

Beluga has created a collection of merchandise exclusively for our Indiegogo donators. 
SHEEPING FEES INCLUDED FOR ALL PERKS

***********************************

***********************************

***********************************

***********************************

***********************************

***********************************

***********************************


***********************************

***********************************



Our main constraint is time. The goal is to have the book and website ready by Fall 2015 so that you can receive it by Diwali (read the Book to know more :)) and Christmas. We have worked extremely hard on the content, but we want to do extensive beta tests to ensure that children understand and engage with the character, the way the information is presented and the level of difficulty of the interactive elements. We anticipate that this shouldn’t be a problem, and are fully committed to making this project a lambtastic success! We just want ewe to know so that you can suggest ways in which we may overcome the hurdle, should we face it.


Share our adventure, talk about us! 

We want to reach as many people as possible, so we need you to spread the message! 

Post on Facebook, Tweet us, and tell everyone you know (and even those you don’t) about our mission and our journey! 

Together, let’s empower kids to be thoughtful global citizens!

The same way adults refer to their travel guides for information, Beluga's Travel Book allows children to explore new places, discover new cultures and have fun while they learn.
Beluga's Travel Book helps the reader to discover a culture through descriptions of people, language, cuisine, notable sights such as monuments, religious institutions, natural wonders, and countless others.



For example, if a child is ‘visiting’ Ladakh, he can flip to that chapter and learn that most people there are Buddhist (and what that means), that ‘Hello’ in Ladakhi is ‘Julley’, that most people eat Momos, that the Shanti Stupa symbolises peace and that The Himalayas are the World’s Tallest Mountain Range.



The Travel Book is playful


With illustrations, children can colour in the pictures of Beluga with a wise monk in his Maroon robes.
With quizzes and games, they can complete – 6 Across; How do you say ‘Hello’ in Ladakhi (5 letters). 
With cultural challenges, they can ‘Make a paper replica of the spiritual flags’.
There are countless such activities for little explorers.




The Travel Book is interactive

If we reach our strech goal, a website and an app will be developed to allow children access maps and click on a state for more detailed information on each subject and a wider selection of activities. Most importantly, they can join the ‘Comm-ewe-nity’ and connect with a network of other 'little adventurers'. 


Humans learn from interactions, and we believe this will multiply the opportunities to learn and adventure for each child. Kids love sharing their stories, experiences, itineraries, and travel tips!  



'The Travel Book for Little Adventurers' allows readers to interact with their ‘foreign’ surroundings in a way they can enjoy. 
If children eventually visit India, they'll get more involved in the process, thanks to the ewe-some knowledge they get from Beluga.


We want to show children how spectacularly diverse the world can be so that they can dream! So they can grow up to be adventurers who appreciate diversity as a positive thing.



Francis Bacon said, ‘Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education’.
This is truer today than ever before because:
1. We belong to an increasingly interconnected world, where children need to learn to socialize with others from different cultures.
2. Exploring new places may help children find a life-long passion, for example, they may see Beluga playing a ‘tabla’ and decide to learn the Indian drum.
3. The absolutely most important reason and one closest to my heart is – 'Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all people cry and laugh, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends'… Maya Angelou



In a time when kids are exposed to so much negativity, most of which results from misconceptions and a lack of understanding of other cultures, we want to offer a new generation of children the opportunity to empathize with and appreciate one another. To become FRIENDS.
With Beluga as their travel and learning buddy, we want to empower children to:
1. Create friend-sheeps
2. Step out of their comfort zone
3. Adopt a global perspective
4. Celebrate cultural differences
So that they become thoughtful global citizens and embrace education as an adventure.




Beluga and I met many young children, a beautiful coincidence during our travels, who we know you would be inspired by too. There are so many children who lack the opportunities to exercise their potential. 


Art Culture Education (ACE) is the French not-for-profit organization I founded to make Beluga reach out to these kids and make them smile too. Combining elements of history, geography and art, ACE endeavours to organize workshops around India to open children’s minds, foster their creativity, discover and nurture their latent talents.



The proceeds from the sales of ‘'Beluga - The Travel Book for Little Adventurers’, the India Edition, will go towards a project that empower these children. Like our photography workshop at the Ladakh Arts and Media Organization which uncovered some beautiful photographers among kids who had never used a camera before! Our long term goal is to connect them with Beluga’s other #littleadventurers and create pen pals among vastly different children. 











For $16,000, we will be able to complete and publish the book, so you can discover India through the eyes of a sheep by Fall 2015.
For $30,000, our first stretch goal, we will be able to launch our website and app.


More funds will enable us to add features to the website that will make our ‘network’ more interactive for the #littleadventures, with platforms to share wishlists, photos, and so so much more!
Beluga has created a collection of merchandise exclusively for our Indiegogo donators. SHEEPING FEES INCLUDED FOR ALL PERKS
***********************************


***********************************




***********************************





***********************************




***********************************
**********************************************************************



***********************************


***********************************










Our main constraint is time. The goal is to have the book and website ready by Fall 2015 so that you can receive it by Diwali (read the Book to know more :)) and Christmas. We have worked extremely hard on the content, but we want to do extensive beta tests to ensure that children understand and engage with the character, the way the information is presented and the level of difficulty of the interactive elements. We anticipate that this shouldn’t be a problem, and are fully committed to making this project a lambtastic success! We just want ewe to know so that you can suggest ways in which we may overcome the hurdle, should we face it.


Share our adventure, talk about us! 
We want to reach as many people as possible, so we need you to spread the message! 
Post on Facebook, Tweet us, and tell everyone you know (and even those you don’t) about our mission and our journey! 



Together, let’s empower kids to be thoughtful global citizens!

story:
Through the Looking Glass

 

In September 2014, when I arrived to Nottingham for the first time, I did not know anyone or anything at all about this place. I would spend my spare time walking through the town, exploring this space, with a particular interest in seeking out hidden alleyways – I still find them very fascinating.

Being on my own, I was trying to find a connection with people too.

Observing them from the distance, mostly through windows and mirrors and sometimes feeling jealous of these moments of their lives, at the time, the only way I could steal such moments was through my film camera.

These photos were not supposed to be displayed anywhere as I had no intention of making them into a project. In a way, they were simply research photos. I took them to get to know and understand this place and the feelings I could find here on this my new journey.

The photos were essentially taken to compensate for my sense of loneliness and to find that feeling were I could feel that I somewhat belonged or understood part of this city.

The idea of this body of work came along only recently.

I was printing photos from my films shot in 2014/15, in the Photo Parlour - Nottingham’s collective dark room. If you are passionate about analog photography, this is the place you have to know and also visit – This most inspirational place is in town near the train station and run by Dan Wheeler.

Eventually, looking through several prints, it was clear how these shots represent my feelings from my first moments in Nottingham quite well.

People working and socializing in barber shops, tea rooms and bakeries, captured along Derby Road, in Hurts Yard, along Bridlesmith Walk and more.

I used an old Praktica film camera and HP5 black & white film. All the prints are on fibre based paper.

 

I discovered photography through a friend of mine.

About four years ago, I was living in Bristol and one day I received a parcel from this friend who was then living in Paris. The content was this Praktica camera with a few black & white films and a letter. It read – this is now your camera, learn to use it!

Now, photography is more than just a hobby. It is a personal attitude, an easy way to approach people who I find interesting. People who with their stories make me discover and understand more about the world around me.

 

If I had the luxury of time and more importantly money, I would spend more time focusing on practising and developing my ideas and versatilities - especially focusing on improving my printing skills and exploring  venues who would potentially exhibit my work.

I have just started a crowdfunding page - via this link, people who like my work can support my projects to get them into venues where they will be seen.

 

Mariano Doronzo

www.marianodoronzo.com

mariano.doronzo@hotmail.com

Facebook Artistic Page: www.facebook.com/mariano.doronzo/

Personal Blog: mezzosangueblog.wordpress.com/

 

Disciplines: Photography, Writing, Poetry.

Collaboration also with several collectives:

 

  • Colectivo Bau-Bau (https://www.facebook.com/colectivobaubau/);
  • Capitolo 107 (https://www.facebook.com/capitolo107/).

 

Next Exhibition: Through the Looking Glass, The Alley Café, from 1st to 28th February 2017.

Previous Exhibition:

Learning to Fly, Paratissima Torino 2016 (IT), 2-6 Nov 2016.

Everyone – Your place in the world, Derby Museum & Art Gallery, 9 Jul – 25 Sept 2016.

story:
Hello ! 

My name is Sean; AKA THEESEANMARTIN; AKA THROUGHTHEESEYES. I'm a photographer based in Los Angeles and am here on Indiegogo to ask you for YOUR help in funding my first premium photo magazine, THROUGHTHEESEYES//VOL.1

THROUGHTHEESEYES//VOL.1 is a collection & archive of images of people, life, and moments as viewed and photographed through the eyes of THEESEANMARTIN. It's my first ever project of this sort, and I'm excited to have you along for the journey.


Why should you donate?

To help share my vision on a larger scale. With friends, family, all the people that have supported me on my journey thus far, and those who have just joined me. And why not share that in print form. A medium that will forever be my favorite.

In order to reach my goal, I need to raise $3500

Those funds will go into the printing & production process of all the magazines and the prints that come with the specified perks. 

Not only will you be helping me share my vision, but also help towards the growth of a young, future artist. 20% of all profits made on the magazine will be donated to Inner City Arts; an organization based in DTLA whose mission is to engage young people in the creative process in order to shape a society of creative, confident and collaborative individuals. 

 

Perks:

If you're able to make a donation, of course, you'll receive something in return:

$5
You will receive a Thank You Shout Out printed in the magazine.

$10
Hand written thank you card & 4x6 print
(Your choice of image available on my website shop at time of campaign completion)
+
Thank You Shout Out printed in the magazine.


$15
Digital PDF of THROUGHTHEESEYES//VOL.1
+
Hand written thank you card & 4x6 print (Your choice of image available on my website shop at time of campaign completion), Thank You Shout Out printed in the magazine.


$30
One limited print copy of THROUGHTHEESEYES//VOL.1, signed & numbered.
+
Digital PDF copy, Hand written thank you card & 4x6 print (Your choice of image available on my website shop at time of campaign completion), Thank You Shout Out printed in the magazine.


$50
One limited print copy of THROUGHTHEESEYES//VOL.1, signed & numbered
+
8" x 10" Print, signed
(Your choice of image available on my website shop at time of campaign completion)
+
All Perks above


$75
One limited print copy of THROUGHTHEESEYES//VOL.1, signed & numbered
+
16" x 20" Print, signed
(Your choice of image available on my website shop at time of campaign completion)
+
All Perks above



Other ways you can help out:
You don't have to donate to help out. If you can simply share this with a tweet, fb post, or whatever your social media outlet of choice is, I would greatly appreciate you for that.

story:
I had an exploratory meeting with Random House 3 weeks ago to discuss a book I had pitched, so for the days prior, elation was the word of the day and the meeting went better than expected, or at least better than a meeting you have without sleeping for 4 days before in anticipation of a meeting. I received the formal offer letter within a week ,but they added one extra line-actually 3 words (funny how 3 words can mean so much...but alas, these were not of the "I love you" variety and more of the "relinquish all copyrights" variety. I sensed an impending breakup was required after we tried to reconcile, but we will always have NYC.

On the train ride home, I began to ponder "Could I just produce this myself" but then another old relationship breakup partner resurfaced...fear. Fear asked "Why would anyone buy something when almost all folks have a camera in their cell phone-what make's your work different, Ms. "Too Big for Your Britches"? Fear can really be a buzzkill-no wonder I needed to part with him- he literally smothered me at times. Yet, when I am reviewed either in a exhibition or a printed client word, the common thread is often that people "feel my work"-an emotion is generated. To me, that is the only thing I wish for-to allow the subject to be true to self enough that I can portray that spark...that essence. Whether it be composed from clay, wood, mire, voice, celluloid, paint, an instrument/s or an image, they all have the ability to make us feel-a direct shot to the soul. As artists, that is truth.

So instead of belonging to suits on 5th avenue whose faces look as though their shoes are on too tight, this project will belong directly to the people by the people- fellow humans- those who inspire and write their own life compositions daily.  And I will bleed so not to fail any of you-of that, I will promise. So, won't you join me for an adventure?

story:
Hello. My name is Gonchigsuren. Greetings from Mongolia.

I have been working as a professional photographer for almost 40 years.

Over that time I have worked at a daily newspaper and as a free photographer.

For the last two years, I have created a historical photo book of my 40th years anniversary and now that book dummy is ready

This book is reflected the reality of everyday life of Mongolia. One feature is of this book is showing the difference between  daily lives in socialism and democracy.

Generally, this book reflected Mongolian social life, naadam festival, sport and political and historical figures.

I am planning my first book opening and the exhibition of my collection on November, 2016.

Before the photography exhibition, I am preparing to have a photography contest among young photographers around Mongolia and the winner will be participated in a photography exhibition with me.  In the photography exhibition, not only my collection, but also all documentary photographers’ collection will give us an opportunity to compare the rarity of different generations.

I will present all photographies of the exhibition on online.

I really want you and all my friends who interested in photography to support my book project.

My collection and production truly reflects my dedication and heart.

I hope you will enjoy, I wish you all the best.

ABOUT THE BOOK:

Hardcover 10" x 8", 100 pages, 600 Copies

156 B&W photographs by Gonchigsuren Vanchin


Some photography from my book

Life style:

Naadam festival:

People and Portrait

Parade:

Sports:

Other:

Thank you so much for looking at my project

story:
Short Summary

Live Your Dream is an International Photography Exhibition on May 9th – June 24th that celebrates the passion for photography in our communities. Santiago de Chile.

Every big project starts with an idea. Turning that idea into reality is almost always harder than it looks. The project is divided into 5 parts – chapters.

Note: we do not sell the works, but we can contact you with the photographer, if you want to get some images, just contact Hanna at arthannna@gmail.com.

Chapter One: “Connection”

First, you have to put yourself in the place to receive the truth. We live in an extremely noisy world with all kinds of frequencies coming at us - commitments, deadlines, fix this, do that, plans, expectations - and they all make it hard to get clarity and peace of mind. So you have to consciously put yourself in a place to receive that clarity.

Find that time to be in a place to receive the truth, where you do not have to look over your shoulder because you are too busy to see life, to see the world. Find your right connection. 

Chapter Two: “Reflection”

Life is not easy. Do not try to make it that way. It's not fair, it never was, it isn't now, it won't ever be. Do not fall into the entitlement trap of feeling you are a victim, you are not. Get over it and get on with it. And yes, most things are more rewarding, when you break a sweat to get them. 

Nothing in your life is not a reflection of who you are.

Chapter Three: “Willpower”

You are going to have some ups, and you are going to have some downs. Most people give up on themselves easily. You know the human spirit is powerful? There is nothing as powerful - it is hard to kill the human spirit. It takes courage to act. At the end of your feelings is nothing, but at the end of every principle is a promise. Do not allow your emotions to control you. We are emotional. And if you do not discipline and contain your emotions, they will use you. 

Live your life with passion! With some drive.

Chapter Four: “Ability”

​A lot of things that we want to do, a lot of places we would love to go, a lot of things we would love to experience, we just stop at 'but'. 'But' will cause you to hide out behind fear, 'but' will cause you to come up will all types of excuses that you can validate your inaction. 'But' is a dream-killer.  A lot of people say 'no' to things, and they do not even know, what they are saying 'no' to! Do not allow 'but' to keep you in the corner.  Do what you can, where you are with that you have, and never be satisfied. I want to know you for your ability, not your disability.  

Chapter Five: “Hero”

You are not only a special person created at a special time - you have some special inside you. If you going to win the fight of your life, you can't be afraid to fight. You've gone too far to quit, you've come too far to give up. Impossible is just a big word, thrown around by small men. If you are going to fall, fall back on anything except your faith. Fall forward. You are the Hero of your own story. 

Who We Are

We are an international young team currently located in Santiago. Above all, we believe in the power of our members. We're in the business of selling pleasure. So we don't sell art or photography. We "sell" dreams.

What We Need Your Help With

Raise a minimum of $15 000 to get all 100 images printed and mounted, pre-exhibition and post-exhibition costs, work of people outside the team, promotion and etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what we do please share our story on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and any other social media you are comfortable with.

The short URL for this campaign is http://igg.me/at/live-your-dream

DON'T LET YOUR DREAM BE JUST A DREAM. LET’S TAKE A STEP NOW

Send us your Name + Dream + Good Resolution Photo of You at dreamer.chile@gmail.com.

  1. We will email a digital-photo of you with  “I AM A DREAMER” watermark. Plus, we will put this image at the exhibition on the “Wall of Dreamers”.
  2. Then we will print it out and send your Dream by post to another dreamer you don't know. Let’s inspire each other!!!

WHY: It will help you identify what is really important in your life - what you really value. You aren't just writing a dream - you are describing in detail your vision of the future for yourself. You will be then able to identify specific goals to work towards. It's in your control to work towards the things you want! Let’s do it now.

RUS: ОБЗОР

Все, что ты делаешь имеет ценность, ты автор своей истории. Не каждый будет видеть это, не каждый поддержит тебя, не каждый примет твои ценности. Но если у тебя есть мечта, мнение других не должно стать твоей реальностью. Если ты чувствуешь, тебе есть, что  сказать – живи мечтой.

“Live Your Dream” – это Международная выставка фотографии, которая пройдет 9 мая - 24 июня 2017 в Сантьяго-де-Чили. Проект состоит из 5 частей - Глав. Каждая глава – новая история.

Большой проект начинается с идеи. Превращение этой идеи в реальность почти всегда сложнее, чем это может показаться.

НЕ ПОЗВОЛЯЙ СВОЕЙ МЕЧТЕ ОСТАВАТЬСЯ ПРОСТО МЕЧТОЙ 

Отправьте нам свое Имя + Мечту + Фото себя в хорошем качестве на почтовый ящик dreamer.chile@gmail.com.

  1. Во встречном письме мы отправим вам ваше фото с водяным знаком “I AM A DREAMER” и разместим его на выставке среди других, поддержавших этот проект - «Wall of Dreamers».
  2. Затем мы распечатаем ваше фото и отправим его почтой другому мечтателю на другом конце света. Давайте же вдохновлять друг друга!!!

ЗАЧЕМ: Это поможет вам определиться, что действительно важно в вашей жизни - что действительно является вашей ценностью. Вы не просто пишете свою мечту - вы подробно описываете видение своего будущего.  Вы будете в состоянии определить конкретные цели, к которым вам нужно стремиться.  Лишь в ваших силах и под вашим контролем получить то, чего вы хотите. Давайте же сделаем это сейчас.

Live Your Dream is an International Photography Exhibition on May 9th – June 24th that celebrates the passion for photography in our communities. Santiago de Chile.
Every big project starts with an idea. Turning that idea into reality is almost always harder than it looks. The project is divided into 5 parts – chapters.
Note: we do not sell the works, but we can contact you with the photographer, if you want to get some images, just contact Hanna at arthannna@gmail.com.

Chapter One: “Connection”
First, you have to put yourself in the place to receive the truth. We live in an extremely noisy world with all kinds of frequencies coming at us - commitments, deadlines, fix this, do that, plans, expectations - and they all make it hard to get clarity and peace of mind. So you have to consciously put yourself in a place to receive that clarity.
Find that time to be in a place to receive the truth, where you do not have to look over your shoulder because you are too busy to see life, to see the world. Find your right connection. 

Chapter Two: “Reflection”
Life is not easy. Do not try to make it that way. It's not fair, it never was, it isn't now, it won't ever be. Do not fall into the entitlement trap of feeling you are a victim, you are not. Get over it and get on with it. And yes, most things are more rewarding, when you break a sweat to get them. 
Nothing in your life is not a reflection of who you are.

Chapter Three: “Willpower”
You are going to have some ups, and you are going to have some downs. Most people give up on themselves easily. You know the human spirit is powerful? There is nothing as powerful - it is hard to kill the human spirit. It takes courage to act. At the end of your feelings is nothing, but at the end of every principle is a promise. Do not allow your emotions to control you. We are emotional. And if you do not discipline and contain your emotions, they will use you. 
Live your life with passion! With some drive.
Chapter Four: “Ability”
​A lot of things that we want to do, a lot of places we would love to go, a lot of things we would love to experience, we just stop at 'but'. 'But' will cause you to hide out behind fear, 'but' will cause you to come up will all types of excuses that you can validate your inaction. 'But' is a dream-killer.  A lot of people say 'no' to things, and they do not even know, what they are saying 'no' to! Do not allow 'but' to keep you in the corner.  Do what you can, where you are with that you have, and never be satisfied. I want to know you for your ability, not your disability.  

Chapter Five: “Hero”
You are not only a special person created at a special time - you have some special inside you. If you going to win the fight of your life, you can't be afraid to fight. You've gone too far to quit, you've come too far to give up. Impossible is just a big word, thrown around by small men. If you are going to fall, fall back on anything except your faith. Fall forward. You are the Hero of your own story. 

Who We Are
We are an international young team currently located in Santiago. Above all, we believe in the power of our members. We're in the business of selling pleasure. So we don't sell art or photography. We "sell" dreams.




What We Need Your Help With
Raise a minimum of $15 000 to get all 100 images printed and mounted, pre-exhibition and post-exhibition costs, work of people outside the team, promotion and etc.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you like what we do please share our story on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and any other social media you are comfortable with.
The short URL for this campaign is http://igg.me/at/live-your-dream

DON'T LET YOUR DREAM BE JUST A DREAM. LET’S TAKE A STEP NOW
Send us your Name + Dream + Good Resolution Photo of You at dreamer.chile@gmail.com.

We will email a digital-photo of you with  “I AM A DREAMER” watermark. Plus, we will put this image at the exhibition on the “Wall of Dreamers”.
Then we will print it out and send your Dream by post to another dreamer you don't know. Let’s inspire each other!!!

WHY: It will help you identify what is really important in your life - what you really value. You aren't just writing a dream - you are describing in detail your vision of the future for yourself. You will be then able to identify specific goals to work towards. It's in your control to work towards the things you want! Let’s do it now.

RUS: ОБЗОР
Все, что ты делаешь имеет ценность, ты автор своей истории. Не каждый будет видеть это, не каждый поддержит тебя, не каждый примет твои ценности. Но если у тебя есть мечта, мнение других не должно стать твоей реальностью. Если ты чувствуешь, тебе есть, что  сказать – живи мечтой.
“Live Your Dream” – это Международная выставка фотографии, которая пройдет 9 мая - 24 июня 2017 в Сантьяго-де-Чили. Проект состоит из 5 частей - Глав. Каждая глава – новая история.
Большой проект начинается с идеи. Превращение этой идеи в реальность почти всегда сложнее, чем это может показаться.

НЕ ПОЗВОЛЯЙ СВОЕЙ МЕЧТЕ ОСТАВАТЬСЯ ПРОСТО МЕЧТОЙ 
Отправьте нам свое Имя + Мечту + Фото себя в хорошем качестве на почтовый ящик dreamer.chile@gmail.com.

Во встречном письме мы отправим вам ваше фото с водяным знаком “I AM A DREAMER” и разместим его на выставке среди других, поддержавших этот проект - «Wall of Dreamers».
Затем мы распечатаем ваше фото и отправим его почтой другому мечтателю на другом конце света. Давайте же вдохновлять друг друга!!!

ЗАЧЕМ: Это поможет вам определиться, что действительно важно в вашей жизни - что действительно является вашей ценностью. Вы не просто пишете свою мечту - вы подробно описываете видение своего будущего.  Вы будете в состоянии определить конкретные цели, к которым вам нужно стремиться.  Лишь в ваших силах и под вашим контролем получить то, чего вы хотите. Давайте же сделаем это сейчас.

story:
Please help me cover Hurricane Sandy's aftermath six months after the storm

I am gong to the New York metropolitan area from April 20-30 to do an update on Hurricane Sandy. I will be revisiting areas I photographed in the weeks after the storm hit, including Union Beach New Jersey, the Jersey shore, the Rockaways  and Breezy Point, following up with people I met in November to see how how the recovery process is going. 

I will be back in touch with with those who worked with various aid organizations including  Occupy Sandy and The Action Center in the Far Rockaways. On a recent call with Aria Dove, The Action Center's executive director, she said nothing has been learned from the lessons Hurricane Katrina taught. The Far Rockaways are New York's 9th Ward. The area lacks social services. While some post-Sandy aid trickled in, the people still lack adequate health care. The area has been left with environmental hazards as well as economic hardship. The Action Center, which has worked in the community for 12 years, has had trouble securing funding while organizations with no track record are getting money easily. "Money goes to the organizations in the wealthiest communities, not here," Dove told me. "Funding is barely touching the lives of the underserved--people of color and all those in low income brackets." 

Ron, whose family home in Union Beach, New Jersey was taken down, has been in touch with me. His mother lived across from the iconic yellow house that seemed to stand in defiance of climate change after Sandy's surge knocked half of it down. "It's still a total mess here and there's no help to be seen," he reports. "It's a joke how those millions of dollars were raised and nothing is funneling back to the town or the people." How will our society handle Climate Change, a factor that is intensifying storms, and rising tides? That Is a question that guides my photographic investigations.

As an independent photojournalist/multi media reporter, the stories I cover are all self-assigned. I'm a Jersey girl now living in New Orleans so I took Hurricane Sandy's devastation personally. I hit the road from New Orleans without an expense account or definite assignment. Once my stories are done I have to pitch my work without any guaranteed payback.There are fewer media outlets and those that remain pay less and less. One of my editors told me the bosses are taking fewer "David and Goliath" stories. I ask, "What other stories are worth telling?"  Many of my readers thank me for my work and share my stories, but I need financial support if I am to continue.  

Please contribute what you can so I can give you a week of Sandy recovery news. All money contributed will go to my travel expenses and for the work itself. If this campaign is not fully funded, I will still do the work but will be limited in my time and travel.  By funding this project you will help me bring this story to you and the rest of the world with the help of social networking. 

To see more of my work please visit my site at www.jsdart.com 

* My photographs will be made available to the Action Center for use on their site and for other fundraising Sandy aftermath causes.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Hi and thanks so much for checking out my IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign.

My name is Ian Thuillier and I am an Irish photographer from Dublin. 

In 2017 I followed the Formula 1 circus around the world as a freelance photographer for my book, The Violence of Speed.  Through my lens I captured the colour, fanfare and excitement of the world of Formula 1.  The images in the book document the speed, adrenalin, noise and excitement that make up a Grand Prix weekend.

Aside from the imagery, there are unique stories from 12 past and present Formula 1 drivers talking about their experiences in the cockpit of a Formula 1 car. 

It’s easy to forget that as we watch these cars racing around a track at 200mph, what isn't apparent is what is actually going on inside the cockpit.  Television really doesn’t convey the huge forces exerted on the drivers.

For 2 hours, a driver’s vision becomes blurred, constant vibrations travel from the steering wheel through their body, they become dehydrated and they tear muscles in their arms and neck due to the enormous g-forces. 

From Nikki Lauda in the 1970’s through to Damon Hill and Jacques Villeneuve in the 1990’s to present day drivers. I tried to get a sense of the violence of speed that drivers experience and to present the views of as many eras of F1 as possible.

WHAT YOU GET

The Violence of Speed will be printed in October 2018. This allows me time to include more imagery of the 2018 season before it goes to print and the finished books will be sent to everyone in November 2018.

The perks on offer are 3 x large signed museum quality archival pigment prints, an exclusive 5 x set post card pack and the Violence of Speed book at a reduced rate for the first 150 contributors..........

And last but not least all contributors will get the chance to partake in an online charity auction for the number 1 edition of the book signed by the 12 F1 drivers who contributed their stories.  This auction is not open to the public, only to the campaign contributors.

The proceeds from the auction of the book will be donated to the 'Starlight Children's Foundation' charity- a nonprofit organization which brightens the lives of seriously ill children and their families, by replacing pain, fear and stress with fun, joy and laughter.

THE GOAL

By contributing to the creation of this book, you will help me reach my goal of publishing my work and celebrating the wonderful imagery I have captured with a global audience.

This crowdfunding campaign is entirely dedicated to producing this beautiful photographic book. The goal is to reach the funds necessary in order to produce an edition of 500 copies. 

That's why your help is so important. Thank you!

THE BOOK

The book will be printed as follows:

- Size 300x225mm

-  Hard cover 

-  Approximately of 220-240 pages with 350-400 stunning images of Formula 1  

- Sewn and perfect binding

- Edition of 500 copies 

CAN'T CONTRIBUTE TODAY, DON'T WORRY

If you can't make a donation now you can help in many other ways:

- You can share it on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter

- Spread the word by telling a friend who may be interested

- If you have a magazine, a blog, or a website about photography or Formula 1 just contact me and I will give you more information to share about the project

And finally, thank you for considering my campaign and I hope you love the finished book.
